And yousg see the land still, but when We send down water on it, it shakes and swells[1013] and germinates all kinds of lovely plant. 6 That is because indeed Allah is the Truth, and because indeed He gives life to the dead, and because indeed He is Powerful over everything. 7 And because the Hour is indeed coming—there is no doubt about it—and because indeed Allah resurrects those in the graves. 8 And of mankind is one who argues about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an illuminating scripture, 9 turning aside in contempt, to make (others) stray[1014] from the way of Allah; for him in the Earlier (Life) is disgrace, and on the Day of Resurrection We make him taste the punishment of burning: 10 “That is for what yoursg hands[1015] have put forth, and because Allah is not a tyrant unto the servants.” 11 And of mankind is one who worships Allah on edge, so that if something good befalls him, he is reassured by it; but if a trial befalls him, he turns about-face, losing the Earlier (Life) and the hereafter; that is the evident loss. 12 Apart from Allah, he calls upon what can neither harm him nor benefit him; that is the extreme misguidance. 13 He calls upon one whose harm is closer than his benefit; truly, what a miserable patron, and truly, what a miserable consort. 14 Indeed, Allah enters those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds into Gardens beneath which rivers flow; indeed, Allah does whatever He wants. 15 Whoever has been thinking that Allah will not support him[1016] in the Earlier (Life) and the Hereafter—let him extend a means[1017] to the sky, then cut (it) off, and see whether his plotting eliminates what enrages (him). 16 And thus We sent it down as evident signs[1018], for Allah guides whomever He wants. 17 Indeed, those who have attained faith and those who have Judaized, and the Sabians[1019] and the Christians and the Zoroastrians[1020] and the Polytheists—indeed, Allah judges between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, Allah is witness to everything. 18 Have yousg not seen that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth, and the sun and the moon and the stars and the mountains and the trees and the treading creatures and many of mankind? But many others deserved the punishment. And whomever Allah shames, there is none to honor him. Indeed, Allah does whatever He wills. 19 Here are two adversaries who have disputed regarding their Lord, so those who denied—garments of fire were tailored[1021] for them, with scalding water pouring over their heads, 20 melting their insides and the skins. 21 And for them there are maces of iron; 22 whenever they try to depart it out of anguish, they are driven back into it and (told), “Tastepl the punishment of burning.” 23 Indeed, Allah enters those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they are decorated with bracelets of gold and (with)[1022] pearls, and their garments therein are of silk. 24 And they were guided to the best of words, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy. 25 Indeed, those who have denied and bar (others) from the way of Allah and from the Inviolable Mosque, which We have designated for all mankind equally[1023], (including) the one who consecrates himself therein and the visitor. And whoever wants any blasphemy unjustly therein—We will make him taste of a painful punishment. 26 And recall when We located the House for Abraham: “Do not associate anything with Me, and cleanse My House for the circumambulators and those who stand to pray and those who kneel and prostrate. 27 And announce the pilgrimage to mankind—they will come to yousg on foot and on every lean mount; they will come from every distant pathway, 28 that they may witness benefits for themselves and remember[1024] the name of Allah during the known days[1025] for providing them with livestock animals. So eatpl of it and feed the unfortunate poor. 29 Then let them end their untidiness and let them fulfill their vows and let them circumambulate the Ancient House.” 30 All that. And whoever venerates Allah’s inviolable rites, then it is good for him with his Lord. And livestock have been made lawful to youpl, except what is recited to you. So avoid the abomination of idols and avoid saying falsehood, 31 turning to Allah, away from all that is false, without associating anything with Him. And whoever associates anything with Allah—it is as though he has fallen from the sky so that the birds snatch him or the wind sweeps down with him to a far-off place. 32 All that. And whoever venerates the rituals of Allah—it is indeed out of the hearts’ mindfulness (of God). 33 In them are benefits for youpl for a stated term, then their place (of sacrifice) is towards the Ancient House. 34 And for every community We have appointed a rite, that they may commemorate Allah’s name over the livestock animals which He has provided for them. Thus yourpl God is One God, so to Him submit. And give glad tidings to the humble: 35 those whose hearts tremble when Allah is mentioned, and those who endure patiently what has befallen them, and those who establish the prayer and spend from what We have provided for them. 36 And We have made for youpl the (offering of) fleshy cattle among Allah’s rituals. In them is much good for you, so mention[1026] Allah’s name upon them as they line up. Then when they have fallen to their sides[1027], eat of them and feed the contented and the beggar. Thus We have subjected them to you, that you may give thanks. 37 Never shall their flesh nor their blood reach Allah. Rather, what reaches Him from you is mindfulness (of Him). Thus He has subjected them to you, that you may glorify Allah for guiding you. And give glad tidings to those who excel in doing good. 38 Indeed, Allah defends[1028] those who have attained faith. Indeed, Allah does not love every treacherous staunch denier. 39 Permission has been granted[1029] to those who are combated[1030], because they have been dealt with unjustly—and most surely Allah is Able to give them support: 40 those who have been unjustifiably evicted from their homes merely for saying, “Our Lord is Allah.” And were it not that Allah repels people by means of others, monasteries and churches and synagogues and mosques—where the name of Allah is mentioned frequently—would have been utterly demolished[1031]. And most surely, Allah will support whoever supports Him. Indeed, Allah is certainly All-Powerful, Almighty. 41 Those who, when We give them authority in the land, establish the prayer and bring[1032] the purifying charity[1033] and command to what is fair and forbid what is deplorable. And with Allah rests the outcome of all events. 42 And if they disbelieve yousg—so before them the people of Noah andʻĀd[1034] and Thamud[1035] (also) disbelieved, 43 and the people of Abraham and the people of Lot, 44 and the inhabitants of Midian (as well). And Moses was disbelieved. So I reprieved the deniers then I seized them, so how terrible was My condemnation? 45 So how many a town have We[1036] annihilated while it was unjust, so that it lies devastated upon its trellises, with an abandoned well and a lofty mansion? 46 Have they not journeyed in the land and had hearts to reason with or ears to listen with? Therefore, it is not the sight(s) that go blind, but it is the hearts within the chests that go blind. 47 And they urge yousg to hasten the punishment. But Allah will not break His promise. And indeed, a single day with your Lord is like a thousand years of what youpl count[1037]. 48 And how many a town did I respite while it was unjust? Then I seized it, for to Me is the destiny. 49 Say, “O mankind, indeed, I am only an evident warner to you.” 50 Therefore, those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—for them is forgiveness and noble provision. 51 But those who strove against Our signs[1038] attempting to challenge[1039] (the believers)—those are the fellows of purgatory. 52 And never did We send any messenger before you nor a prophet but when he wished (to guide people) Satan cast (obstacles) to his wish. Yet Allah nullifies what Satan casts, then Allah affirms His signs. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. 53 Thus He makes whatever Satan casts a means of trial for those whose hearts harbor disease and those who are hard-hearted. For the unjust are indeed in profound discord. 54 And let those endowed with knowledge know that it is the truth from your Lord, and believe in it so that their hearts soften to it. And indeed, Allah will guide those who have attained faith to a straight path, 55 while those who have denied continue to be in skepticism about it until the Hour comes upon them suddenly or there comes to them the punishment of a desolate day. 56 Dominion on that day belongs to Allah; He judges between them. Thus those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds are in Gardens of Bliss, 57 while those who have denied and disbelieved Our signs—for those there is a demeaning punishment. 58 And those who emigrated in Allah’s way then were killed or died—Allah will most surely provide them with good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is certainly the Best of providers. 59 He will most surely enter them an entrance that well pleases them. For indeed, Allah is certainly All-Knowing, Clement. 60 All that. And whoever punishes with the like of the punishment he was made to suffer and then he is oppressed (again), Allah will most surely support him. Indeed, Allah is certainly Pardoning, Oft-Forgiving. 61 That is because Allah causes the night to penetrate the day and He causes the day to penetrate the night, and because Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing. 62 That is because Allah is the Truth, and because whatever they[1040] call upon apart from Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the All-High, the Supreme. 63 Have yousg not seen that Allah has sent down water from the sky, then the land becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle, All-Aware. 64 To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. For indeed it is Allah who is certainly the Self-sufficient, the Praiseworthy. 65 Have yousg not seen that Allah has subjected to youpl whatever is in the earth and the ships that sail at sea by His command, and that He holds up (whatever is in) the heaven lest it fall on earth, except by His permission? Allah is indeed truly Compassionate towards mankind, Bestowing of mercy. 66 And it is He who gave youpl life, then makes you die, then revives you. Indeed, man is surely a staunch denier. 67 For every community We have appointed a rite which they observe, so do not let them dispute with yousg in this matter. And do call to your Lord; you are most surely rightly guided upon the straight way. 68 But if they argue with yousg, say, “Allah knows better what youpl do.” 69 Allah judges between you on the Day of Resurrection regarding whatever you used to differ over. 70 Have yousg not come to know that Allah knows whatever is in the heaven and the earth? Indeed, that is in a record[1041]; indeed, that is easy for Allah. 71 Yet they worship, apart from Allah, things for which He sent down[1042] no authority and what they have no knowledge of. And for the unjustpl there is no supporter. 72 And when Our signs[1043] are read to them, evident, yousg recognize deploring (looks) on the faces of those who have denied; they nearly assault those who read to them Our signs. Say “Shall I inform you of something worse than that? The Fire! Allah has promised it to those who have denied—and what a miserable destiny!” 73 O mankind, a parable has been set forth, so listen to it: indeed, those whom you[1044] call upon apart from Allah shall never create a fly, even if they were to band together for that purpose; and if a fly snatches anything from them, they cannot recover it from it. Weak are the pursuer and the pursued. 74 They have not respected Allah with the respect due to Him. Indeed, Allah is certainly All-Powerful, Almighty. 75 Allah elects messengers from among the angels and from among mankind; indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing. 76 He knows what is before them and what is behind them. For to Allah all matters are returned[1045]. 77 O you who have attained faith, kneel and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good (deeds), that you may succeed. 78 And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not imposed upon you any discomfort in religion—the creed of your father Abraham. It is He Who named you Muslims before and in this (Scripture), so that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over mankind. So establish the prayer and bring[1046] the purifying charity[1047] and hold fast to Allah. He is your Patron, so what an excellent Patron and what an excellent Supporter!

23. The Believers

23- Al-Mu’minûn

1 Surely the believers have attained success: 2 those who are reverent in their prayers; 3 and those who disregard idle talk; 4 and those who are observant of the purifying charity[1048]; 5 and those who preserve their private parts, 6 except from their spouses or those whom they rightfully possess—for then they are free from blame. 7 But whoever seeks anything beyond that—those are the transgressors. 8 And those who to their trusts[1049] and their covenant are faithful, 9 and those who preserve their prayers[1050]— 10 those are the ones who are the (true) inheritors 11 who inherit Paradise; therein they abide. 12 And most surely, We created man from an extract of clay; 13 then We made him a sperm-drop, lodged in a secure place; 14 then We developed the sperm-drop into a clinging form, and We developed the clinging form into a morsel-like lump, and We developed the morsel-like lump into bones[1051], and We clothed the bonesd with flesh, then We produced him into another creation. So supremely blessed be Allah, the Best of creators. 15 Then after that youpl are surely bound to die. 16 Then on the Day of Resurrection youpl are bound to be raised. 17 And surely We created above youpl seven (heavenly) roads, and never have We been oblivious of the creation. 18 And We sent down water from the sky in due measure and settled it in the earth, and We are certainly able to take it away. 19 And with it We produced for youpl gardens of palms and grapevines; in them you have abundant fruits, and of them you eat. 20 And a tree springing out of Mount Sinai, germinating oil and seasoning for the eaters. 21 And there is indeed a lesson for youpl in livestock: We give[1052] you to drink from what is in their bellies, and you have many benefits in them, and from them you eat, 22 and on them and on ships you are carried. 23 And most surely We sent Noah to his people, so he said, “O my people, worship Allah; you have no god other than Him. Will you not be mindful (of God)?” 24 So the chiefs of his people, who denied, said, “This is nothing but a human being like youpl, who wants to gain superiority over you. And had Allah willed, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of this among our forefathers of old; 25 he is nothing but a man in whom is madness, so wait for a while and see what happens to him.” 26 He said, “My Lord, support me with what they have disbelieved me about.” 27 So We revealed to him: “Build the ship under Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And when Our command comes and the oven overflows[1053], carry in it of each kind, a (male and female) couple[1054], and your family except those of them against whom the word has already been pronounced. And do not speak to me concerning those who have done injustice; they will surely be drowned. 28 Then, when you and those with you are settled on the ship, say, ‘Praise be to Allah who has delivered us from the unjust people.’ 29 And say, ‘My Lord, land me at a blessed landing-place, for You are the best of those who bring (people) to land.’” 30 Indeed, in that are surely signs, and surely We have always been testing (mankind). 31 Then after them We brought forth another generation, 32 and We sent among them a messenger from themselves: “Worship Allah; youpl have no god other than Him; will you not be mindful (of God)?” 33 And said the chiefs of his people who denied and disbelieved in the meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had indulged in the Earlier Life, “This is nothing but a human being like youpl, who eats what you eat and drinks what you drink. 34 And if you obey a human being like yourselves, then you are bound to lose. 35 Does he promise youpl that when you have died and have become dust and bones you will be brought out? 36 Farfetched, farfetched is what you are promised. 37 There is nothing but our Earlier Life —we die and we live, and we will never be raised. 38 He is nothing but a man who has fabricated lies against Allah, and never will we believe him.” 39 He said, “My Lord, support me with what they have disbelieved me about.” 40 He said, “Soon they will definitely become remorseful.” 41 So the Shout took them away, according to the true (promise), and We turned them into scum. So away with the unjust people. 42 Then after them We brought forth other generations. 43 No community can advance its time, nor can they delay it. 44 Then We sent Our messengers in succession; every time a messenger came to his community, they disbelieved him. So We made them follow one another[1055] and made them history. So away with a people who do not believe. 45 Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and an evident manifestation 46 to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they acted arrogantly and they were a haughty people. 47 So they said, “Are we to believe in two human beings like us while their people are servants to us?” 48 So they disbelieved them both, and thus they became of those who were annihilated. 49 And indeed We gave Moses the Scripture, that they may be guided. 50 And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and We sheltered them in a secure place on a hilltop with a spring. 51 “O messengers, eat of the good foods and do righteousness; indeed, I am All-Knowing of what you do[1056]. 52 For indeed, this community of yours is one community and I am your Lord, so be mindful of Me.” 53 But they tore themselves into sects, each party rejoicing in what they had. 54 So leavesg them in their perplexity for a while. 55 Do they assume that, in supplying them with wealth and children, 56 We hasten to give them the good things? In fact, they are unaware. 57 Indeed, those who, out of awe for their Lord, are fearful, 58 and those who believe in their Lord’s signs, 59 and those who associate none with their Lord, 60 and those who bring whatever they bring while their hearts tremble, knowing that to their Lord they are returning— 61 those are the ones who hasten towards good works, and it is they who will reach it first. 62 And We never task any self beyond its capacity, and with Us is a record[1057] that tells the truth, and they will not be dealt with unjustly. 63 But their hearts are in perplexity as to this, and they have deeds other than that which they are doing, 64 until when We seize the affluent ones among them with punishment, they promptly begin to groan. 65 “Do not groan today; indeed, youpl will not be supported by Us. 66 Surely, My signs[1058] used to be recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels 67 in arrogance regarding it, conversing by night (about it), (yet) deserting[1059] it[1060].” 68 Have they not pondered the Word? Or has there come to them what came not to their forefathers of old? 69 Or is it that they did not recognize their messenger so they disacknowledge him? 70 Or do they say, “He is possessed?” Rather, he has come to them with the truth, but most of them are hateful of the truth. 71 Yet were the Truth to follow their whims, the heavens and the earth and everyone in them would have become corrupted. Rather, We have come up to them with their Reminder, but they keep disregarding their Reminder. 72 Or are yousg asking them for a payment? Rather, your Lord’s payment is better, for He is the best of providers. 73 And indeed, yousg are surely calling them to a straight path, 74 for those who do not believe in the Hereafter are most surely swerving from the path. 75 And were We to have mercy upon them and remove whatever harm is upon them, surely they would continue to wander aimlessly while exceeding all limits. 76 And most surely We gripped them with punishment, but they did not surrender to their Lord, nor do they supplicate (Him) 77 until, when We have opened before them a gate of intense punishment, they suddenly despair. 78 And it is He Who initiated for youpl the hearing and the sight(s) and the burning hearts; scarcely do you give thanks! 79 And it is He Who scattered youpl on earth, and to Him you will be herded. 80 And it is He Who gives life and causes death, and to Him is the alternation of night and day. Do youpl not reason? 81 Rather, they said the like of what the ancients had said. 82 They said, “Can it be that when we have died and become dust and bones, can it be that[1061] we will really be resurrected? 83 Most surely, we were promised this before, we and our forefathers—these are nothing but legends of the ancients.” 84 Saysg, “To whom does the earth and everyone in it belong, if youpl happen to know?” 85 They will say, “To Allah.” Saysg, “Will you never remember[1062]?” 86 Saysg, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?” 87 They will say, “To[1063] Allah.” Saysg, “Will you never be mindful (of God)?” 88 Saysg, “In whose hand is the dominance of everything, and He grants refuge but cannot be granted refuge, if you happen to know?” 89 They will say, “Toa Allah.” Saysg, “Then are you bewitched?” 90 Rather, We have come up to them with the truth, yet they are surely liars. 91 Never has Allah taken any offspring nor has there ever been any god with Him, for then each god would have taken away what he had created, and some of them would have gained supremacy over others. Highly Exalted is Allah, far above what they describe: 92 the Knower[1064] of the hidden realm and the manifest. So Most High is He, far above what they associate (as gods with Him). 93 Saysg, “My Lord, if You would show me what they are promised, 94 my Lord, do not make me among the unjust people.” 95 And We are surely able to show yousg what We promise them. 96 Repelsg what is bad by what is better. We know better what they describe. 97 And saysg, “My Lord, I seek refuge with You from the urgings of the devils, 98 and I seek refuge with You, my Lord, lest they become present with me.” 99 Until, when death comes to one of them, he says, “My Lord, send me back, 100 that I may act righteously in that which I have left (behind).” But no! It is just a word that he says, and behind them is a barrier until the day they are resurrected. 101 So when the Horn is blown, no ties of kinship between them exist on that day, nor do they ask one another. 102 So the one whose scales weigh heavy—those are the successful. 103 And the one whose scales weigh light—those are the ones who have lost themselves; in Hell they abide. 104 The Fire lashes their faces, and therein they grimace. 105 “Were not My signs[1065] recited to youpl, but you used to disbelieve them?” 106 They said[1066], “Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray. 107 Our Lord, bring us out of this, and if we ever return, we would truly be unjust.” 108 He said, “Be despisedpl therein and do not speak to Me. 109 Indeed, there was a group of My servants who used to say, ‘Our Lord, we have attained faith, so forgive us and have mercy on us, and You are the best of the merciful.’ 110 But youpl made them a target of ridicule until they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them. 111 Today I have indeed rewarded them for what they endured patiently, for it[1067] is they who are the triumphant ones.” 112 He said[1068], “How long did you remain on earth in terms of number of years?” 113 They said, “We remained a day or part of a day, so ask those who keep count.” 114 He said[1069], “Youpl remained but for a little while, if you only knew. 115 Did youpl think that We had created you in vain, and that to Us you would not be returned[1070]?” 116 Rather, Most High is Allah, the True King; there is no god but He, the Lord of the Noble Throne. 117 And whoever calls upon another god with Allah—he has no proof thereof—his reckoning rests with his Lord; indeed, the deniers never succeed. 118 And saysg, “My Lord, forgive and have mercy, for You are the best of the merciful.”

24. The Light

24- An-Nûr

 1 A surah[1071] that We have sent down and ordained[1072] and sent down in it evident signs[1073], that you may remind yourselves[1074]. 2 The fornicating woman and the fornicating man—whip each one of them a hundred lashes and let no compassion towards them keep youpl from carrying out Allah’s religion, if you (truly) believe in Allah and the Last Day, and let their punishment be witnessed by a group[1075] of believers. 3 The fornicating man marries none but a fornicating woman or an idolatress, and the fornicating woman marries none but a fornicating man or an idolater, and that has been prohibited for the believers. 4 And those who accuse chaste women then cannot bring four witnesses—whippl them eighty lashes and do not ever accept their testimony, for those are the defiantly disobedient— 5 except for those who have repented afterwards and reformed, for indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 6 And those who accuse their own spouses but have no witnesses except themselves, then let the testimony of one of them be four oaths[1076] by Allah that he is surely of the truthful. 7 And the fifth is: may[1077] Allah’s curse indeed be upon him if he is of the liars. 8 But what averts punishment from her is that she testifies under oath four times by Allah that he is surely of the liars, 9 while[1078] the fifth is: may Allah’s wrath indeed be upon her if he is of the truthful. 10 And were it not for Allah’s grace upon youpl, and His mercy, and that Allah is the Granter and Accepter of repentance, All-Wise. . .[1079] 11 Indeed, those who produced the fabrication are a band of you. Do not consider it bad for youpl; rather, it is good for you. For each person of them is whatever sin he has earned, yet the one who played the major role—for him is a great punishment. 12 If only when youpl heard it, the believing men and the believing women had thought well of themselves[1080] and said, “This is an evident fabrication!” 13 If only they had produced four witnesses against it. Yet since they did not come up with the witnesses, then before Allah they are the liars. 14 And were it not for Allah’s grace upon youpl, and His mercy in the Earlier (Life) and the Hereafter, you would have been touched by a great punishment for what you have ventured into. 15 Recall receiving it with your tongues and saying with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, and considering it trivial while with Allah it is greatly serious. 16 And if only when youpl heard it you had said, “It is not lawful for us to speak about this. Highly Exalted are You; this is a great slander.” 17 Allah admonishes you never to return to the like of it if you are believers. 18 And Allah clarifies the signs to youpl, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. 19 Indeed, those who love that obscenity should spread among the believers—for them is a painful punishment in the Earlier (Life) and the Hereafter, for Allah knows while you know not. 20 And were it not for Allah’s grace upon youpl, and His mercy, and that Allah is Compassionate, Bestowing of mercy. . .[1081] 21 O you who have attained faith, do not follow Satan’s footsteps, for whoever follows Satan’s footsteps (should know that) indeed he commands to obscenity and what is deplorable. And were it not for Allah’s grace towards you, and His mercy, not one of you would ever have been purified, ever, but Allah purifies whomever He wills. For Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. 22 And let not the ones endowed with grace and affluence swear not to give to the near relatives and the destitutepl and the emigrants in the way of Allah, and let them pardon and let them overlook. Do youpl not love that Allah should forgive you? For Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 23 Those who accuse chaste, unwary, believing women are indeed cursed in the Earlier (Life) and the Hereafter, and for them is a great punishment 24 on the day when their tongues and their hands and their feet testify against them regarding what they used to do. 25 On that day, Allah pays them their true recompense in full, and they learn that it is Allah who is the Evident Truth. 26 Nasty[1082] ones are for nasty men, and nasty men are for nasty ones, and good ones are for good men, and good men are for good ones. Those are acquitted of what they say; for them is forgiveness and a noble provision. 27 O you who have attained faith, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you announce your presence and greet their inhabitants with the greeting of peace. That is better for you, that you may remind yourselves. 28 But if youpl find no one in them, then do not enter them until you are given permission. And if it is said to you, “Turn back,” then turn back; it is purer for you, for Allah is All-Knowing of what you do. 29 Youpl commit no sin by entering uninhabited houses in which there is convenience for you, for Allah knows whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal. 30 Tellsg the believing men to restrain their sight(s)[1083] and to preserve their private parts; that is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is All-Aware of what they do. 31 And tellsg the believing women to restrain their sight(s) and to preserve their private parts, and not display their adornment except what is apparent thereof, and to draw their head coverings over their bosoms and not display their adornment except to their husbands, or their fathers, or their husbands’ fathers, or their sons, or their husbands’ sons, or their brothers, or their brothers’ sons, or their sisters’ sons, or their womenfolk, or those whom they rightfully possess, or their male attendants who have no (sexual) urge, or children who are not yet aware of women’s privacies, and they should not strike their feet to draw attention to their hidden adornment. Thus repent to Allah, all of you, O believers, that you may succeed. 32 And marry the singles among you and those who are fit among your bondmen and bondwomen. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them from His grace. For Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing. 33 And let those who do not find the means to marry remain chaste until Allah enriches them from His grace. And if any of those whom youpl rightfully possess desire an (emancipation) agreement, write an agreement with them if you recognize some good in them, and give them of Allah’s wealth which He has given you. And do not compel your maids to prostitution, seeking the materials of the Earlier (Life), if they want to remain chaste. But should anyone compel them—then after their compulsion, Allah is indeed Oft-Forgiving[1084], Bestowing of mercy. 34 And We have most surely sent down to youpl clarifying[1085] signs and a parable from those who passed on before you[1086], and an admonition for the ones who were mindful (of God). 35 Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His light is as a niche wherein is a lamp; the lamp is in a glass; the glass is like a glittering planet, kindled[1087] from a blessed tree—an olive tree—neither eastern nor western. Its oil would almost illuminate even if no fire were to touch it. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whomever He wills. Thus Allah sets forth parables for mankind. For Allah is All-Knowing of everything. 36 (Such light shines) in houses which Allah has permitted to be raised up and in which His name is remembered. Highly exalting[1088] Him therein, mornings and before sunset, 37 are men whom neither bargain nor sale distracts from Allah’s remembrance or from establishing the prayers or from bringing[1089] the purifying charity[1090], fearing a day when hearts and sight(s) are overturned, 38 (in the hope) that Allah may repay them according to the best of what they have done and increase them from His grace. For Allah provides for whomever He wills without measure. 39 But those who have denied—their deeds are like a mirage in a desert: the thirsty one thinks it is water until when he has reached it he finds it to be nothing, but there he finds Allah, Who settles his account in full. For Allah is Swift in reckoning. 40 Or (they are) like darkness(es)[1091] in an abysmal sea, covered by waves, above which are waves, above which are clouds—darkness(es)[1092], one upon the other. If one holds out his hand, he can hardly see it. For whomever Allah has not granted a light has no light. 41 Have yousg not seen how Allah is highly exalted by whoever is in the heavens and the earth and by the birds outstretching their wings, each having come to know its (way of) prayer and exaltation? And Allah is All-Knowing of what they do. 42 For to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the destiny. 43 Have you not seen how Allah propels clouds, then brings them together, then piles them up in heaps so you see rainfall coming out of its midst? And He sends down[1093] from the sky—from mountains in it— some hail, striking with it whomever He wills and diverting it from whomever He wills? The flash of its lightening almost does away with the sight(s). 44 Allah alternates night and day. Indeed, in that is a lesson for those endowed with sight(s). 45 And Allah created[1094] every treading creature from water, so of them is one (kind) that treads upon its belly, and one (kind) that treads upon two legs, and one (kind) that treads upon four; Allah creates whatever He wills; Allah is indeed Powerful over everything. 46 Most surely, We have sent down clarifying[1095] signs[1096], and Allah guides whomever He wills to a straight path. 47 And they say, “We have attained faith in Allah and in the Messenger, and we have obeyed.” Then a group of them turn away afterwards, for in no way are those ever believers. 48 And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger in order to judge[1097] between them, a group of them promptly disregards (it); 49 but if the truth is in their favor, they come to Him in obedience. 50 Is there sickness in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah may oppress them, or (that) His Messenger (may do so)? In fact, they themselves are the unjust. 51 However, the response of the believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger in order to judgec between them has always been to say, “We have heard and obeyed”, for those are the successful. 52 And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is mindful of Him—then it is those who are the triumphant ones. 53 And they swore by Allah their most solemn oaths that if yousg commanded them, they would set out. Saysg, “Dopl not swear; (your) obedience is well-known[1098]. Allah is indeed All-Aware of what you do.” 54 Saysg, “Obeypl Allah and obey the Messenger.” But if youpl turn away, then he[1099] is only responsible for what (duty) he is made to carry, and youpl are responsible for whatever (duty) you are made to carry. For if you obey him, you will be guided, while the only responsibility of the Messenger is evident proclamation. 55 Allah has promised those of you who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds that He will most surely make them successors in the land as He made those before them successors[1100] (of others), and that He will most surely establish for them their religion which He has approved for them, and that He will most surely substitute security in place of their fear—as they worship Me[1101], never associating anything with Me. But whoever denies after that—those are the defiantly disobedient. 56 And establishpl the prayer and bring[1102] the purifying charity[1103] and obey the Messenger, that you may be granted mercy. 57 Never thinksg that[1104] those who have denied can thwart (God) on earth. For their shelter is the Fire, and indeed, what a miserable destiny! 58 O you who have attained faith, let those whom you rightfully possess and those of you who have not reached puberty seek your permission[1105] (before entering) on three occasions: before the dawn prayer and at noon when you lay aside your clothes and after the evening prayer—three occasions of privacy for you. At other times, neither you nor they commit sin by intermingling with one another; Allah thus clarifies the signs for you. For Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. 59 And when the children among you reach puberty, let them seek permission as those before them have sought permission; Allah thus clarifies His signs for you. For Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. 60 And elderly women who do not expect (to be desired in) marriage—they commit no sin by taking off their outer clothing without flaunting their adornment, but to maintain modesty is better for them. For Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. 61 There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the lame, nor any blame on the sick, nor on yourselves for eating at your houses , or your fathers’ houses, or your mothers’ houses, or your brothers’ houses, or your sisters’ houses, or the houses of your paternal uncles, or the houses of your paternal aunts, or the houses of your maternal uncles, or the houses of your maternal aunts, or those whose keys you own, or that of a friend of yours. You commit no sin by eating together or separately. But when you enter such houses, greet yourselves with a greeting from Allah, blessed (and) good; Allah thus explains the signs for you, that you may reason. 62 Indeed, the believers are but those who have attained faith in Allah and His Messenger and, when they are with him for a matter of common interest, they do not leave until they have sought his permission. Indeed, those who seek yoursg permission—those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So if they seek your permission to attend to some affair of theirs, give permission to any of them you wish and seek Allah’s forgiveness for them; indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 63 Do not make the calling of the Messenger among yourselves like your calling of one another. Allah certainly knows those[1106] among you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those who oppose his command beware, lest a trial afflict them or a painful punishment afflict them. 64 Undoubtedly, to Allah does belong whatever is in the heavens and the earth; surely, He knows yourpl condition. And on the day they are returned[1107] to Him, He informs them of what they did. For Allah is All-Knowing of everything.

25. The Criterion

25- Al-Furqân

1 Supremely Blessed be the One Who bestowed the Criterion from on high upon His servant, to be a warner[1108] to all realms. 2 The One to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and Who has not taken for Himself any offspring nor has He any associate in the dominion, and He has created everything and determined its measure. 3 And they have taken apart from Him gods who do not create anything, but are themselves created, and who possess for themselves neither harm nor benefit, and have no power over life or death or resurrection. 4 Moreover, those who have denied said, “This is nothing but a fabrication that he has forged, while other people have helped him with it.” They have certainly come forth with injustice and falsehood. 5 And they said, “Legends of the ancients that he has sought to be written down; thus they are dictated to him morning and evening.” 6 Saysg, “It was sent down by the One Who knows the Secret in the heavens and the earth; indeed, He has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.” 7 And they said, “What sort of messenger is this who eats food and walks in marketplaces? If only an angel had been sent down to him to be a warner alongside him, 8 or if a treasure were to be cast to him, or if he had a garden from which he eats[1109].” And the unjust ones said, “Youpl are only following a bewitched man.” 9 Looksg how they have set forth parables for you and gone astray, so they cannot find a way. 10 Supremely Blessed be the One Who, if He so willed, would provide yousg with better than that—Gardens beneath which rivers flow—and make[1110] for you palaces. 11 Rather, they have considered the Hour to be a lie, and We have prepared a blaze for those who have disbelieved in the Hour. 12 When it sees them from a distant place, they hear its raging and roaring. 13 And when they are cast, shackled, into a tight place therein, there they plead for demise. 14 “Do not callpl for one demise today, but call for many demises.” 15 Saysg, “Is that better or the Garden of Eternity promised to the ones who were mindful (of God)? For them it has always been a repayment and a destiny. 16 They have therein whatever they desire, as they abide. That has always been yoursg Lord’s promise, (worthy) to be requested. 17 And on the day when He[1111] herds them and what they worship apart from Allah, then He says[1112], “Was it youpl who misguided these servants of Mine, or was it they who strayed from the way?” 18 They said[1113], “Highly Exalted are You. We should not have taken any[1114] masters apart from You. But you allowed them to enjoy, as well as their fathers, until they forgot the Reminder and became a ruined people.” 19 Thus they[1115] have certainly disbelieved youpl regarding what you say, so you[1116] can neither avoid (punishment) nor get any support. And whoever of you commits injustice, We will make him taste a supreme punishment. 20 And never did We send any emissaries before yousg but they used to eat food and walk in the marketplaces. And We made some of you a means of trial for others—will you be patient? And your Lord has always been All-Seeing. 21 And those who do not expect to meet Us said, “If only the angels were sent down to us or we could see our Lord.” They have acted arrogantly regarding themselves and have become excessively defiant. 22 On the day when they see the angels—no glad tidings for the criminals on that day, and they[1117] say, “an insurmountable separator[1118].” 23 And We proceeded[1119] to the work they had done and turned them into scattered dust. 24 The fellows of the Garden (of Paradise) on that day have a better residence and are more fairly accommodated. 25 And it is the day when the sky is cleft with clouds and the angels werec sent down[1120] in streams. 26 Dominion on that day belongs to the All-Merciful, and it has been a difficult day for the deniers. 27 And it is the day when the unjust bites his hands, saying, “If only I had followed the way with the Messenger. 28 Woe to me! I wish I had not taken so-and-so for a close friend; 29 he definitely made me stray away from the Reminder after it had come to me.” And Satan has always been a betrayer of man.” 30 And the Messenger saidc, “O My Lord, my people have dealt with this Recital[1121] by deserting it.” 31 Likewise, to every prophet We assigned enemies from among the criminals. But sufficient is yoursg Lord as a Guide and Supporter. 32 And those who denied said, “If only the Recitale had been sent down upon him as one complete whole!” Yet (it is sent in this way) in order to strengthen your heart thereby, and We (revealed it to be) chanted slowly and distinctly. 33 And whatever similitude they come to yousg with, We provide you with the truth and a better exposition. 34 Those who are herded to Hell on their faces—those are in a worse position and further astray from the way. 35 And surely We gave Moses the Scripture and appointed his brother Aaron as an assistant, 36 then We said, “Godl to the people who have disbelieved Our signs,” then We destroyed them completely. 37 And when the people of Noah disbelieved the messengers, We drowned them and made them a sign for mankind. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the unjust, 38 and (for)ʻĀd[1122] and Thamûd[1123] and the fellows of Al-Russ[1124] and many generations in between. 39 Thus to each We set forth parables, and each We devastated utterly. 40 And indeed they have already come across the city[1125] upon which was rained the woeful rain. Have they not seen it then? Rather, they did not expect any resurrection. 41 And when they see yousg, they take you not except in ridicule: “Is this the one Allah has sent as a messenger? 42 He was about to make us stray away from our gods, had we not patiently adhered to them.” And they will eventually know, when they witness the punishment, who is further astray from the way. 43 Have yousg seen the one who took his own whim as his god? Would you be a trustee for him? 44 Or do yousg assume that most of them hear or reason? They are but like livestock; rather, they are even further astray from the way. 45 Have yousg not seen how your Lord extended the shade? And had He willed, He could have made it still. Then We made the sun a guide to it. 46 Then We drew it to Us easily. 47 And it is He Who made the night for youpl as a garment and sleep for repose, and made the day a (time of) resurrection. 48 And it is He Who sent the winds[1126] as heralds of glad tidings[1127] ahead of His mercy. And We[1128] sent down from the sky pure water 49 to revive a lifeless land thereby, and to provide drink for a multitude of animals and humans We have created. 50 And most surely We have circulated it among them, that they may constantly remember[1129], yet most of mankind refused anything but constant denial. 51 And had We willed, We could have sent to every town a warner. 52 So do not obeysg the deniers, but strive against them with it[1130] a supreme striving. 53 And it is He Who merged the two seas, this one fresh and sweet and this one salty and bitter, and He made between them a barrier and an insurmountable separator. 54 And it is He Who created of water a human being, then made him related by lineage and marriage. And yoursg Lord has always been All-Able. 55 Yet they worship, apart from Allah, what neither benefits them nor harms them. And the denier has always been a backup against his Lord. 56 And We have not sent you but as a bearer of glad tidings and as a warner. 57 Saysg, “I ask of you no reward for this—only that whoever wills may take a way to his Lord.” 58 And place yoursg trust in the Ever-Living One Who never dies, and exalt Him with praise. And sufficient is He as the All-Aware of the misdeeds of His servants. 59 The One Who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days[1131] then settled on the Throne. The All-Merciful. So ask about Him one (who is) well aware. 60 And when it is said to them, “Prostrate yourselves to the All-Merciful,” they say, “And what is the All-Merciful? Shall we prostrate ourselves to what you command[1132] us?” And it increases their aversion. 61 Supremely Blessed be the One Who placed constellations in the sky and placed in it a lamp[1133] and an illuminating moon. 62 And it is He Who made the night and the day alternate—for whoever wants to constantly remember[1134] or wants to give constant thanks. 63 And the servants of the All-Merciful are those who walk the earth gently[1135], and when the ignorant harassers address them, they say, “Peace.” 64 And they are those who spend the night prostrating themselves to their Lord and standing (in prayer). 65 And they are those who say, ‘‘Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell; indeed, its suffering has been ever adhering; 66 it is indeed bad as a residence and dwelling place.” 67 And they are those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor stingy, for the upright method has always been between both. 68 And they are those who do not call upon any other god with Allah and do not kill the self which Allah has made inviolable—except in the pursuit of justice—and do not fornicate. And whoever does that encounters penalties. 69 The punishment is doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he abides therein humiliated— 70 except for whoever has repented and has attained faith and has done righteous work, for those—Allah replaces their evil deeds with good deeds. And Allah has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 71 And whoever has repented and has acted righteously, then surely he repents to Allah a true repentance. 72 And they are those who do not bear false witness, and when they come across idle talk, they pass by with dignity. 73 And they are those who, when reminded of the signs[1136] of their Lord, do not fall before them deaf and blind. 74 And they are those who say, “Our Lord, grant us in our spouses and our offspring(s)[1137] a comfort to the eyes, and make us a good example of the ones who were mindful (of God).” 75 Those are awarded the Chamber (in Heaven) for their patience, and are received[1138] therein with greetings and peace, 76 abiding therein—an excellent residence and dwelling place. 77 Saysg, “What are youpl to my Lord without your calling upon Him? But you have certainly disbelieved, so the inevitable is bound to come.”

26. The Poets

26- Ash-Shu‘arâ’

1 Tâ Sîn Mīm. 2 Those are the signs of the Evident Scripture. 3 Perhaps yousg are going to destroy yourself with sorrow because they do not believe? 4 If We will, We can bestow[1139] upon them a sign from heaven, at which their necks would stay bent in humility. 5 But no fresh reminder comes to them from the All-Merciful but they disregard it. 6 Thus they have certainly disbelieved, but soon will come to them the tidings of what they used to ridicule. 7 Have they not seen the land— how many noble kinds of plants We have germinated therein? 8 Indeed, in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 9 And indeed, it is yoursg Lord who is surely the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 10 And recall when Your Lord called to Moses, “Go to the unjust people— 11 the people of Pharaoh. Will they never be mindful?” 12 He said, “My Lord, I fear that they will disbelieve me. 13 And my chest tightens[1140] and my tongue is not fluent, so send for Aaron (too). 14 And they hold (a charge of) a misdeed against me, so I fear they will kill me.” 15 He said, “By no means! So godl, with Our signs; We are with youpl, listening. 16 So godl to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are indeed the Messenger of the Lord of all realms: 17 send the Children of Israel with us.’” 18 He said, “Did we not raise yousg among us as a child, and you stayed among us for many years of your life? 19 And yousg committed that base deed of yours that you committed while you were one of the deniers[1141].” 20 He said, “I did it then while I was one of those astray. 21 And I fled from youpl when I feared you, then my Lord gave me wise judgment and made me one of the emissaries. 22 And is that a favor yousg remind me of: that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?” 23 Pharaoh said, “And what is the Lord of all realms?” 24 He said, “The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, if youpl (can ever) believe with certitude.” 25 He said to those around him, “Are you listening?” 26 He said, “Yourpl Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers.” 27 He said, “This messenger of yours who has been sent to you is certainly a madman.” 28 He said, “The Lord of the east and the west and whatever is between them, if youpl can (ever) reason.” 29 He said, “If yousg accept any god other than me, I will surely make you of the imprisoned.” 30 He said, “What if I bring yousg something evident?” 31 He said, “Bring it, if yousg are of the truthful.” 32 So he cast his staff and thereupon it was an evident serpent. 33 And he pulled his hand and thereupon it was white for the beholders. 34 He said to the chiefs around him, “This is indeed a knowledgeable sorcerer 35 who wants to evict you from your land with his sorcery, so what do you command?” 36 They said, “Put him off, and his brother, and send summoners to the cities 37 to bring yousg every knowledgeable magician.” 38 So the sorcerers were assembled for the appointment on a specified day. 39 And people were told, “Are you going to assemble, 40 that we may follow the sorcerers if they are the overcomers?” 41 So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Pharaoh, “Is there a reward for us if we are the overcomers?” 42 He said, “Yes, and you will then most surely become of those brought near (to me).” 43 Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you intend to cast.” 44 So they cast their ropes and their staffs and said, “By Pharaoh’s might, we are most surely the overcomers.” 45 Then Moses threw his staff, and thereupon it swallowed what they had fabricated. 46 So the sorcerers fell down prostrating. 47 They said, “We have attained faith in the Lord of all realms, 48 the Lord of Moses and Aaron.” 49 He said, “Have youpl believed in him before I have given you permission? He must be your leader who taught you sorcery. Well, you will certainly know soon; I will most surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will most surely crucify you all.” 50 They said, “No problem; indeed, to our Lord we are returning. 51 We ardently hope our Lord will forgive us our offenses, as we were the first of the believers.” 52 And We revealed to Moses: “Journey with My servants by night; youpl will indeed be followed.” 53 So Pharaoh sent summoners to the cities. 54 “Indeed, these are just a small gang, 55 and they certainly do enrage us. 56 But indeed, we are cautious[1142].” 57 So We got them out from gardens and springs 58 and treasures and a noble domicile. 59 So it was. And We made the Children of Israel inherit them. 60 And they pursued them at sunrise.  61 And when the two groups sighted each other, the followers of Moses said, “We are indeed overtaken!” 62 He said, “By no means! My Lord is indeed with me; He will guide me.” 63 So We revealed to Moses: “Strike the sea with your staff,” whereupon it split, so that each part was like a great hill. 64 And thereupon, we brought the others near. 65 Then We saved Moses and those with him, all of them. 66 Then We drowned the others. 67 Most surely in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 68 And most surely, yoursg Lord is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 69 And relate to them the tiding of Abraham, 70 when he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?” 71 They said, “We worship human-shaped idols and we remain consecrating ourselves to them.”  72 He said, “Can they hear youpl when you call? 73 Or can they benefit you, or can they do harm?” 74 They said, “Rather, we found our forefathers doing so.” 75 He said, “Have you seen what you have been worshiping, 76 you and your ancient fathers? 77 They are enemies to me, except for the Lord of all realms, 78 Who created me and therefore He guides me; 79 and Who feeds me and gives me to drink; 80 and when I get sick, He heals me; 81 and Who makes me die and then revives me; 82 and Whom I ardently hope will forgive me my offense on the Day of Recompense.” 83 “My Lord, grant me wise judgment and include me with the righteous, 84 and make me a reputation of truth among later generations, 85 and make me of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss, 86 and forgive my father—he was indeed one of those astray, 87 and do not disgrace me on the day they are resurrected: 88 the day when neither wealth nor children are of help— 89 except for one who has come[1143] to Allah with a sound heart.” 90 And the Garden (of Paradise) was brought near for those who had been mindful, 91 while purgatory was displayed to the deluded ones. 92 And they were told, “Where is what you used to worship 93 apart from Allah? Can they support you or get support for themselves?” 94 Then they were toppled into it, together with the deluded ones 95 and the troops of Iblis[1144], all of them. 96 They said, as they disputed about it, 97 “(We swear) by Allah, we were surely in evident misguidance 98 for equating youpl with the Lord of all realms. 99 But no one misguided us except the criminals. 100 And now we neither have intercessors 101 nor any intimate friend. 102 So if only we could have another chance, we would be of the believers.” 103 Most surely in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 104 And most surely, yoursg Lord is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 105 The people of Noah disbelieved the emissaries 106 when their brother Noah said to them, “Will you never be mindful? 107 Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. 108 So be mindful of Allah and obey me. 109 And I ask of you no reward for this, for my reward is only from the Lord of all realms. 110 So be mindful of Allah and obey me.” 111 They said, “Shall we believe in you, when (only) the lowliest have followed you[1145]?” 112 He said, “What do I know about what they used to do? 113 Their reckoning rests only with my Lord, if only you were aware. 114 And in no way would I expel the believers; 115 I am only an evident warner.” 116 They said, “If you do not refrain, O Noah, you will most surely be of those stoned.” 117 He said, “My Lord, my people have disbelieved me. 118 So legislate between me and them decisively, and deliver me and those who are with me of the believers. 119 So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship. 120 Then We drowned the rest. 121 Most surely in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 122 And most surely, yoursg Lord is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 123ʻĀd[1146] disbelieved the emissaries 124 when their brother Hûd said to them, “Will you never be mindful? 125 Indeed, I am to youpl a trustworthy messenger. 126 So be mindful of Allah and obey me. 127 And I ask of you no reward for this, for my reward is only from the Lord of all realms. 128 Do you build a sign on every height for vanity’s sake? 129 And you set up fortresses, hoping to live eternally? 130 And when youpl strike, you strike mercilessly? 131 So be mindful of Allah and obey me. 132 And be mindful of the One Who supplied you with whatever you know. 133 He supplied you with livestock and children 134 and gardens and springs. 135 Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great day.” 136 They said, “It is equal to us, whether you admonish or be not of those who admonish. 137 This is nothing but the character[1147] of the ancients, 138 and we will never be punished.” 139 So they disbelieved him; thus We annihilated them. Most surely in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 140 And most surely, Yoursg Lord is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 141 Thamûd[1148] disbelieved the emissaries 142 when their brother Salih said to them, “Will you never be mindful? 143 Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. 144 So be mindful of Allah and obey me. 145 And I ask of you no reward for this, for my reward is only from the Lord of all realms. 146 Will you (always) be left secure in whatever is here? 147 In gardens and springs 148 and vegetation(s), and palm-trees with tender yield? 149 And you carve houses in the mountains, with skill[1149]? 150 So be mindful of Allah and obey me. 151 And do not obey the command of the extremists: 152 those who spread corruption in the land and do not reform.” 153 They said, “You are surely one of the bewitched; 154 you are nothing but a human being like us, so bring us a sign if you are of the truthful.” 155 He said, “This is a she-camel; she has her turn to drink, and you have your turn to drink on a well-known day. 156 And do not touch her with any harm, lest the punishment of a great day seize you.” 157 But they hamstrung her, then became remorseful[1150]. 158 So the punishment seized them. Most surely in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 159 And most surely, yoursg Lord is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 160 The people of Lot disbelieved the emissaries 161 when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you never be mindful? 162 Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. 163 So be mindful of Allah and obey me. 164 And I ask of you no reward for this, for my reward is only from the Lord of all realms. 165 Of all the creatures in all realms, do youpl approach males? 166 And you leave what your Lord has created for you of spouses? Rather, you are a people who have transgressed.” 167 They said, “Unless you refrain, O Lot, you will most surely be of those evicted.” 168 He said, “I am certainly one of those who abhor your practice.” 169 “My Lord, deliver me and my family from what they practice.” 170 So We delivered him and his family, all of them, 171 except for an old woman among those who lingered behind. 172 Then We destroyed the others. 173 And We rained down upon them a rain, so how bad was the rain of those forewarned! 174 Most surely in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 175 And most surely, yoursg Lord is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 176 The Fellows of the Thicket disbelieved the emissaries 177 when Shu’aib said to them, “Will you never be mindful? 178 Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. 179 So be mindful of Allah and obey me. 180 And I ask of you no reward for this, for my reward is only from the Lord of all realms. 181 Give full measure and do not be of the cheaters, 182 and weigh with accurate scales 183 and do not defraud people of their belongings, and do not go wickedly about the land, corrupting it. 184 And be mindful of the One Who created youpl and the masses of old.” 185 They said, “You are surely one of the bewitched. 186 And you are nothing but a human being like us, and we think that you are surely of the liars. 187 So make pieces[1151] from heaven fall on us, if you are of the truthful.” 188 He said, “My Lord knows better what you do.” 189 But they disbelieved him, so the punishment of the Day of Gloom seized them; it was indeed the punishment of a great day. 190 Most surely in that is a sign, and in no way were most of them believers. 191 And most surely, yoursg Lord is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 192 And most surely, it is a bestowal from on high from the Lord of all realms. 193 The Trustworthy Spirit came down with it[1152] 194 upon yoursg heart, that you may be of the forewarners, 195 in an evident Arabic tongue. 196 And it is in the books of the ancients. 197 Is it not a sign for them that the scholars of the Children of Israel recognized it? 198 And had We bestowed it from on high upon some non-Arabs 199 and he had recited it to them, they would still not have believed in it. 200 Thus We inserted it into the hearts of the criminals. 201 They will not believe in it until they witness the painful punishment 202 which will come to them suddenly while they are unaware. 203 Then they will say, “Will we be reprieved?” 204 So do they seek to hasten Our punishment? 205 So have yousg seen if We let them enjoy (life) for (many) years, 206 then there comes to them what they were promised, 207 of what avail to them will their past enjoyments be? 208 And never did We destroy a town but it had forewarners— 209 a reminding, and in no way have We been unjust. 210 And in no way have the devils been descending with it, 211 for it neither suits them nor is it in their power. 212 They are indeed barred from hearing (it). 213 So do not call upon any other god with Allah, lest yousg be of those punished. 214 And warn yoursg close kinsfolk, 215 and lower your wing[1153] for those of the believers who have followed you. 216 But if they disobey you, say, “I am indeed innocent of what you do.” 217 And[1154] place your trust in the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy, 218 Who sees you when you rise, 219 as well as your movement among those who prostrate; 220 indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. 221 Shall I inform youpl upon whom the devils keep descending? 222 They keep descending upon every sinful fabricator. 223 They give ear, and most of them are liars. 224 And as for the poets—the deluded ones follow them. 225 Have yousg not seen that they aimlessly roam in every valley? 226 And that they say what they do not do? 227 Except for those who attained faith and did righteous deeds and remembered Allah frequently and defended themselves after they had been dealt with unjustly. And those who have been unjust will know the place of return to which they are bound to return.

27. The Ants

27- An-Naml

1 Tâ Sîn. Those are the signs[1155] of the Recital[1156] and an Evident Scripture— 2 guidance and glad tidings for the believers 3 who establish the prayer and bring[1157] the purifying charity[1158] and, of the Hereafter, they are certain. 4 Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter—We have adorned their deeds for them, so they wander aimlessly; 5 those are the ones for whom is the worst punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the biggest losers. 6 And indeed, yousg are surely receiving the Recitalb from One who is All-Wise, All-Knowing. 7 Recall when Moses said to his family, “I have surely glimpsed a fire. I will bring you some news from it, or bring you a firebrand, a borrowed flame[1159], that you may warm yourselves.” 8 Then when he reached it, he was called: “Blessed is whoever is in the fire and whoever is around it, and Highly Exalted is Allah, Lord of all realms. 9 O Moses, it is indeed I, Allah, the Almighty, the All-Wise. 10 Now, cast your staff.” So when he saw it shaking as though it were a snake, he turned away, fleeing, and did not look back. “O Moses, fear not! Truly, in My presence emissaries have nothing to fear, 11 except for one who did an injustice then substituted kindness for evil—then I am surely Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 12 And put your hand inside the opening of your garment (and) it will come out white, without any evil affliction—among nine signs to Pharaoh and his people; they have indeed been a defiantly disobedient people.” 13 So when Our signs came to them as an eye-opener, they said, “This is evident sorcery.” 14 And they repudiated them, though their (inner) selves were certain of them—out of injustice and haughtiness; so looksg what the outcome was for the corrupters. 15 And indeed, We brought David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, “Praise be to Allah, Who has favored us over many of His believing servants.” 16 And Solomon succeeded David, and he said, “O mankind, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given of everything; this is most surely the evident grace.” 17 And to the service of Solomon were herded his troops of unseen beings[1160] and men and birds, all held in strict order, 18 until, when they came upon the valley of ants, an ant said, “O you ants! Enter into your homes, lest Solomon and his troops crush you while they are unaware.” 19 So he smiled, laughing at her speech, and said, “My Lord, direct me to be thankful for Your blessings which you have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to do righteousness that well pleases You. And include me, by Your mercy, among Your righteous servants.” 20 Then he inspected the birds and said, “What is it with me? Can I not see the hoopoe, or is he among the absentees? 21 Most surely, I will either punish him severely or slay him, unless he brings me an evident excuse.” 22 But he did not stay away for long and he said, “I have encompassed that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with sure tidings. 23 I found a woman reigning over them, and she has been given of everything, and she has a great throne. 24 I found her and her people prostrating to the sun apart from Allah, for Satan has adorned their deeds for them and has thus barred them from the way, so that they are not guided— 25 that they do not[1161] prostrate themselves to Allah, Who brings out what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows whatever you[1162] hide and whatever you make public. 26 Allah—there is no god but He, Lord of the Great Throne.” 27 He said, “We will see whether you have spoken the truth or have been one of the liars. 28 Go with this letter of mine and cast it to them, then turn away from them and wait to see what they say to each other.” 29 She said, “O chiefs, a noble letter has indeed been cast down to me; 30 it is indeed from Solomon, and it is indeed, ‘In the name of Allah, the All-Merciful, the Bestower of mercy: 31 You must not exalt yourselves above me and must come to me as Muslims[1163].’” 32 She said, “O chiefs, give me your opinion in this matter of mine. I never take a decision on any matter except in your presence.” 33 They said, “We are a people of power and of intense force, and you are in command, so see what you wish to command.” 34 She said, “Indeed, when kings enter a town, they corrupt it and humiliate its dignified people, and this is what they (always) do. 35 Thus I am sending them a gift and will see what the emissaries return with.” 36 So when he came to Solomon, he said, “Are youpl supplying me with wealth? What Allah has brought me is better than what He has brought you. Rather, it is you who rejoice when given gifts. 37 Returnsg back to them. Indeed, we will come upon them with troops they cannot resist, and indeed, we will evict them from it, humiliated and dishonored.” 38 He said, “O chiefs, which one of you can bring me her throne before they come to me as Muslims[1164]?” 39 A powerful one of the unseen beings[1165] said, “I will bring it to yousg before you rise from your seat, and indeed, I am certainly strong and trustworthy enough to do it.” 40 The one who had knowledge of the Scripture said, “I will bring it to you before you blink your eye.” So when he saw it settled before him, he said, “This is of my Lord’s grace, to test me: whether I will thank or will deny. For whoever is thankful is only thankful to his own benefit, and whoever has denied[1166]—my Lord is, indeed, Self-Sufficient, Noble.” 41 He said, “Disguise her throne for her, and we shall see whether she will be guided or be one of those who are never guided.” 42 So when she arrived, it was said, “Is your throne like this?” She said, “As if this is it.” (Solomon said,) “And We were given knowledge before her and we have always been Muslimsa.” 43 But she was barred by whatever she used to worship apart from Allah; indeed, she was of a denying people. 44 She was told, “Enter the tower.” And when she saw it, she thought it was a deep pond and she bared her legs. He said, “It is a tower paved with glass.” She said, “My Lord, I have indeed been unjust to myself, and I have submitted with Solomon to Allah, Lord of all realms.” 45 And indeed, We sent to Thamûd their brother Saleh (saying), “Worship Allah.” But they promptly became two disputing groups. 46 He said, “O my people, why do you ask that the bad be hastened before the good? If only you would ask Allah’s forgiveness so that you may be shown mercy.” 47 They said, “We consider yousg a bad omen, and those with you (too).” He said, “Your omen is with Allah. In fact, you are a people being tried.” 48 And there were nine persons in the city who were spreading corruption in the land and would not reform. 49 They said, “Swear by Allah to one another that we[1167] will surely attack him and his family at night, and then we will emphatically tell his kinsman seeking retribution, ‘We did not witness the murder of his family, and we are indeed truthful.’” 50 And they schemed a scheme, and We schemed a scheme while they were unaware. 51 So looksg at how the outcome of their scheming was that We[1168] did destroy them and their people, all of them. 52 So here are their houses, vacant, on account of their injustice. Indeed, in this is surely a sign for people who know. 53 And We saved those who believed and were mindful (of God). 54 And Lot (too), when he said to his people, “Do you commit obscenity while you can see (its shamefulness)? 55 Do you approach men with lust instead of women? Rather you are an ignorant people.” 56 But the only response of his people was to say, “Evict Lot’s folk from your town; indeed, they are a few people who always keep themselves clean.” 57 So We saved him and his family, except for his wife, whom We destined to be of those who lingered behind. 58 And We rained upon them a rain, and so evil was the rain of the forewarned. 59 Saysg, “Praise be to Allah and peace be upon His servants whom He has elected. Is Allah better or what they[1169] associate?” 60 Or who (else then) is the one who created the heavens and the earth, and sent down to youpl from the sky water with which We[1170] germinated gardens full of beauty, whose trees you could not have germinated? Is there any other god with Allah? Rather, they are a people who equate[1171]. 61 Or who (else then) is the one who made the earth habitable and made rivers flow through it and set firm mountains for it and placed a partition between the two seas? Is there any other god with Allah? Rather, most of them do not know. 62 Or who (else then) is the one who responds to someone in need when he calls upon Him and relieves evil and makes you successors on earth? Is there any other god with Allah? Little do you remind[1172] yourselves. 63 Or who (else then) is the one who guides youpl through the darkness(es) of the land and the sea, and who sends the winds[1173] as heralds of glad tidings[1174] before His mercy? Is there any other god with Allah? Most High is Allah above what they associate. 64 Or who (else then) is the one who originates creation and then restores it, and Who provides for youpl from the sky and the land? Is there any other god with Allah? Saysg, “Produce yourpl proof, if you are truthful.” 65 Saysg, “No one in the heavens or the earth knows what is hidden except Allah.” For they are unaware of when they will be resurrected; 66 rather, their knowledge has been reached[1175] in the Hereafter; rather, they are in doubt about it; rather, they are completely blind to it. 67 And those who denied said, “Can it be that[1176] when we have become dust, and our forefathers—can it be that we will really be brought out? 68 Most surely, we were promised this before, we and our forefathers; this is nothing but the legends of the ancients.” 69 Saysg, “Journey through the earth and look what the outcome was for the criminals.” 70 But dosg not grieve over them and do not be troubled by what they scheme. 71 And they say, “When is this promise, if you are truthful?” 72 Saysg, “Perhaps some of what you are asking to be hastened has drawn near.” 73 And indeed, yoursg Lord is surely the Possessor of grace towards mankind, but most of them are not thankful. 74 And indeed, yoursg Lord knows whatever their chests harbor and whatever they make public. 75 And never is there anything hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is in an evident record[1177]. 76 This Recital[1178] indeed narrates to the Children of Israel most of what they differ over, 77 and most surely it is a guidance and a mercy to the believers. 78 Indeed, yoursg Lord decrees between them by His wise judgment, and He is the Almighty, the All-Knowing. 79 So place yoursg trust in Allah; you are indeed upon the evident truth. 80 Indeed, yousg cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make[1179] the deaf hear the call if they withdraw and turn their backs. 81 Nor can yousg guide[1180] the blind out of their utter misguidance; you can make no one hear except those who believe in Our signs, and are (thus) Muslims[1181]. 82 And when the decree is fulfilled against them, We will bring out for them—from the earth—a treading creature that will tell them that[1182] mankind used to have no certitude in Our signs. 83 On the day when We herd from every community a crowd of those who disbelieve our signs, so that they are held in strict order. 84 Until, when they come (before their Lord), He will say, “Did you deny My signs and did you not encompass them in knowledge, or what were you doing?” 85 And the decree shall be fulfilled against them for the injustices they did, and they shall be speechless. 86 Have they not seen that We have made the night for them to rest therein and the day allowing sight? Indeed, in that are signs for people who believe. 87 And on the day when the Trumpet is blown, and everyone in the heavens and the earth was[1183] horrified, except whomever Allah willed, and everyone came before Him in humility. 88 And yousg see the mountains, thinking them fixed, yet they pass as the passing of the clouds—the making of Allah Who has perfected everything; He is indeed All-Aware of what you[1184] do. 89 Whoever comes with a good deed—for him is one better than it and they are safe from horror[1185] on that day, 90 while whoever comes with an evil deed—their faces are tumbled into the Fire. “Are you[1186] being repaid except for what you used to do?” 91 (Saysg) “Indeed, I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this township, Who has made it inviolable and to Whom everything belongs, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims[1187] 92 and to read the Recital[1188]; so whoever is guided, then he is surely guided to his own benefit. And whoever goes astray, then say, “Indeed, I am only one of the forewarners.” 93 And saysg, “Praise be to Allah; He will show youpl His signs and you will recognize them. For in no way is yoursg Lord oblivious of what youpl do[1189].”

28. The Narratives

28- Al-Qasas

1 Tâ Sîn Mīm. 2 Those are the signs[1190] of the Evident Scripture. 3 We read to yousg from the tiding of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for people who believe. 4 Indeed, Pharaoh became exalted in the land and divided its people into sects, deeming a faction of them weak and oppressed: slaughtering their sons while keeping their women alive (in bondage). Indeed, he was one of the corrupters. 5 Thus We are willing to favor those who were deemed weak and oppressed in the land and to make them leaders and to make them the inheritors 6 and to establish them in the land and to show Pharaoh and Hamān and their troops from them the very thing they used to fear[1191]. 7 And We revealed to Moses’ mother, “Nurse him, then when you fear for him, cast him into the waters and do not fear and do not grieve; We are surely returning him to you and making him one of the emissaries.” 8 Then Pharaoh’s folk picked him up (only) to be an enemy and a (source of) grief for them. Indeed, Pharaoh and Hamān and their troops were wrongdoers. 9 So Pharaoh’s wife said, “A comfort to the eye for me and for yousg. Dopl not kill him; hopefully he may be useful to us, or we may take him as a son.” And they were unaware. 10 And Moses’ mother felt a void in her burning heart so that she almost declared him, had We not steadied her heart, that she may remain of the believers. 11 Thus she said to his sister, “Trail him.” So she watched him from afar while they were unaware. 12 And We had forbidden all wet nurses for him, so she said, “Shall I tell youpl about a household that can raise him for you and look after him?” 13 Thus We returned him to his mother, that her eye might be comforted and that she may not grieve, and so that she would know that Allah’s promise is true; yet most of them do not know. 14 And when he had attained his full strength and had matured, We gave him wise judgment and knowledge, for thus do We repay those who excel in doing good. 15 And (one day) he entered the city unnoticed by its people and found in it two men fighting—one of his own sect and one from his enemies, so the one of his sect solicited his assistance against the one from his enemies, so Moses struck him and put an end to him.
