He said, “This is of Satan’s work; he is indeed an evidently misguiding enemy.” 16 He said, “My Lord, I have indeed been unjust to myself, so forgive me.” So He forgave him; indeed, He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Bestower of mercy. 17 He said, “My Lord, because of the blessings You have bestowed upon me, I shall not be a backup for criminals.” 18 So the next morning he was walking about the city, fearful (and) vigilant, when suddenly the man who had sought his support the day before cried out to him. Moses said to him, “You are an evident deluder.” 19 And as he was about to strike the one who was their enemy, he said, “O Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the reformers.” 20 And a man came running from the farthest part of the city; he said, “O Moses, the chiefs are conspiring to kill you, so get out; I am indeed one of those who seek to advise you.” 21 So he went out of it, fearful (and) vigilant; he said, “My Lord, deliver me from the unjust people.” 22 And as he headed towards Midian, he said, “Hopefully, my Lord will guide me to the right way.” 23 And when he arrived at the waters of Midian he found there a crowd of people drawing water, and he found two women holding their flocks on the side. He said, “What is the matter with youdl?” They said, “We cannot draw water until the shepherds depart, and our father is a very old man.” 24 So he drew water for them and then turned away to the shade and said, “My Lord, I am in dire need of whatever good you have sent down for me.” 25 Then one of them came to him, walking bashfully. She said, “My father is calling you to repay you, as a reward for drawing water for us.” So when he came to him and narrated to him the narratives, he said, “Do not fear; you are (now) safe from the unjust people.” 26 One of them said, “Father, hire him; indeed, the best one you can hire is one who is strong (and) trustworthy.” 27 He said, “I surely wish to marry you to one of these two daughters of mine, provided you work for me for the term of eight pilgrimages; but if you complete ten, that is up to you, for I do not desire to impose any hardship on you. You will find me, Allah willing, one of the righteous.” 28 He said, “Let this be (an agreement) between you and me; whichever of the two terms I fulfill, I will not have transgressed, and Allah is a trustee over what we say.” 29 So when Moses had completed the term and journeyed with his family, he noticed a fire by the side of Mount Tûr. He said to his family, “Stay here; I have surely glimpsed a fire. Perhaps I can bring youpl some information from there, or an ember from the fire, that you may warm yourselves.” 30 So when he reached it, he was called from the right side of the valley at the blessed spot, from the tree: “O Moses, indeed I—I alone—am Allah, Lord of all realms. 31 So throw down yoursg staff.” And when he saw it shaking as if it were a snake, he turned away, fleeing, and did not look back. “O Moses, come forward and do not fear; you are indeed of the secure ones. 32 Put yoursg hand inside your garment; it will come out white, without any bad affliction. And clasp to you your arm, that you should not be overawed, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs; indeed, they have been a defiantly disobedient people.” 33 He said, “My Lord, I have in fact killed one of them, and I fear lest they kill me. 34 And my brother Aaron—he is more eloquent than me, so send him with me as an assistant to confirm me; I do fear that they will disbelieve me.” 35 He said, “We will strengthen yoursg shoulder with your brother and give youdl authority so they will not be able to reach you. With Our signs, youdl and those who follow you will be the overcomers.” 36 So when Moses came to them with Our signs, evident, they said, “This is nothing but fabricated sorcery, and We never heard of this among our ancient forefathers.” 37 Thus Moses[1192] said, “My Lord knows better of the one who brings guidance from Him and who will have the future outcome of the Home; indeed, the unjust never succeed.” 38 And Pharaoh said, “O chiefs, I have never known of any god for you other than me. So fire-up clay-bricks for me, O Haman, and build me a tower, that perhaps I may view the God of Moses, though I definitely think he is of the liars.” 39 Thus he and his troops went arrogantly about the land without any right, and they thought that they would not be returned[1193] to Us. 40 So We took him and his troops and We threw them into the waters, so look what the outcome was for the unjust ones. 41 And We made them leaders calling to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they are not supported. 42 And We caused a curse to follow them in this Earlier (Life), and on the Day of Resurrection they are of the despised. 43 And We certainly brought Moses the Scripture after We had annihilated the earliest generations, as insights for mankind, and guidance and mercy, that perhaps they would remind themselves. 44 And yousg were not on the western side (of the Mount) when We decreed the command to Moses, nor were yousg of the witnesses. 45 Yet We established many generations[1194], then the ages became seemingly long. Nor were you among the people of Midian, reading Our signs[1195] to them; but We have been sending emissaries. 46 Nor were you by the side of Mount Tûr when We called out. Rather, it was a mercy from your Lord so that you may warn a people to whom no warner had come before you, that perhaps they would remind themselves. 47 And (We have sent you as a messenger) lest a calamity befall them as a result of what their hands have put forth, and they say, “Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your signs and been among the believers.” 48 But when the truth came to them from Our Providence, they said, “If only he was given the like of what was given to Moses.” Did they not deny what was given to Moses in the past? They said, “Two works[1196] of sorcery[1197], backing one another.” And they said, “We deny both.” 49 Saysg, “Then bring a scripture from Allah more conducive to guidance than both of them and I will follow it, if youpl are truthful.” 50 But if they do not respond to yousg, know that they only follow their whims. And who is more misguided than one who follows his own whim without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the unjust people. 51 And surely We have conveyed the Word to them, that they may remind themselves. 52 Those to whom We brought the Scripture before it believe in it, 53 and when it is recited to them, they say, “We have believed in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord; indeed, we were Muslims[1198] prior to it.” 54 Those are brought their reward twice on account of how they persevered patiently. And they counter evil with good and they spend from what We have provided them. 55 And when they hear idle talk they disregard it and say, “We have our deeds and youpl have your deeds; peace be upon you; we do not seek (the company of) ignorant people.” 56 Indeed, yousg cannot guide whom you love, but Allah guides whom He wills, and He knows better of those who are guided. 57 And they said, “If we follow the guidance with yousg, we will be snatched from our land.” Did We not establish for them a safe sanctuary to which all kinds of products are brought as provision from Ourself? But most of them do not know. 58 And how many a town did We annihilate for becoming unappreciative of its livelihood? So here are their residences, uninhabited after them but little, and We have always been the inheritors. 59 And in no way would yoursg Lord annihilate towns until He had sent to their mother-town a messenger reading to them Our[1199] signs[1200]. And in no way would We annihilate towns except if their people are unjust. 60 And whatever youpl have been brought is (merely) the enjoyment of the Earlier Life and its adornment, but what is with Allah is better and longer lasting. Do you[1201] not reason? 61 Can someone to whom We have made a fine promise—which he is bound to encounter—be equal to someone whom We have allowed to enjoy the enjoyment of the Earlier Life, then on the Day of Resurrection will be one of the arraigned? 62 On the day when He calls to them and says, “Where are My associates whom you used to claim?” 63 Those against whom the sentence was justified said[1202], “Our Lord, these are the ones whom we deluded. We deluded them as we ourselves were deluded. We declare our innocence before You; it was not us that they used to worship.” 64 And it was said, “Call on yourpl associates.” So they called them, but they did not respond to them, and they saw the punishment. If only they had sought guidance! 65 And on the day when He calls[1203] to them and says, “What did you respond to the emissaries?” 66 Then all tidings were obscureda for them on that day so they are unable to ask each other. 67 But as for one who has repented and has attained faith and has acted righteously—hopefully, he will become of the successful. 68 And yoursg Lord creates whatever He wills and He chooses. Never could the choice be theirs. Highly Exalted is Allah, and Most High is He above the associations they make. 69 And yoursg Lord knows whatever their chests harbor and whatever they make public. 70 And He is Allah; there is no god but He. To Him belongs all praise in the First (life) and in the Hereafter, and to Him youpl are returned[1204]. 71 Saysg, “Have youpl seen if Allah were to make the night perpetual over you until the Day of Resurrection, which god other than Allah would bring you illumination? Do you not hear?” 72 Saysg, “Have youpl seen if Allah were to make the day perpetual over you until the Day of Resurrection, which god other than Allah would bring you night to rest in? Do you not observe?” 73 But out of His mercy, He has made for youpl night and day so that you may rest in it and seek of His grace, and that you may give thanks. 74 And on the day when He calls to them and says, “Where are My associates whom you used to claim?” 75 And We drewa out from every community a witness, then said, “Produce your proof,” so they realized that the truth belongs to Allah, and whatever they used to fabricate strayed away from them. 76 Indeed, Qarun was of the people of Moses, but he oppressed them. And We had given him treasures, the keys of which would weigh down a band of strong men. Recall when his people said to him, “Do not exult; surely, Allah does not love the exultant. 77 And seek in whatever Allah has brought yousg the Home of the Hereafter, and do not forget your share of the Earlier (Life) , and do good as Allah has done good to you, and do not seek corruption in the land; indeed, Allah does not like the corrupters.” 78 He said, “Indeed, it was only brought to me on account of knowledge I possess.” Did he not know that before him Allah had annihilated many generations who were stronger than he and had collected greater riches? And the criminals will not be asked about their misdeeds. 79 And he came out before his people in his splendor; those who wanted the Earlier Life said, “If only we possessed the likes of what Qarun was given. He is indeed very fortunate.” 80 But those who were given knowledge said, “Woe to you! The recompense of Allah is better for those who have attained faith and have acted righteously.” Yet none is granted it except the patient ones. 81 So We caused the earth to swallow him and his home, then he had no battalion to support him apart from Allah, and he was not of those who could help themselves. 82 And by morning the ones who only yesterday had wished they were in his position were saying, “Indeed, it is Allah who extends His provision for whomever He wills of His servants, and He restrains (it). Had Allah not been gracious to us, He would have caused it to swallow us[1205]. No wonder the deniers never succeed.” 83 That is the Home of the Hereafter—We assign it for those who want no exaltation in the land nor corruption. And the future outcome is for those who are mindful (of God). 84 Whoever has come with a good deed—for him there is better than it, but whoever has come with an evil deed—those who have done evil deeds will only be rewarded for what they used to do. 85 Indeed, He Who ordained the Recital[1206] upon yousg will surely return you to a great place of return. Saysg, “My Lord knows better who brings guidance and who is the one in evident misguidance.” 86 And you did not (even) expect the Scripture would be cast to yousg, yet (it was revealed to you) as a mercy from your Lord, so never be a backup for the deniers. 87 And do not let them bar yousg from Allah’s signs[1207] after they have been sent down to you. And call to your Lord, and never be of those who associate (others with God). 88 And do not callsg upon any other god with Allah; there is no god but He. All things perish except His Countenance. Judgment belongs (only) to Him, and to Him youpl are returned[1208].

29. The Spider

29- Al-‘Ankabût

1 Alif Lām Mīm. 2 Do people think that they will be left to say, “We believe” without being tested? 3 Yet certainly We have tested those before them; thus Allah will surely know the truthful and He will surely know the liars. 4 Or do those who do evil deeds think that they can outstrip Us? Terrible is their judgment! 5 Whoever expects the meeting with Allah—the appointed time of Allah is sure to come, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. 6 Thus whoever strives—he only strives to his own benefit; most surely, Allah is Self-Sufficient (without need for any of the creatures) of all realms. 7 And as for those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—We will certainly remit their evil deeds and We will certainly repay them according to the best of what they used to do. 8 And We have enjoined upon man kindness towards his parents. But if they urge you[1209] to associate with Me something yousg have no knowledge of, do not obey them. To Me is yourpl return, and I will inform you of what you used to do. 9 Those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—We will surely enter them among the righteous. 10 And among mankind is one who says, “We have attained faith in Allah.” Yet when he is hurt on Allah’s account, he equates the people’s persecution with Allah’s punishment. And if help comes from yoursg Lord, he will definitely say, “We were actually with youpl.” Does not Allah know better whatever is within the chests of (all creatures of) all realms? 11 And Allah will surely know those who have attained faith, and He will surely know the hypocrites. 12 And those who denied said to those who had attained faith, “Follow our way and we will carry your offenses.” But never will they (willingly) carry any of their offenses; they are indeed liars. 13 Yet, they will surely carry their own heavy burdens and other heavy burdens with their own heavy burdens, and they will surely be asked on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to fabricate. 14 And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and He stayed among them for a thousand years, less fifty seasons. Then the Flood took them, for they were unjust. 15 But We saved him together with the fellows of the Ark, and We made it a sign for (all people of) all realms. 16 And Abraham—recall when he said to his people, “Worship Allah and be mindful of Him; that is better for you if you only knew. 17 Indeed, whatever youpl worship apart from Allah are nothing but idols, and you create fabrications. Those you worship apart from Allah possess no provision for you, so seek your provision with Allah and worship Him and thank Him; to Him you are returned[1210].” 18 And if youpl disbelieve, other communities before you have also disbelieved. And there is no responsibility upon the messenger except evident proclamation. 19 Have they[1211] not seen how Allah starts creation and then restores it? This is indeed easy for Allah. 20 Saysg, “Journey throughout the earth and look how He started creation.” Then Allah will bring about the next existence; Allah is indeed All-Powerful over everything.” 21 He punishes whomever He wills and He grants mercy to whomever He wills, and to Him youpl are turned back. 22 And youpl can neither thwart (God) on earth nor in heaven, and apart from Allah you have neither ally nor supporter. 23 And those who denied Allah’s signs and the meeting with Him—those have despaired of My[1212] mercy, and for those is a painful punishment. 24 But there was no response from his people except that they said, “Kill him or burn him.” But Allah saved him from the fire; indeed, in that are signs for people who believe. 25 And he said, “Youpl have chosen idols apart from Allah, as a bond of love for one another in the Earlier Life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your shelter is the Fire, and you will have no helpers.” 26 Then Lot believed in him and said, “I am emigrating to my Lord; He is indeed the Almighty, the All-Wise.” 27 And We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and conferred upon his offspring the prophethood and the scripture, and brought him his reward in the Earlier (Life). And indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous. 28 And Lot—recall when he said to his people, “Indeed, you do approach[1213] obscenity such as nobody in all communities has ever committed before you. 29 Can it be that you do approach men and cut off the way[1214] and commit what is deplorable in your gatherings?” But there was no response from his people except that they said, “Bring upon us Allah’s punishment if yousg are of the truthful.” 30 He said, “My Lord, help me against the corruptive people.” 31 And when Our messengers came to Abraham[1215] with the glad tidings, they said, “We are going to destroy the people of this town; indeed, its people have been unjust.” 32 He said, “Yet Lot is in it.” They said, “We know better of who is in it; we will most surely deliver[1216] him and his family, except for his wife; she has become one of those who linger behind.” 33 Then, when Our messengers came to Lot, he was troubled and distressed on their account. But they said, “Do not fear nor grieve; we will deliver[1217] you and your family, except for your wife; she has become one of those who linger behind. 34 Indeed, We will send[1218] down upon the people of this town a torment from heaven on account of having been defiantly disobedient.” 35 And We left behind something of it as an evident sign for people who reason. 36 And to Midian (We sent) their brother Shuʻaib. So he said, “O my people, worship Allah and expect the Last Day, and do not go wickedly about the land, corrupting it.” 37 But they disbelieved him, so the Tremor overtook them and they became lifeless bodies in their home. 38 And ʻĀd[1219] and Thamûd[1220] as well, as it has become evident for youpl from their (ruined) residences. And Satan adorned their deeds for them, barring them from the way, even though they could see. 39 And Qarun and Pharaoh and Hamān—Moses certainly went to them with clear proofs, but they went about arrogantly in the land, and in no way were they forerunners. 40 Each We seized by his misdeed: so of them are those upon whom We sent a sandstorm, and of them are those who were taken away by the Shout, and of them are those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and of them are those whom We drowned. For never would Allah do them any injustice, but to themselves they used to do injustice. 41 The likeness of those who take for themselves guardians apart from Allah is as the likeness of the spider that takes for itself a house, and surely the feeblest of houses is indeed the house of the spider, if they only knew. 42 Indeed, Allah knows whatever thing they[1221] call upon apart from Him, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise. 43 And such parables We set forth for mankind, but none grasps them except the learned. 44 Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth; indeed, in that is a sign for the believers. 45 Recite what is revealed to yousg of the Scripture and establish the prayer; indeed the prayer forbids obscenity and what is deplorable. And surely the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows what youpl do. 46 And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in the best manner, unless it be those of them who have done injustice, and say, “We believe in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to you, and our God and your God is One, and to Him we are Muslims[1222].” 47 Likewise, We sent down to yousg the Scripture. So those to whom We gave the Scripture believe in it, and some of these ones believe in it, but none repudiate Our signs except the deniers. 48 And yousg never used to read any Scripture before it, and you never used to write it down with your right hand; otherwise the advocates of falsehood would have doubted. 49 In fact, it is evident signs in the chests of those given knowledge, and none repudiate Our signs except the unjust ones. 50 And they said, “Why are no signs[1223] sent down to him from his Lord?” Saysg, “Surely the signs are only in the Providence of Allah, and surely I am only an evident warner.” 51 Does it not suffice them that We revealed to yousg the Scripture which is recited to them? Indeed, in that is mercy and a reminding for people who believe. 52 Say, “Allah suffices as witness between you and me; He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believed in falsehood and denied Allah—it is those who are the losers.” 53 And they urge yousg to hasten the punishment. And were it not for a stated term, the punishment would have come to them. But it will come upon them suddenly while they are unaware. 54 They urge you to hasten the punishment, and indeed, Hell is surely encompassing of the deniers. 55 On the day when the punishment envelops them from above them and from beneath their feet, and He says[1224], “Taste what you used to do! 56 O My servants who have attained faith: My earth is vast, so worship Me alone. 57 Every single self is sure to taste death, then to Us youpl are returned[1225]. 58 And those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—We will settle[1226] them in the Garden (of Paradise) in Chambers under which rivers flow, abiding therein; how good is the reward of the workers 59 who endured patiently and in their Lord they place their trust!”60 How many a treading creature is there that does not carry its provision? Allah provides for it and for youpl, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. 61 And surely, if you were to ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?” They would say, “Allah.” So how can they be averted (from the truth)? 62 Allah expands provision for whomever He wills of His servants and He restrains for him; indeed, Allah is All-Knowing of everything. 63 And surely, if yousg were to ask them, “Who sent down from the sky water with which He revived the earth after it had died?” They would say, “Allah.” Saysg, “Praise be to Allah.” Rather, most of them do not reason. 64 This Earlier Life is nothing but a distraction and a game, and indeed the Home of the Hereafter is truly the perennial life, if they only knew. 65 So when they embark on ships they call upon Allah, devoting religion to Him. But once He has delivered them safely to land, they promptly associate others (with Him), 66 so that they deny whatever We have brought them and so that they enjoy[1227], for they will eventually know! 67 Have they not seen that We have established a safe sanctuary, while all around them people are being snatched away? Do they believe in falsehood and deny the blessings of Allah? 68 And who is more unjust than one who has fabricated lies and attributed them to Allah or disbelieved the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a dwelling for the deniers? 69 And those who strove for Us—We will surely guide them in Our ways, for Allah[1228] is most surely with those who excel in doing good.

30. The Romans

30- Ar-Rûm

1 Alif Lām Mīm. 2 The Romans have been overcome 3 in the nearest[1229] land. But after having been overcome, they will overcome (their enemy) 4 in a few[1230] years. The command belongs to Allah, in the past and in the future. And on that day, the believers will exult 5 in Allah’s support. He supports whomever He wills, and He is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 6 The promise of Allah—Allah never breaks His promise, but most of mankind knows not. 7 They know an outer aspect of the Earlier Life, but they are oblivious of the Hereafter. 8 Have they not reflected within themselves? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them except with the truth and for a stated term. But many among mankind do deny the meeting with their Lord. 9 Have they not journeyed through the earth and looked at what the outcome was for those before them? They were more powerful than them, and they cultivated the land and developed it more than they developed it, and their messengers came to them with evident proofs. For never would Allah do them any injustice, but to themselves they used to do injustice. 10 Then absolute evil was the consequence for those who committed evil[1231]; that is because they rejected Allah’s signs and used to ridicule them. 11 Allah originates creation and then restores it, then to Him youpl are returned[1232]. 12 And on the day when the Hour takes place, the criminals despair. 13 And they had[1233] no intercessors from among their associate-gods, and they became deniers of their associate-gods. 14 And on the day when the Hour takes place—on that day they separate. 15 So, as for those who had attained faith and had done righteous deeds—they are in a meadow, delighted. 16 But as for those who had denied and had rejected Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter—those are arraigned in the punishment. 17 So Highly Exalted is Allah when youpl reach nightfall and when you reach morning. 18 And to him is all praise in the heavens and the earth, and in the evening, and when youpl reach midday. 19 He brings out the living from the dead and He brings out the dead from the living, and He revives the land after it has died, and likewise youpl are brought out[1234]. 20 And of His signs is that He created youpl from dust, and there you are, human beings spreading about. 21 And of His signs is that He created for you spouses from among yourselves so that you may find rest with them, and He has set between you love and mercy; indeed, in that are signs for people who reflect. 22 And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the diversity of yourpl tongues[1235] and colors; indeed, in that are signs for those who know[1236]. 23 And of His signs is yourpl sleep by night and day, and your pursuit of His grace; indeed, in that are signs for people who listen. 24 And of His signs is that He shows youpl lightning, causing fear and ardent hope. And He bestows[1237] water from the sky, and with it He revives the earth after its death; indeed, in that are signs for people who reason. 25 And of His signs is that the heaven and the earth remain (firm) by His command, then when He calls youpl out of the earth, you promptly come out. 26 To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth; all surrender to Him. 27 It is He who originates creation and then restores it, and that is even easier for Him. And His is the Most Exalted example in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Almighty, the All-Wise. 28 He has set forth for youpl a parable from yourselves: do you make those whom you rightfully possess full partners in the wealth We have given you, so that you are equal in regard to it, fearing them as you have fear of each other? We thus detail the signs for people who reason. 29 Yet those who did injustice followed their whims without knowledge. But who can guide those whom Allah has misguided? And they will have no helpers. 30 So set yoursg face upright towards the religion, turning away from all that is false; (this religion is) the original disposition from Allah upon which He originated mankind. There cannot be any change in Allah’s creation; this is the upright religion, but most of mankind does not know. 31 (Keep) turningpl to Him in penitence, and be mindful of Him and establish the prayer, and do not be of those who associate others (with Him) — 32 of the ones who have caused disunity in[1238] their religion and become sects, each party exulting in whatever they have. 33 And when harm touches people they call upon their Lord, turning to Him in penitence. Thereafter, when He makes them taste mercy from Him, a group of them associate others with their Lord 34 so as to deny what We have brought them. So take yourpl enjoyment, then you will come to know. 35 Or have We sent down to them any authority which speaks in support of what they have been associating with Him? 36 And when We make people taste a mercy, they rejoice in it; but when adversity befalls them because of what their hands have put forth, they promptly become despondent. 37 Have they not seen that Allah extends provision for whomever He wills and He restrains (it)? Surely in that are signs for people who believe. 38 So bringsg to the relative his rights, and the destitutesg and the traveler in need; that is best for those who seek Allah’s Countenance, and those are the successful. 39 And whatever youpl have brought[1239] in usury so that it increases[1240] through people’s money is not (considered) an increase with Allah, but whatever you have brought[1241] as purifying charity[1242],  seeking Allah’s Countenance—those[1243] are the multipliers. 40 Allah is the One Who created youpl, then provided for you, then makes you die, then brings you back to life. Can any of your associate-gods do any of that? Highly Exalted is He, and Most High above what they associate[1244] (with Him). 41 Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea because of what people’s hands have earned, so that He[1245] may make them taste some of what they have done, that they may return. 42 Saysg, “Journeypl through the earth and look what the outcome was for those who came before; most of them were polytheists”. 43 So set yoursg face upright towards the upright religion before there comes from Allah a day that cannot be turned back; on that day they will be divided: 44 whoever has denied—upon him falls his denial, and whoever has acted righteously—they[1246] smooth a way for themselves. 45 So that He may repay those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds out of His grace. Indeed, He does not love the deniers. 46 And of His signs is that He sends the winds bearing glad tidings, and that He may let youpl taste of His mercy, and so that ships may sail by His command, and so that you may seek of His grace, and so that you may give thanks. 47 And indeed, before yousg We sent messengers to their people, and they came to them with evident proofs. So We took retribution from those who had committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers. 48 Allah is the One Who sends the winds[1247] so they stir up clouds, then He spreads them in the sky as He wills and makes them into pieces[1248], then you see rain drops coming out from their midst; then when He makes it fall upon whom He wills of His servants, there they are, anticipating glad tidings 49 although before it was bestowed[1249] upon them from on high they were indeed in despair. 50 So looksg at the effects[1250] of Allah’s mercy—how He revives the earth after its death; indeed, He is the Reviver of the dead, and He is All-Powerful over everything. 51 But if We sent a wind and they saw it turning things yellow, they would continue thereafter to deny. 52 So surely yousg cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear[1251] the call when they turn away, fleeing. 53 Nor will yousg guide[1252] the blind out of their misguidance; you can make hear only those who believe in Our signs and are thus Muslims[1253]. 54 Allah is the One Who created youpl out of weakness, then after weakness gave (you) strength, then after strength gave (you) weakness and gray hair. He creates whatever He wills, and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Powerful. 55 And on the day when the Hour takes place, the criminals swear they had not stayed but for an hour; thus they used to be averted (from the truth). 56 But (on Judgment Day) those endowed with knowledge and faith said[1254], “Surely, youpl have remained (in existence from the time of your creation) until the Day of Resurrection (in accordance with the decree) in Allah’s Scripture; so this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not know.” 57 On that day the excuses of those who were unjust do not benefit them, nor are they allowed to make amends. 58 And We have certainly set forth in this Recital[1255] for mankind every sort of parable. But even if yousg bring them a (miraculous) sign, those who have denied will surely say, “You are nothing but fakers.” 59 Allah thus seals the hearts of those who do not know, 60 so besg patient. The promise of Allah is true, so do not let those who lack certitude belittle you.

31. Luqman

31- Luqmân

1 Alif Lām Mīm. 2 These are the signs of the Wise Scripture, 3 a guidance and a mercy for those who excel in doing good: 4 those who establish the prayer and bring[1256] the purifying charity[1257] and of the Hereafter they are certain. 5 Those are rightly guided by their Lord, and those are the successful. 6 And among mankind is one who trades in distracting tales to make (people) stray[1258] from the way of Allah without knowledge, and to take it[1259] for a mockery; for those is a demeaning punishment. 7 And when Our signs[1260] are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as though he did not hear them, as though there is deafness in his ears. So givesg him glad tidings[1261] of a painful punishment. 8 Indeed, those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—for them are the Gardens of Bliss, 9 abiding therein, a true promise of Allah. And He is the Almighty, the All-Wise. 10 He created the heavens without any pillars that youpl can see, and cast firm mountains into the earth lest it sway with you, and scattered throughout it all kinds of treading creatures. And from the sky We sent down water, and We germinated therein many noble kinds of plants. 11 Such is Allah’s creation, so showpl me what those apart from Him have created; rather, the unjust are in evident misguidance. 12 And truly, We endowed Luqman with wisdom: “Givesg thanks to Allah.” For whoever is thankful is only thankful to his own benefit, and whoever has denied[1262], then Allah is indeed Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy. 13 And recall when Luqman said to his son, as he was admonishing him, “O my child, do not associate (anything) with Allah; indeed, associating (others with Allah) is surely a great injustice.” 14 And We have enjoined upon man the care of his parents. His mother carried him with hardship upon hardship, besides weaning him in two years. So givesg thanks to Me and to your parents; to Me is the destiny. 15 But if theydl strive to have yousg associate with Me whatever you have no knowledge of, do not obey them. Yet accompany them in the Earlier (Life) kindly, and follow the way of the one who has turned to Me in penitence. Then to Me is yourpl return, and I will inform you of what you used to do. 16 “O my child, if it be the weight[1263] of a mustard-seed, and be it in a rock or in the heavens or in the earth, Allah brings it forth; indeed, Allah is Subtle, All-Aware. 17 O my child, establish the prayer and command to what is fair and forbid what is deplorable, and be patient over what has befallen you; indeed, that is of the matters requiring determination. 18 And do not turn your cheek away from people (in pride), nor walk about the earth merrily; indeed, Allah does not love every self-admiring boaster. 19 And moderate your stride and lower your voice; indeed, the most deplorable of all voices is surely the donkey’s voice.” 20 Have youpl not seen that Allah has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and showered you with His blessings[1264], both manifest and hidden? Yet among mankind is one who argues about Allah without any knowledge nor any guidance nor any illuminating Scripture. 21 And when it is said to them, “Follow what Allah has sent down,” they say, “Rather, we follow what we found our forefathers doing.” Even if Satan has been calling them to the punishment of the Blaze? 22 And whoever surrenders his face to Allah while excelling in doing good, then he has truly grasped the firmest handhold. And with Allah rests the outcome of all events. 23 And whoever denies—let not his denial sadden yousg; to Us is their[1265] return, then We will inform them of what they did; indeed, Allah is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests. 24 We give them a little enjoyment, then We compel them to a harsh punishment. 25 And if yousg ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth?” They will surely say, “Allah.” Saysg, “Praise be to Allah.” Rather, most of them do not know. 26 To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Indeed, Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy. 27 And were all the trees on earth pens, with the sea[1266] replenished[1267] by seven seas following it, never would the Words of Allah run out. Indeed, Allah is Almighty, All-Wise. 28 Neither yourpl creation nor your resurrection are but as that of a single soul. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing. 29 Have yousg not seen that Allah causes the night to penetrate the day, and causes the day to penetrate the night? And that He subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a stated term? And that Allah is All-Aware of whatever youpl do? 30 That is because Allah is the Truth, and because what they call[1268] upon apart from Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the All-High, the Supreme. 31 Have yousg not seen that the ships sail through the sea by the blessing of Allah, to show you of His signs? Indeed, in that are signs for everyone who is most patient, constantly thankful. 32 And when waves like canopies cover them, they call upon Allah, devoting religion to Him. But when He has delivered them ashore, some of them waver. But no one repudiates Our signs except every perfidious staunch denier. 33 O mankind, be mindful of your Lord, and fear a day when no parent can repay anything on behalf of his child, nor can a child repay anything on behalf of his parent. The promise of Allah is indeed true, so let not the Earlier Life deceive youpl, and let not the Deceiver deceive you regarding Allah. 34 Indeed, with Allah rests the knowledge of the Hour. And He bestows[1269] the rain from on high and He knows what the wombs contain. But in no way does any soul know what it will earn tomorrow, and in no way does any soul know in what land it will die; indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.

32. Prostration

32- As-Sajdah

1 Alif Lām Mīm. 2 The bestowal of the Scripture from on high is—no doubt about it—by the Lord of all realms. 3 Yet they say, “He has fabricated it.” Rather, it is the truth from yoursg Lord, so that you may warn a people to whom no warner came before you, that they may be guided. 4 Allah is the One Who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days[1270], and then settled over the Throne; apart from Him, youpl have neither ally nor intercessor. Will you not remind yourselves? 5 He governs every matter from the heavens to the earth, then it ascends to Him on a day the length of which is a thousand years by yourpl count. 6 That is the Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest, the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy 7 Who has made excellent everything He created[1271], and He originated the creation of man from clay, 8 then made his progeny from an extract of a despicable fluid, 9 then He proportioned him and breathed into him of His Spirit, and He gave youpl hearing and sight(s) and burning hearts; little do you give thanks. 10 And they said, “Can it be that when we have become lost into the earth—can it be that we will[1272] really be brought to a new creation?” Rather, they do deny the meeting with their Lord. 11 Saysg, “The angel of death put in charge of youpl takes you, then to your Lord you are returned[1273].” 12 And if only yousg could see the criminals bowing their heads before their Lord: “Our Lord, we have seen and we have heard, so send us back, that we may act righteously; we are (now) certain.” 13 And had We willed, We could have brought every soul its guidance, but the declaration from Me will come true: “I will most surely fill Hell with (the race of) unseen beings[1274] and human beings, both together.” 14 So taste, on account of how youpl forgot the meeting of this day of yours; indeed, We have forgotten you, so taste the eternal punishment on account of what you used to do. 15 The only people who (truly) believe in Our signs are those who, when they are reminded of them, fall down prostrating and highly exalt their Lord with praise, and they are not arrogant. 16 Their sides shun the beds as they pray to their Lord out of fear and ardent hope, and from Our provisions to them they spend. 17 No soul knows what has been hidden[1275] for them[1276] of comfort to the eyes—a repayment on account of what they used to do. 18 So, is the one who has been a believer like the one who has been defiantly disobedient? They are not equal. 19 As for those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds, for them are the Gardens of Shelter—hospitality on account of what they used to do. 20 But as for those who have defiantly disobeyed, their shelter is the Fire; every time they want to depart it, they are brought back into it, and it is said to them, “Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.” 21 And We will certainly make them taste the lesser punishment (in this life) prior to the greater punishment, that they may return. 22 And who is more unjust than one who was reminded of his Lord’s signs, then disregarded them? We will certainly wreak vengeance upon the criminals. 23 And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so dosg not regard his meeting with scepticism. And We made it a guidance for the Children of Israel. 24 And of them We appointed leaders guiding by Our command, when[1277] they persevered patiently and were certain of Our signs. 25 Indeed, yoursg Lord is the One Who judges between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding whatever they used to differ over. 26 Is it not a guidance for them: how many generations We caused to perish before them, amidst whose residences they (now) walk? Surely in that are signs. Do they not hear? 27 Have they not seen that We conduct the water to a dry land, and with it We bring out vegetation from which their livestock eat, and they themselves? Do they not see? 28 And they say, “When is this conquest, if youpl are truthful?” 29 Saysg, “On the Day of Conquest the belief of the ones who had denied will not benefit them, and they will not be given respite.” 30 So disregardsg them and wait. Indeed, they (too) are waiting.

33. The Parties

33- Al-Ahzâb

1 O Prophet, be mindful of Allah and do not obey the deniers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allah has always been All-Knowing, All-Wise. 2 And follow what is revealed to yousg from your Lord; indeed, Allah has always been All-Aware of what youpl do[1278]. 3 And place yoursg trust in Allah, for Allah is sufficient as a Trustee. 4 Never did Allah make two hearts inside any man’s body, nor did He ever make yourpl spouses whom you reject and compare to your mothers’ backs into your actual mothers. Nor did He make your adopted sons your actual sons. That is your saying coming out of your mouths, and Allah speaks the truth and He guides to the way. 5 Call them after their fathers; that is more equitable with Allah. But if youpl do not know their fathers, then your brethren in faith and your protégés. And you commit no sin if you err therein, except for what your hearts premeditate. And Allah has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 6 The Prophet is worthier as a guardian of the believers than they are of themselves, and his spouses are (as) mothers to them. And blood relatives are worthier than the (other) believers or the immigrants[1279] as heirs of one another according to Allah’s Scripture—except that youpl may do an upright act to your allies; that has been inscribed in the Scripture. 7 And recall that We took from the prophets their pledge, and from yousg and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, son of Mary, and We took from them a solid pledge, 8 that He[1280] may ask the truthful[1281] about their truthfulness. Yet He has prepared for the deniers a painful punishment. 9 O you who have attained faith, remember Allah’s blessings upon you when troops advanced towards you, and We[1282] sent against them a wind and troops that you did not see. And Allah has always been All-Seeing of what you do[1283]. 10 When they came upon youpl from above you and from beneath you, and when sight(s) swerved and hearts reached the larynges, and you assume[1284] about Allah various assumptions. 11 There and then the believers were tested and were made to quake with a severe earthquake, 12 as the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is sickness say, “Allah and His Messenger promised us nothing but a deception.” 13 Recall, too, when a faction of them said, “O people of Yathrib, there is no staying[1285] for you here, so retreat.” And a group of them askf the Prophet to excuse them, saying, “Indeed, our houses are exposed,” although they are not exposed, but they want nothing but to flee. 14 And had it[1286] been invaded from all its sides, then they were asked tribulation, they would have brought it[1287] and tarried not but a little. 15 And certainly, they had previously covenanted with Allah that they would not turn their backs. And Allah’s covenant must be answered for. 16 Saysg, “Flight will not benefit youpl if you flee from death or killing; even then you will be given no enjoyment but a little.” 17 Saysg, “Who is it who can safeguard youpl from Allah if He desires adversity for you or desires mercy for you?” Apart from Allah, they can find for themselves neither guardian nor supporter. 18 Allah already knows the hinderers among you and those who say to their brethren, “Come along to us,” whereas they do not mobilize for battle but a little, 19 begrudging support to youpl. And when fear approaches, yousg see them looking at you, their eyes rolling—like someone fainting at death; then, when panic is over, they scald youpl with sharp tongues, begrudging you any good. Those have not believed, so Allah has nullified their deeds, and this matter has always been easy for Allah. 20 They assume that the parties have not gone away. But were the parties to come (again), they would wish they were in the desert with the nomadic Arabs, asking[1288] about yourpl news. And if they were among you, they would not combat but a little. 21 Most surely, there has always been an excellent role model for youpl in the Messenger of Allah (and) for anyone who has been putting hope in Allah and expecting the Last Day, and has remembered Allah frequently. 22 And when the believers saw the parties, they said, “This is what Allah and His messenger have promised us, and Allah and His messenger have told the truth.” And it only increased them in faith and submission. 23 Of the believers are men who have been true to what they have covenanted with Allah: so of them is one who fulfilled his obligation[1289], and of them is one who still waits, and they have not changed in the least. 24 That Allah may repay the truthful for their truthfulness and punish the hypocrites, if He wills, or grant them repentance and accept it from them. Indeed, Allah has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 25 And Allah repelled those who denied in their rage—they gained no advantage. And Allah thus spared the believers combat, and Allah has always been All-Powerful, Almighty. 26 And He brought down those of the People of the Scripture who backed them from their strongholds, and threw terror into their hearts, (while) youpl kill[1290] one group, and another group you capture. 27 And He made youpl inherit their land and their homes and their possessions and a land you had never trodden. And Allah has always been Powerful over everything. 28 O Prophet, say to your spouses, “If you want the Earlier Life and its adornment, then come, let me compensate you and release you kindly. 29 But if you want Allah and His Messenger and the Home of the Hereafter, then indeed, Allah has prepared a great reward for those of you who excel in doing good.” 30 O wives of the Prophet, if any one of you were ever to commit an evident obscenity[1291], the punishment for her would be doubled[1292] twofold. And that has always been easy for Allah. 31 But whoever of you is devout towards Allah and His Messenger and acts righteously—We[1293] will bring her her reward twice over, and We have prepared for her a noble provision. 32 O wives of the Prophet, you are not like any of the other women. If you are truly mindful (of God), then do not speak too softly, lest the sick at heart lust after you, but speak forthright words. 33 And settle[1294] in your houses and do not display yourselves as in the former days of pagan ignorance, and establish the prayer and bring[1295] the purifying charity[1296] and obey Allah and His Messenger; indeed, Allah only wants to keep abomination away from you, O people of the (Prophet’s) household, and to cleanse you thoroughly. 34 And remember what is recited in your[1297] houses of Allah’s signs[1298], and wisdom; indeed, Allah has always been Subtle, All-Aware. 35 Indeed, Muslim men and Muslim women, and believing men and believing women, and devout men and devout women, and truthful men and truthful women, and patient men and patient women, and reverent men and reverent women, and charitable men and charitable women, and fasting men and fasting women, and men who preserve their private parts[1299] and women who (likewise) preserve, and men who remember Allah frequently and women who (likewise) remember—Allah has prepared for them forgiveness and a great reward. 36 It is not for any believing man or believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decreed a command, to have a choice in their affair. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, then he has strayed into evident misguidance. 37 And recall as you say to the one upon whom Allah had bestowed His grace, and upon whom yousg had (also) bestowed your grace, “Hold on to your spouse and be mindful of Allah,” while hiding within yourself what Allah was to reveal, and fearing mankind, whereas Allah is more worthy of your fear. Then when Zaid ended his relationship with her[1300], We married her to you, that there may be no blame on the believers regarding the spouses of their adopted sons when their relationship has ended, for the command of Allah has always been fulfilled. 38 Never has there been any blame on the Prophet regarding what Allah has ordained for him; such is Allah’s rule among those (prophets) who passed on before, and the command of Allah has always been a determined determination. 39 Those who proclaim the messages of Allah and fear Him and fear no one except Allah. And Allah is sufficient as a Reckoner. 40 Never has Muhammad been the father of any of yourpl men, but a Messenger of Allah and the seal[1301] of the prophets. And Allah has always been All-Knowing of everything. 41 O you who have attained faith, remember Allah with frequent remembrance, 42 and highly exalt Him morning and evening. 43 It is He Who blesses youpl, as do His angels[1302], to get you out of darkness(es) into light, and He has always been Merciful to the believers. 44 Their greeting on the day they meet Him is, “Peace.” And He has prepared for them a noble reward. 45 O Prophet, We have sent you as a witness and a bearer of glad tidings and a warner, 46 and  a caller to Allah by His leave and  an illuminating beacon. 47 And givesg the believers glad tidings that for them is a supreme grace from Allah. 48 And dosg not obey the deniers and the hypocrites, and ignore their hurtfulness, and place your trust in Allah, for Allah is sufficient as a Trustee. 49 O you who have attained faith, if you marry believing women but then divorce them before having touched[1303] them[1304], you have no right to expect a waiting period on their part. But compensate them and release them in a graceful manner. 50 O Prophet, We have permitted to you your spouses to whom you have given their dowries, and those whom you rightfully possess from what Allah has granted you, and the daughters of your paternal uncle, and the daughters of your paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncle, and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you, and a believing woman—if she grants herself to the Prophet[1305], if the Prophet wishes to marry her; (this is) exclusively for you, and not for the believers. We already know what We have ordained for them regarding their spouses and those whom they rightfully possess; this is to spare you any discomfort. And Allah has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 51 You may defer any of them you wish and receive any of them you wish, and should you desire any of those you had set aside, then no sin is committed by you. This is more proper, so that they are comforted and are not grieved, and are content with what you have brought them—all of them. And Allah knows what is within your hearts, for Allah has always been All-Knowing, Forbearing. 52 Yousg are not allowed (to marry) any further women, nor to exchange the spouses you have for others, even if you are impressed by their beauty, except for those whom you rightfully possess. And Allah has always been Watchful over everything. 53 O you who have attained faith, do not enter the houses of the Prophet unless you are given permission to come for a meal. And do not wait for its preparation, but when you are invited, then go in. And when you have eaten, disperse without seeking to remain for a talk. This used to hurt the Prophet, but he shied away from telling you, but Allah does not shy away from the truth. And when youpl ask them[1306] for something, ask them from behind a screen; that is cleaner for your hearts and their hearts. For it is not for you to hurt the Messenger of Allah, nor must you ever marry his spouses after him; that would indeed be (a) great (offense) with Allah. 54 Whether youpl disclose anything or hide it, indeed, Allah has always been All-Knowing of everything. 55 No sin is committed by them[1307] regarding their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers’ sons or their sisters’ sons or their women or those whom they rightfully possess. Yet be mindful[1308] of Allah; indeed, Allah has always been a Witness over everything. 56 Indeed, Allah and His angels give blessings[1309] to the Prophet. O you who have attained faith, pray for blessings upon him and greet him with a prayer of peace. 57 Indeed, those who hurt Allah and His Messenger— Allah has cursed them in the Earlier (Life) and the Hereafter, and has prepared for them a demeaning punishment. 58 And those who hurt believing men and believing women for acts they did not earn have surely burdened themselves with perjury and evident sin. 59 O Prophet, tell your spouses and your daughters and the women of the believers to make their outer garments hang low over them; that is more likely that they will be recognized and not hurt. And Allah has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 60 If the hypocrites do not desist, as well as those with sickness in their hearts and the rumormongers in the City (of Madinah), We will surely incite yousg against them; then they will not neighbor you in it except for a short while. 61 Accursed; wherever they are found, they should be captured and relentlessly killed outright. 62 Such has been Allah’s rule with those who passed on before, and yousg will never find any change in Allah’s rule. 63 People ask you about the Hour. Say, “Indeed, knowledge thereof rests only with Allah. But what could make yousg realize? Perhaps the Hour could be near.” 64 Indeed, Allah has cursed the deniers and has prepared for them a blaze, 65 abiding therein forever, finding neither ally nor supporter. 66 On the day when their faces are flipped in the Fire, they say, “If only we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger.” 67 And they said[1310], “Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters[1311] and our dignitaries, but they led us away from the way. 68 Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a supreme[1312] curse.” 69 O you who have attained faith, do not be like those who hurt Moses, though Allah cleared him of what they had said. And he has been well-esteemed with Allah. 70 O you who have attained faith, be mindful of Allah and speak for justice; 71 He will set aright your deeds for you and will forgive you your misdeeds. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger—then he has surely triumphed a great triumph. 72 Indeed, We offered the trust[1313] to the skies and the land and the mountains, but they refused to carry it and were apprehensive of it, but man carried it; he has always been constantly unjust, constantly ignorant. 73 That Allah may punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the polytheists, men and women. And (that) Allah may grant repentance to the believers and accept it from them, men and women, for Allah has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.

34. Sheba

34- Saba’

1 All praise be to Allah to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and all praise be to Him in the Hereafter, and He is the All-Wise, the All-Aware. 2 He knows what penetrates into the earth and what comes out of it, and what descends from the sky and what ascends to it, and He is the Bestower of mercy, the Oft-Forgiving. 3 Yet those who have denied have said, “The Hour is not coming upon us.” Saysg, “Yes indeed, by my Lord, the Knower[1314] of the hidden realm, it will come upon you.” Not an atom’s weight in the heavens or in the earth escapes His knowledge, nor anything smaller or larger, except that it is in an evident record[1315]— 4 that He may repay those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds; for those is forgiveness and noble provision. 5 Those who strove against Our signs, attempting to challenge[1316] (God) — those ones, for them is a painful punishment of torment[1317]. 6 And those who have received knowledge see that what was sent down to yousg from your Lord is the truth and guides to the path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy. 7 And those who have denied said, “Shall we point out to youpl a man who tells you that, once you are torn into shreds, you will surely be in a new creation?” 8 Did he invent a lie about Allah or is there madness in him? Rather, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in punishment and extreme misguidance. 9 Have they not seen what lies before them and behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We will[1318], We can make the earth cave in beneath them, or let fall down on them pieces[1319] from the sky; indeed, in that is a sign for every penitent servant. 10 And surely, We bestowed upon David grace from Us: “O mountains, echo with him (My praises), and you birds (too).” And We softened iron for him. 11 “Makesg coats of armor and measure the links well, and dopl righteousness[1320]; indeed I am All-Seeing of what youpl do.” 12 And for Solomon (I subjected) the wind[1321]—its morning course (reaching a distance otherwise attained in) one month, and its evening course (reaching a distance otherwise attained in) one month. And We made a spring of molten brass flow for him, and there would be unseen beings[1322] working under him by the leave of his Lord. But whoever of them would swerve from Our command, We would make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze. 13 They would make for him whatever he wished of sanctuaries, and statues, and bowls like pools, and heavy cauldrons. “O David’s folk, work in thankfulness.” But few of My servants are constantly thankful. 14 Then, when We decreed death for him, nothing indicated his death to them except the woodworm eating his staff. Then, when he fell down, it became clear[1323] to the unseen beings that, had they known what was hidden, they would not have remained in the demeaning punishment. 15 Surely, there used to be a sign for (the people of) Sheba in their residence[1324]: two gardens, on the right and on the left. “Eatpl of your Lord’s provision and give thanks to Him.” A good land and an Oft-Forgiving Lord. 16 But they disregarded (God), so We sent against them the torrent of the Arim (Dam), and We substituted for them their two gardens with two gardens of bitter crops and thorny shrubs and something of sparse lote-trees. 17 Thus We repaid them on account of how they denied, and do We (thus) repay[1325] anyone except the staunch denier? 18 And We made between them[1326] and the towns We had blessed[1327] visible towns, and We well determined the journey between.     “Journeypl between them safely by night and day.” 19 But they said, “Our Lord, lengthen[1328] the distances of our journeys.” Thus they were unjust to themselves, so We made them history and We scattered them in every direction; indeed, in this are signs for everyone who is most patient, constantly thankful. 20 And surely, Iblis[1329] confirmed[1330] his assumption about them. So they followed him, except for a group of believers. 21 And never did he have any authority over them, except that We may know the one who believes in the Hereafter from the one who is doubtful about it. And yoursg Lord is a Constant Preserver over everything. 22 Saysg, “Call upon those whom you claimed (to be gods) apart from Allah; they do not possess an atom’s weight in the heavens nor in the earth, and they do not have therein any association (with God), and He does not have any assistant from among them.” 23 And intercession cannot be of benefit before Him, except for one to whom He has given permission[1331]. Until, when fear has been dispelled[1332] from their hearts, they say[1333], “What did yourpl Lord say?” They say, “The truth; and He is the All-High, the Supreme.” 24 Saysg, “Who provides for youpl from the heavens and the earth?” Say, “Allah—and indeed, either you or we are rightly guided or in evident misguidance.” 25 Saysg, “Youpl will not be asked about the crimes we committed, nor will we be asked about what you do.” 26 Saysg, “Our Lord will bring us together, then He will legislate[1334] justly for us with the truth, for He is the Legislator[1335], the All-Knowing.” 27 Saysg, “Show me those you have attached to Him as associates. But no! Rather, He is Allah, the Almighty, the All-Wise.” 28 And We have not sent you but to the whole of mankind, as a herald of glad tidings and a warner, but the majority of mankind does not know. 29 Thus they say, “When is this promise due, if youpl are truthful?” 30 Saysg, “Youpl are promised a day which you can neither postpone for a while nor bring forward.” 31 Those who denied said, “We will never believe in this Recital[1336] nor in what came before it.” And if only yousg could see the unjust as they are brought to stand before their Lord, throwing back allegations at one another: those who had been deemed weak and oppressed say to the arrogant leaders, “Were it not for youpl, we would have been believers.” 32 The arrogant leaders said[1337] to those who had been deemed weak and oppressed, “Did we bar you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you yourselves were criminals.” 33 And those who had been deemed weak and oppressed said to the arrogant leaders, “Rather, it was your scheming by night and day as you used to command us to deny Allah and to set up rivals to Him.” Thus they hid their remorse when they saw the punishment. And We put the yokes around the necks of those who had denied. Are they being repaid except for what they used do? 34 And never have We sent a warner to any town except that its affluent said, “Indeed, we deny what youpl have been sent with.” 35 And they said, “We have more wealth and more children (than the believers), and never shall we be punished.” 36 Saysg, “Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whomever He wills and He restrains (it), but the majority of mankind does not know.” 37 And it is neither yourpl wealth nor your children that bring you closer in position to Us—except whoever has attained faith and has acted righteously, for for those[1338]  is a repayment of double (measure)[1339] for what they did, and in the Chambers[1340] (of Paradise) they remain safe. 38 But those who strove against Our signs[1341] attempting to challenge[1342] (God)—those are arraigned in the punishment. 39 Saysg, “Indeed, My Lord extends provision for whomever He wills of His servants and He restrains (it). And anything youpl spend (in His cause) He replaces it, and He is the Best of providers.” 40 And on the day when He herds[1343] them all together, then says to the angels, “Is it you that these used to worship?” 41 They said[1344], “Highly Exalted are You; You are our Ultimate Guardian, not them. Rather, they used to worship the unseen beings[1345]; most of them are believers in them.” 42 “So today youpl possess for one another neither benefit nor harm.” And We will say to those who did injustices, “Taste the punishment of the Fire in which you used to disbelieve.” 43 And when Our signs[1346] are read to them, evident, they say, “This is nothing but a man who wants to bar youpl from what your forefathers used to worship.” And they say, “This is nothing but a fabricated lie.” And the deniers said of the truth when it came to them, “This is nothing but evident sorcery.” 44 Yet never before had We given them any books to study, nor had We sent them any warner before yousg. 45 And those before them also disbelieved, and never did they attain even a tenth of what We gave them. And they disbelieved My messengers, so how terrible was My condemnation! 46 Saysg, “Indeed, I admonish youpl with one thing: that you rise up for Allah in pairs or individually, then reflect. There is no madness in your fellow. He is just a warner to you before the advent of a severe punishment.” 47 Saysg, “Whatever reward I have asked of youpl, it is yours; my reward comes only from Allah, and He is Witness over everything.” 48 Saysg, “Indeed, My Lord projects the truth. He is the Superb Knower of the hidden realms.” 49 Saysg, “The truth has come, while falsehood can neither originate nor restore.” 50 Saysg, “If I go astray, I go astray only to my own loss; but if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me; He is indeed All-Hearing, Near.” 51 And if yousg could only see when they were[1347] terrified and there was no escape, and they were seized from a nearby place. 52 And they said, “We have believed in it.” But how can they attain it from such a distant place 53 when they had denied it before[1348]? And they throw about conjectures regarding the hidden realm from such a distant place. 54 And a barrier was placed between them and what they desire, as was done formerly with their likes. Indeed, they were in disturbing doubt.

35. Originator

35- Fâtir

1 All praise be to Allah, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Maker of the angels as messengers with two and three and four wings. He adds to creation as He wills; indeed, Allah is Powerful over everything. 2 Whatever mercy Allah unfolds for mankind, none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds, none can release it thereafter.  And He is indeed the Almighty, the All-Wise. 3 O mankind, remember Allah’s blessing upon you. Is there a creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? There is no god but He, so how can you be averted (from the truth)? 4 And if they disbelieve yousg, surely messengers before you were also disbelieved. And to Allah all matters are returned[1349]. 5 O mankind, indeed the promise of Allah is true, so let not the Earlier Life deceive you, and let not the Deceiver deceive you regarding Allah. 6 Indeed, Satan is an enemy to youpl, so take him as an enemy; indeed, he only invites his party to be among the fellows of the Blaze. 7 For those who have denied is a severe punishment, while for those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds is forgiveness and a supreme reward. 8 What about the one whose evil deed was adorned for him and so he came to regard it as good? Allah misguides whomever He wills and He guides whomever He wills, so let not your self be wasted[1350] sorrowing over them; indeed, Allah is All-Knowing of what they do. 9 And Allah is the One Who sent the winds[1351], stirring up clouds, then We[1352] drove them to a lifeless land whereby We revived the earth after it had died; likewise is Resurrection. 10 Whoever wants might—to Allah belongs all might. To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work lifts it up. But as for those who scheme evil, there is a severe punishment, and the scheming of those is bound to fail. 11 And Allah created youpl from dust, then from a sperm drop, then He made you pairs. And no female carries or delivers except with His knowledge. And no person is given a long life or has his life cut short[1353] except that it is in a record[1354]; indeed, that is easy for Allah. 12 And the two waters are not equal: this one is fresh, sweet, good to drink, while this is salty, bitter. Yet from each youpl eat tender meat and extract jewelry which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through them, that you may seek of His grace, and that you may give thanks. 13 He causes the night to penetrate the day and He causes the day to penetrate the night, and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a stated term. Such is Allah, yourpl Lord; to Him belongs the dominion. But those you call upon apart from Him do not own so much as the mere skin of a date stone. 14 If youpl call upon them, they do not hear your call; and even if they heard, never would they respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection, they will reject your polytheism. And none informs yousg like One Who is all-aware. 15 O mankind, it is you who stand in need of Allah, while Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy. 16 If He wills, He can do away with youpl and bring about a new creation. 17 And that would not be too mighty for Allah. 18 And no bearer of burden bears the burden of another. And even if a heavily laden one calls for help with its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if the one called be a relative. You are only to warn those who fear their Lord, though unseen, and have established the prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself to his own benefit.  And to Allah is the destiny. 19 Not equal are the blind one and the one who can see, 20 nor are the darkness(es) and the light, 21 nor are the shade and the torrid heat, 22 nor equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allah causes whomever He wills to hear, but yousg cannot make those in the graves hear. 23 Yousg are only a warner. 24 Indeed, We have sent yousg with the truth, as a herald of glad tidings and a warner. And there is no community but a warner has passed through it. 25 And if they disbelieve yousg, those before them also disbelieved. Their messengers came to them with evident proofs and with the Books and with the illuminating Scripture. 26 Then I seized those who denied—so how terrible was My condemnation? 27 Have yousg not seen that Allah has sent down water from the sky, and with it We[1355] have brought out products of various colors? And in the mountains are streaks of white and red, varying in their hue, and pitch-black. 28 Likewise, human beings and animals and livestock come in various colors. Indeed, from among His servants, only the learned fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Almighty, Oft-Forgiving. 29 Indeed, those who read the Scripture of Allah and have established the prayer and have spent of what We have provided for them, secretly and publicly, expect a bargain that will not fail. 30 That He may render to them their rewards in full and increase them of His grace; He is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Ever Thankful. 31 And what We have revealed to yousg of the Scripture is the truth, confirming what preceded it. Allah is most surely All-Aware, All-Seeing of His servants. 32 Then We gave the Scripture as a heritage to those of Our servants whom We selected: so of them is one who is unjust to himself, and one who follows a middle course, and one who is a forerunner in good deeds—by Allah’s leave. That is what the great grace is. 33 Gardens of Eden which they enter[1356]; they are adorned therein with gold bracelets and pearls[1357], and their garments therein are of silk. 34 And they said[1358], “All praise be to Allah Who has lifted all sorrow from us; our Lord is most surely Oft-Forgiving, Ever Thankful. 35 He Who settled us in the Home of Everlasting Stay, by His grace, where neither toil touches us nor fatigue afflicts us.” 36 And those who have denied—for them is the fire of Hell wherein they are never finished off and thus die, nor is its punishment lightened for them. Thus We repay every staunch denier[1359]. 37 And they scream aloud therein, “Our Lord, get us out, that we may act righteously, unlike the way we used to act.” “Did We not give youpl a life long enough to take warning if you were going to? And the warner did come to you, so taste[1360], for there is no supporter for the unjust.” 38 Indeed, Allah is the Knower of the hidden realm of the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests. 39 It is He who made youpl successors on earth. So whoever denies—his denial is upon him, and the denial of the deniers adds only to their Lord’s loathing of them, and the denial of the deniers adds only to their perdition. 40 Say, “Have you regarded those associates of yours that you worship apart from Allah? Show me what they have created on earth.” Or do they have any share in the heavens? Or have We given them a scripture such that they rely on an evident proof[1361] from it? Rather, the unjust promise one another nothing but a deception. 41 Indeed, Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they vanish. And were they to vanish, there is none to hold them both except He; indeed, He has always been Forbearing, Oft-Forgiving. 42 And they swore by Allah their most solemn oaths: that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than any of the other communities. Yet when a warner came to them, it only increased them in aversion— 43 behaving arrogantly in the land and scheming evil. But evil scheming surrounds none but its people. So do they expect anything but the precedent of the ancients? For yousg will never find any change in Allah’s rule, and you will never find any deviation in Allah’s rule. 44 And have they not journeyed through the earth and observed the consequences for those before them, though they were superior to them in strength? But in no way could Allah be thwarted by anything in the heavens or in the earth. Indeed, He has always been All-Knowing, All-Powerful. 45 And if Allah were to hold mankind accountable for what they have earned, He would not leave a single treading creature on its surface. But He defers them for a stated term, and then when their term is due—indeed, Allah has always been All-Seeing of His servants.

36. Ya-Sîn

36- Yâ-Sîn

1 Ya-Sîn. 2 By the all-wise Recital[1362]. 3 Yousg are indeed of the emissaries 4 on a straight path. 5 (God bestowed it as) a bestowal[1363] from on high by the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy, 6 to warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are oblivious. 7 Certainly, most of them deserved the decree on them, for they refuse to believe. 8 Indeed, We placed shackles around their necks up to their chins, so that their heads are forced up. 9 And We placed a barrier in front of them and a barrier behind them, and thus We blocked their vision so they cannot see. 10 And it is the same for them whether yousg warn them or do not warn them—they believe not. 11 Indeed, yousg can only warn one who has followed the Reminder and has feared the All-Merciful though unseen—so give him glad tidings of forgiveness and a noble reward. 12 Indeed, We—We alone—revive the dead and write down what they have put forth and their traces. And everything have We tallied in an evident archive. 13 And setsg forth for them the parable of the fellows of the town when the Emissaries came to it— 14 when We sent them two persons but they disbelieved them, so We reinforced[1364] (them) with a third. Then they said, “Truly, We are emissaries sent to you.” 15 They said, “You are nothing but human beings like us, and the All-Merciful did not send down anything; you are only lying.” 16 They said, “Our Lord knows that we are indeed emissaries sent to you, 17 and our only duty is evident proclamation.” 18 They said, “We see an evil omen in youpl; if you do not give up, we will most surely stone you, and a painful punishment from us will most surely afflict you.” 19 They said, “Your evil omen is within yourselves. Can it be that it is because you were reminded[1365]? Rather, you are an extremist people!” 20 And there came a man rushing from the farthest end of the city. He said, “O my people, follow the emissaries. 21 Follow those who do not ask youpl any reward, and are themselves guided. 22 And why should I not worship the One Who originated me, and to Whom youpl are returned[1366]? 23 Shall I take other gods apart from Him? If the All-Merciful wants harm for me, their intercession does not avail me at all, nor can they rescue me. 24 In that case, I should indeed be in evident misguidance. 25 Indeed, I have attained faith in yourpl Lord, so listen to me.” 26 It was said, “Enter the Garden (of Paradise).” He said, “Oh if only my people could know 27 how my Lord has forgiven me and made me one of the honored!” 28 And after him, We sent down no soldiers from heaven to his people, nor would We ever send any down. 29 It was just[1367] a single Shout, and suddenly they were extinct. 30 Alas for the servants! No messenger comes to them but they ridicule him. 31 Have they not seen how many generations We annihilated before them—that they will not return to them? 32 And none of them[1368] but will be arraigned before Us, all together. 33 And there is a sign for them in the lifeless land: We have revived it and have brought out from it grains, so from it they eat. 34 And We have made in it gardens of palm-trees and grapevines, and have caused springs to burst forth in it, 35 that they may eat from its produce and (from) what[1369] their hands have made[1370].
