So will they not give thanks? 36 Highly Exalted is He Who created all pairs—of what the earth germinates and of their own selves[1371] and of what they do not know. 37 And a sign for them is the night: We strip the day out of it—and they are suddenly in darkness. 38 And the sun runs towards its destination; such is the determining of the Almighty, the All-Knowing. 39 And We have determined the moon[1372] in phases until it returned like an old palm-branch. 40 The sun is not to overtake the moon, nor is the night to outpace the day, and each floats in an orbit. 41 And a sign for them is that We carried their offspring[1373] in the laden ship, 42 and We created for them the like of it in which they ride. 43 And if We will, We can drown them—with no screaming to be heard from them, nor will they be rescued, 44 except by a mercy from Us and enjoyment for a while. 45 And when it is said to them, “Be mindful of what lies before you and what lies behind you, that you may receive mercy” . . .[1374] 46 Yet never does a sign of their Lord’s signs come to them, but they disregard it. 47 And when it is said to them, “Spend of what Allah has provided for you,” those who deny say to those who have attained faith, “Shall we feed someone whom Allah could feed, if He so wills? You are but in evident misguidance.” 48 And they say, “When will this promise be, if youpl are truthful?” 49 All they can expect is a single Shout, which will take them away while they feud, 50 so that they will neither be able to make a will nor return to their own people. 51 And the trumpet was blown[1375], whereupon they walked quickly out from the tombs to their Lord. 52 They said, “Woe to us! Who has resurrected us from our resting place?” This is what the All-Merciful has promised, and the emissaries have spoken the truth.” 53 It was just[1376] a single Shout, and suddenly they were all arraigned before Us. 54 So today no soul is dealt with unjustly in the least, and youpl are not repaid except for what you used to do. 55 Indeed, today the fellows of the Garden (of Paradise) are happily busy, 56 they and their spouses, in shades[1377], reclining on couches. 57 For them are fruits therein, and for them is whatever they call for. 58 “Peace”—a word from a Lord Bestowing of mercy. 59 But step aside today, you criminals. 60 Did I not covenant with you, O Children of Adam, that you shall not worship the devil—indeed, for you he is an evident enemy— 61 and that you shall worship Me? This is a straight path. 62 Yet he has certainly led a great multitude of you astray. Did you not use reason? 63 This is Hell which youpl were promised. 64 Roast in it today on account of how you used to deny. 65 Today, We put a seal upon their mouths, and their hands speak to Us, and their feet testify to whatever they used to earn. 66 And if We will, We can obliterate their eyes, then they race with each other to (find) the Path—but how will they see? 67 And if We will, We can disfigure them right in their place[1378], so that they can neither move forward nor go back. 68 And to whomever We give long life, We reverse his development—so will they[1379] not reason? 69 And never did We teach him[1380] poetry, nor is it proper for him; it is but a Reminder and an Evident Recital[1381]— 70 so that it may forewarn[1382] whoever is alive, and so that God’s decree may be deserved by the deniers. 71 Have they not seen that We have created for them, of Our Handiwork, livestock, so that they are their owners? 72 And We made them manageable by them, so some they ride and some they eat. 73 And they have in them other benefits and drinks, so will they not give thanks? 74 Yet they have taken to themselves gods other than Allah, that perhaps they may be supported. 75 They cannot support them, even if they are arraigned for them as an army. 76 So let not their words sadden yousg. Indeed, We know whatever they keep secret and whatever they make public. 77 Has man not regarded that We created him from a sperm-drop? Yet he became an evident adversary, 78 and he set forth a parable for Us and forgot his own creation. He said, “Who can revive the bones when they have decayed?” 79 Saysg, “He who initiated them the first time revives them, for He is All-Knowing of every creation.” 80 He who made fire for youpl out of green trees, so that with them you kindle. 81 Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth capable[1383] of creating the like of them? Yes indeed, and He is the All-Creating, the All-Knowing. 82 Indeed, His only command once He has desired anything is to say to it, “Be,” and so it is[1384]. 83 So Highly Exalted is the One in Whose hand is the dominion of everything, and to Him yousg are returned[1385].

37. The Aligned

37- As-Sâffât

1 By those aligned, lined up in ranks. 2 Then by the propellers propelling firmly. 3 Then by the readers of a Reminder— 4 indeed, yourpl God is surely One, 5 Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and Lord of the Easts. 6 Indeed, We have adorned the lowest[1386] heaven with an adornment, the planets[1387], 7 and as a protection against every defiant devil. 8 They cannot eavesdrop[1388] on the Higher Assembly, for they get bombarded from every side— 9 repelled, and they will have an unremitting punishment, 10 except for one who snatched a fragment and was then pursued by a piercing meteor. 11 So inquiresg of them, “Are they more difficult to create, or the others We created?” Indeed, We created them from sticky clay. 12 Rather, yousg were amazed[1389] as they ridicule. 13 And when reminded, they remember not. 14 And when they see a sign, they exaggerate in ridiculing 15 and say, “This is nothing but evident sorcery. 16 Can it be that when we have died and become dust and bones, can it be that[1390] we will really be resurrected? 17 And[1391] our ancient forefathers?” 18 Saysg, “Yes indeed, and you will be totally subdued.” 19 It is but a single nudge, and there they are looking on (in bewilderment)! 20 And they said[1392], “Woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense.” 21 “This is the Day of Decision which youpl used to deny. 22 Herdpl those who were unjust and their spouses, and what they used to worship 23 apart from Allah, and guide them to the path to purgatory. 24 And stop them—indeed, they are to be questioned.” 25 “What is the matter with youpl that you do not help one another?” 26 Rather, on this day, they are submissive. 27 And they cameg to one another, asking one another. 28 They[1393] said, “Indeed, youpl used to come at us from the right[1394]” 29 They[1395] said, “Rather, youpl yourselves were not believers, 30 and we had no authority over you; rather, you yourselves were a people who exceeded all limits. 31 And therefore we deserved our Lord’s decree on us. Most surely we will all get a taste, 32 for we deluded youpl; indeed, we were deluded.” 33 So on that day, they are indeed partners in the punishment. 34 This is what We do with the criminals. 35 Indeed, when it was said to them, “There is no god except Allah,” they would act arrogantly 36 and say, “Are we really to abandon our gods for a mad poet?” 37 In fact, he came with the truth, and he confirmed the emissaries. 38 Most surely, youpl will taste the painful punishment, 39 and in no way will you be repaid except for what you used to do, 40 except for Allah’s sincere chosen[1396] servants. 41 For those, there is a known provision: 42 fruits, and they are honored 43 in the Gardens of Bliss, 44 on couches facing one another. 45 A drink is passed round among them from a flowing spring: 46 white, a delight to those who drink, 47 no headiness in it, nor by it are they[1397] drained[1398]. 48 And with them are bashful maidens with lovely eyes, 49 as if they were closely guarded eggs. 50 So they came[1399] to one another, asking one another. 51 One of them said, “Indeed, I did have a comrade 52 who would say, ‘Can it be that yousg are really of those who believe? 53 Can it be that when we have died and become dust and bones, can it be that[1400] we will really be called to account?’” 54 He said (to his companions in Paradise), “Can youpl view (him)?” 55 Then he viewed (him) and saw him in the midst of purgatory. 56 He said, “(I swear) by Allah, yousg almost ruined me. 57 And were it not for the blessing of my Lord, I would have been of the arraigned.” 58 “Are we (then) not to die 59 except for our first death? And are we never to be punished?” 60 It is most surely this which is the great triumph. 61 For the like of this let the workers work. 62 Is this a better hospitality or the Tree of Zaqqum[1401]? 63 Indeed, We have made it a means of trial for the unjust. 64 Indeed, it is a tree that comes out from the very origin of purgatory. 65 Its yield is as if it were devils’ heads. 66 So they are sure to eat from it and fill their bellies with it. 67 Then, on top of it, they will have a brew of scalding water. 68 Then their return is sure to be to purgatory. 69 Indeed, they found their forefathers astray, 70 so they rush along in their footsteps. 71 And certainly, most of the ancients before them went astray. 72 And certainly, We sent among them forewarners. 73 So looksg at what the outcome was for those who were warned, 74 except for Allah’s sincere chosen[1402] servants. 75 And certainly, Noah called out to Us, so the very excellent of responders are We! 76 Thus We delivered him and his family from the great calamity, 77 and We made his offspring the sole survivors, 78 and We left him thus to be remembered among later generations. 79 Peace be upon Noah among (all creatures of) all realms. 80 Indeed, thus do We repay those who excel in doing good. 81 Indeed, he is one of Our believing servants. 82 Then We drowned the others. 83 And, indeed, of his kind is Abraham. 84 Recall when he came to his Lord with a sound heart. 85 He said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping? 86 Is it false gods, instead of Allah, that youpl want? 87 So what is yourpl opinion about the Lord of all realms?” 88 Then he took one look at the stars 89 and said, “I am sick.” 90 So they turned away from him, fleeing, 91 whereupon he turned to their gods and said, “Will youpl not eat? 92 What is it with youpl? Do you not speak?” 93 Then he turned on them, striking with his right hand. 94 So they came towards him, dashing[1403]. 95 He said, “Do you worship what you carve, 96 when Allah has created youpl and all that you do?” 97 They said, “Build a structure for him and throw him into purgatory.” 98 So they desired to plot against him, but We made them the lowest. 99 And then he said, “I am going to my Lord—He will guide me.” 100 “My Lord, give me one of the righteous.” 101 So We gave him glad tidings of a forbearing boy. 102 Then, when he was old enough to accompany him, he said, “O my child, I see in a dream that I am sacrificing you, so look—what do you see[1404]?” He said, “O my father, do as you are commanded; you will find me, Allah willing, of the patient ones.” 103 Then, when theydl had submitted and he laid him down on his forehead, 104 We then called out to him, “O Abraham! 105 Yousg have truly fulfilled the vision.” Thus indeed do We repay those who excel in doing good. 106 Indeed, this was certainly the evident test. 107 And We redeemed him with a great sacrifice, 108 and We left him thus to be remembered among later generations: 109 “Peace be upon Abraham.” 110 Thus We repay those who excel in doing good. 111 Indeed, he is one of Our believing servants. 112 And We gave him glad tidings of Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous. 113 And We blessed him and Isaac. But of their offspring is one who excels in doing good and one who is evidently unjust to himself. 114 And We certainly conferred Our favor upon Moses and Aaron, 115 and We delivered themdl and their people from the great calamity. 116 And We supported thempl, so they were the overcomers. 117 And We gave themdl the evidential Scripture, 118 and We guided themdl upon the straight path. 119 And We left themdl thus to be remembered among later generations: 120 “Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.” 121 Thus do We repay those who excel in doing good. 122 Indeed, they are of Our believing servants. 123 And Elijah is indeed one of the emissaries. 124 Recall when he said to his people, “Will you not be mindful (of God)? 125 Do youpl call upon Baʻl[1405] and leave the best of creators— 126 Allah, your Lord[1406] and the Lord of your ancient fathers?” 127 But they disbelieved him, and thus they will certainly be arraigned, 128 except for Allah’s sincere chosen[1407] servants. 129 And We left him thus to be remembered among later generations: 130 “Peace be upon Elijah[1408].” 131 Thus do We repay those who excel in doing good. 132 Indeed, he is one of Our believing servants. 133 And Lot is indeed one of the emissaries. 134 Recall when We delivered him and all of his family, 135 except for an old woman[1409] who lingered behind. 136 Then We annihilated the others. 137 And most surely youpl pass by them in the morning 138 and at night. Do you not reason? 139 And Jonah is indeed one of the emissaries. 140 Recall when he fled to the overloaded ship, 141 and he drew lots and was of those who lost. 142 Then the whale took him into its mouth, and he was to blame. 143 And had he not been one of those who highly exalt God, 144 he would have stayed in its belly until the day they are resurrected. 145 Then We threw him into the wilderness while he was sick, 146 and We germinated a gourd tree over him. 147 Then We sent him to a hundred thousand or more. 148 And they attained faith, so We gave them enjoyment for some time. 149 So inquiresg of them, “Are the daughters for yoursg Lord while for them are the sons?” 150 Or did We create the angels as females while they witnessed?” 151 Undoubtedly, it is out of their utter falsehood that they do indeed say, 152 “Allah has begotten.” But they are most surely liars. 153 Has He selected daughters over sons? 154 What is it with youpl? How do you judge? 155 Will you not remind[1410] yourselves? 156 Or do youpl have an evident manifestation? 157 Then bring yourpl scripture, if you have been truthful. 158 And they invented a relationship between Him and (the race of) unseen beings[1411]. And certainly, (the race of) unseen beings knew that they (who made the claims) would surely be arraigned— 159 Highly Exalted is Allah far above what they describe— 160 except for Allah’s sincere chosen[1412] servants. 161 Thus surely, youpl and what you worship 162 can never seduce (anyone) away from Him, 163 except for one who is to roast in purgatory. 164 “And there is not one of us[1413] but has an assigned position. 165 And we are indeed the aligned. 166 And we are indeed those who exalt God.” 167 Even though they[1414] used to say, 168 “Had we received a Reminder from the ancients[1415], 169 we would have been Allah’s sincere chosen servants.” 170 But they denied it, so they will find out. 171 And most surely Our Word has already gone out to our servant emissaries: 172 indeed, it is they who shall surely be supported, 173 and indeed it is Our soldiers who shall surely be the overcomers. 174 So turnsg away from them for some time, 175 and watch them—for they will soon see. 176 Do they seek to hasten Our punishment? 177 Yet, when it descends into their courtyard, miserable shall be the morning of those forewarned[1416]. 178 And turnsg away from them for a while, 179 and watch—they will soon see. 180 Highly Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of Might, far above what they describe. 181 And peace be upon the emissaries. 182 And all praise be to Allah, Lord of all realms.

38. Sād

38- Sâd

1 Sād. By the Recital[1417] containing the Reminder. 2 Yet those who denied are in a state of might[1418] and opposition. 3 How many generations have We caused to perish before them, so they called out when it was too late to escape! 4 And they marveled that a forewarner had come to them from among them, and the deniers said, “This is a sorcerer, a sheer liar. 5 Did he make all the gods into one God? Surely this is indeed something strange.” 6 And the chiefs among them proceeded, (saying), “Walk away (from the Prophet) and hold fast to yourpl gods; indeed this is certainly something planned. 7 Never have we heard of this in the former creed. This is nothing but an invention. 8 Was the Reminder sent down to him out of all of us?” Rather, they are doubtful about My Reminder; rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment. 9 Or do they possess the treasuries of yoursg Lord’s mercy, the Almighty, the Giver? 10 Or do they possess the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend by any means. 11 An army of confederates will be defeated there. 12 Before them the people of Noah disbelieved, as did ʻĀd[1419], and Pharaoh of the stakes, 13 and Thamûd[1420] and the people of Lot and the fellows of the thicket. Those were the parties. 14 None of them but disbelieved the messengers, so My punishment was deserved. 15 For these await nothing but a single shout, from which there is no recovery. 16 Yet they said, “Our Lord, hasten for us our share of punishment before the Day of Reckoning.” 17 Enduresg patiently what they say and remember Our servant David who was endowed with strong faith; indeed, he often turns[1421] to Us. 18 Indeed, We subjected the mountains to give due exaltations (to God) with him in the evening and at daybreak, 19 with the birds made to flock, each often turning to Him. 20 Thus We strengthened his dominion and brought him wisdom and decisive speech. 21 And has the tiding of the disputants reached yousg, as they climbed the sanctuary— 22 as they entered upon David, and he was startled by them? They said, “Do not fear; two disputants, one of whom has oppressed the other. So judge between us with the truth and do not be untrue, and guide us to the right path.” 23 “Indeed, this is my brother; he has ninety-nine ewes and I have just one ewe, and he said, ‘Entrust it to me,’ and he pressured me with words.” 24 He said, “He has done yousg wrong by asking your ewe in addition to his ewes, and indeed many partners do oppress one another— except those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds, but these are so few.” And David realized that We were testing him, so he sought forgiveness from his Lord and fell down to his knees and turned penitent. 25 So We forgave him that, and indeed there is most surely for him nearness to Us and a beautiful place to return to. 26 “O David, We have appointed you as a viceroy in the land, so judge between mankind with the truth and do not follow the whim, lest it misguide you from the way of Allah. Indeed, for those who stray from the way of Allah there is a severe punishment for their having forgotten the Day of Reckoning.” 27 And in no way have We created the heaven and the earth and whatever is between them in vain. That is the assumption of those who have denied. So woe to those who have denied from the Fire! 28 Or are We to make those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds equal to those who spread corruption in the earth? Or are We to make the people who are mindful (of God) equal to the wicked? 29 A Scripture that We sent down to yousg, blessed, that they[1422] may ponder its signs[1423] and that those endowed with understanding may remind themselves. 30 And to David We gave Solomon, an excellent servant; indeed, he often turns[1424] to Us. 31 Recall when the beautiful horses were paraded before him in the evening, 32 so he said, “Indeed, I have loved the good things with a love more than the remembrance of my Lord, until it[1425] disappeared behind the veil (of night). 33 Bringpl them back to me.” And he started to stroke their legs and necks. 34 And surely, We tested Solomon and cast a body on his throne, then he turned penitent. 35 He said, “My Lord, forgive me and grant me a dominion never to be attained by anyone after me; indeed, You— only You—are the Giver.” 36 So We subjected to him the wind[1426], flowing gently by his command wherever he directed; 37 and the demons—every builder and diver; 38 and others bound together in fetters. 39 “This is Our gift, so givesg generously or withhold, without measure.” 40 And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a beautiful place to return to. 41 And recall Our servant Job, when he called out to his Lord, “Satan has touched me with toil and suffering.” 42 “Stamp your foot—this is a cool washing-place and drinking-place.” 43 And We gave him back his family and doubled them—a mercy from Us and a reminding for those endowed with understanding. 44 “And take with yoursg hand a bundle of grass, and strike with it so as not to breach (your oath).” Indeed, We found him patient. What an excellent servant; indeed, he often turnsa unto Us. 45 And recallsg Our servants[1427] Abraham and Isaac and Jacob—those endowed with strong faith and with sight(s). 46 Surely We distinguished them with a distinct quality[1428]—the remembrance of the (final) Home. 47 And indeed, to Us they are of the elect, the outstanding. 48 And recallsg Ishmael and Elisha and Ezekiel—and all are of the outstanding. 49 This is a Reminder. For indeed, for the mindful (of God) is a beautiful place to return to: 50 the Gardens of Eden, with their doors wide-open for them, 51 relaxing therein and calling for abundant fruit and beverage. 52 And with them are bashful maidens of equal age. 53 This is what you[1429] are promised for the Day of Reckoning. 54 Indeed, such is Our provision, inexhaustible. 55 All this. But indeed, for those who exceed all limits is a miserable place to return to: 56 Hell, in which they roast—so what a miserable resting place! 57 All this, so let them taste it—scalding water and purulence. 58 And another[1430] (torment) similar to it, of diverse kinds. 59 “This is a crowd rushing headlong with youpl.” They are not welcome; indeed, they are to be roasted in the Fire. 60 They said, “But it is youpl who are not welcome! It is you who brought it upon us! So what a miserable end!” 61 They said, “Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us, give him double punishment in the Fire.” 62 And they said, “What is it with us that we do not see men whom we used to count among the villains? 63 Did we take them with mockery[1431], or have our sight(s) swerved from them? 64 Indeed, that is certainly true: the disputing among the inhabitants of the Fire. 65 Saysg, “Indeed, I am only a forewarner, for there is no god except Allah—the One, the Subduer, 66 Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Almighty, the Forgiver.” 67 Saysg, “It is a great tiding 68 which youpl disregard. 69 I have had no knowledge of the Highest Assembly as they disputed. 70 It is only revealed to me that[1432] I am an evident warner.” 71 Recall when Yoursg Lord said to the angels, “Indeed, I am creating a human being from clay. 72 So when I have formed him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall prostrate before him. 73 So the angels fell prostrate, all of them, entirely— 74 but not Iblis[1433]; he acted arrogantly and became one of the deniers. 75 He said, “O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating before what I created with My Own hands? Have you acted arrogantly, or have you become one of the exalted?” 76 He said, “I am better than him; You created me from fire and created him from clay.” 77 He said, “Then get out of it, for you are indeed an outcast! 78 And indeed, My curse is upon you until the Day of Recompense.” 79 He said, “My Lord, then reprieve me until the day they are resurrected.” 80 He said, “Then indeed, you are of those reprieved 81 until the Day of the Time Appointed.” 82 He said, “Then, by Your majesty, I will most surely delude them all, 83 except for your sincere chosen[1434] servants among them.” 84 He said, “So the truth[1435] is—and only the truth I say— 85 I will surely fill Hell with yousg and with whoever of them who follows you, all together.” 86 Saysg, “I ask of you no reward for this, and I am not a pretender. 87 It is but a Reminder to (all creatures of) all realms. 88 And youpl will certainly know its tiding after a while.”

39. Throngs

39- Az-Zumar

1 The bestowal of the Scripture from on high is by Allah the Almighty, the All-Wise. 2 Indeed, We have sent down to yousg the Scripture with the truth, so worship Allah, devoting religion to Him. 3 Undoubtedly, faithful religion is due to Allah! And those who take guardians apart from Him—(they say,) “We only worship them so that they may bring us closer to Allah.” Indeed, Allah will judge between them regarding whatever they used to differ over. Indeed, Allah does not guide one who is a liar, a relentless denier. 4 Had Allah desired to have a child, He would have selected whatever He so willed from whatever He created. Highly Exalted is He; He is Allah, the One, the Subduer. 5 He created the heavens and the earth with truth; He rolls the night around the day, and He rolls the day around the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a stated term. Undoubtedly, He is the Almighty, the Forgiving. 6 He created youpl from a single self, then made from it its spouse, and sent down to you of livestock eight kinds in pairs. He creates you in your mothers’ bellies, one act of creation after another, in threefold darkness(es). That is Allah, yourpl Lord; to Him belongs the dominion; there is no god but Him, so how then are you turned away? 7 If youpl deny, then indeed Allah is Self-sufficient without (any need of) you, yet He does not approve denial on the part of His servants, and if you are thankful He approves it for you. And no bearer of burden bears the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, whereupon He informs you of what you used to do; indeed, He is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests. 8 And when some harm touches man, he calls upon his Lord, in penitence to Him. But then, when He confers on him a blessing of His, he forgets what he was previously calling upon for, and he sets up rivals to Allah in order to make (people) stray[1436] from His way. Say, “Enjoy yoursg denial for a little while; you are one of the fellows of the Fire.” 9 Or what[1437] about one who worships devoutly during the watches of the night, prostrating himself and standing up, wary of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord? Saysg, “Are those who know and those who do not know equal?” Indeed, only those endowed with understanding remind themselves. 10 Saysg (on My behalf), “O My servants who have attained faith, be mindful of your[1438] Lord. For those who do good in this Earlier (Life) is goodness, and Allah’s land is vast. Indeed, the patient ones will be rendered their reward in full without measure.” 11 Saysg, “Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allah, devoting religion to Him, 12 and I was commanded to become the first of the Muslims[1439].” 13 Say, “I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a great day.” 14 Saysg, “It is Allah I worship, devoting my religion to Him.” 15 “So worshippl whatever you wish apart from Him.” Saysg, “Indeed, the losers are those who lost themselves and their people on the Day of Resurrection.” Undoubtedly, that is the evident loss. 16 They have layers of fire above them, and layers beneath them. That is how Allah puts fear into His servants. “O My servants, therefore, be mindful of Me!” 17 And those who avoided false masters—that they should worship them, and turned  to Allah  in penitence—for them are glad tidings. So givesg glad tidings to My servants 18 who listen to what is said and follow the best of it; those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the people of understanding. 19 What about the one who has deserved the decree of punishment? Is it yousg who (can) rescue those in the Fire? 20 But those who were mindful of their Lord—for them are compartments above which are compartments built high, with rivers flowing beneath them: the promise of Allah; Allah never breaks a promise. 21 Have youpl not seen that Allah has sent down water from the sky, then He made it flow into springs in the earth, then He brings out with it vegetation of various colors, then they wither and you see them yellowing, then He turns them into debris? Indeed, in this is a reminding for the people of understanding. 22 What about someone whose chest Allah has expanded to (accept) Islam, so that he follows a light from His Lord? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah; those are in evident misguidance. 23 Allah has bestowed the most beautiful of all teachings from on high: a Scripture consistent and paired. The skins of those who fear their Lord shiver from it, then their skins and their hearts soften up to the remembrance of Allah. Such is Allah’s guidance; He guides with it whomever He wills. But whomever Allah misguides, no guide shall there ever be for him. 24 What about someone who covers his face against the terrible punishment of the Day of Resurrection? And it was said[1440] to the unjust, “Taste what youpl used to earn.” 25 Those before them disbelieved, so the punishment came up to them from where they were unaware. 26 So Allah made them taste disgrace in the Earlier Life, and surely the punishment of the Hereafter is more grievous, if they only knew. 27 And surely, We have put forth in this Recital[1441] for mankind all kinds of parables, that they may remind themselves: 28 an Arabic Recitalb, free from any distortion, that they may become mindful (of God). 29 Allah set forth the parable of a man owned by quarreling associates, and a man belonging exclusively to one man. Are they equal in status? All praise be to Allah. But most of them do not know. 30 Yousg will certainly die, and they will certainly die. 31 Then certainly on the Day of Resurrection you will dispute with one another in the presence of your Lord. 32 So who is more unjust than one who lied about Allah and disbelieved the truth when it came to him? Is there not in Hell a dwelling for the deniers? 33 But the one who came with the sincere belief and sincerely believed in it—those[1442] are the mindful (of God). 34 For them, with their Lord, is whatever they will; such is the repayment for those who excel in doing good. 35 So that Allah may remit the worst of what they have done and repay them their reward in accordance with the best of what they used to do. 36 Is not Allah enough for His servant[1443]? And they (seek to) frighten yousg with those apart from Him. Thus whomever Allah misguides, no guide shall there ever be for him. 37 And whomever Allah guides, for him there is no misleader. Is Allah not Almighty, Capable of vengeance? 38 And if yousg asked them, “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they would say, “Allah.” Say, “Have youpl seen those whom you call upon apart from Allah? If Allah desired any harm for me, would they be capable of preventing His harm? And if He desired a blessing for me, would they be capable of preventing His mercy?” Say, “Allah suffices for me; those who trust, place their trust in Him.” 39 Say, ‘My people, act according to your position[1444]; surely, I am also acting (according to mine). Then you shall come to know 40 who will receive a punishment that disgraces him, and upon whom a perpetual punishment shall fall.” 41 Indeed, We have sent down the Scripture upon yousg for mankind with the truth. So whoever seeks guidance does so to his own benefit, while whoever goes astray—he only does so to his own detriment, and you are not a trustee over them. 42 Allah takes up the selves at the time of their death, and those that have not died (He takes up) during their sleep. Then He retains those for which He has decreed[1445] death and releases the others to (fulfill) a stated term. Most surely, in that are signs for people who reflect. 43 Or have they chosen intercessors other than Allah? Saysg, “Even though they have no power over anything, nor do they reason?” 44 Saysg, “All intercession is up to Allah; to Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, then to Him youpl are returned[1446].” 45 And when Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are disgusted. But when those apart from Him are mentioned, they promptly start anticipating glad tidings. 46 Saysg, “Our God, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest, You judge between Your servants regarding whatever they used to differ over.” 47 If those who were unjust owned whatever is in the earth, all together, and the like of it with it, they would (seek to) redeem themselves with it from the terrible punishment on the Day of Resurrection. But there appeared[1447] to them from Allah what they never anticipated. 48 And there appeared to them the evil deeds of whatever they had earned, and so they became surrounded by what they used to ridicule. 49 And when harm touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We grant him a blessing from Us, he says, “I have been brought it solely because of (my) knowledge.” Rather, it is a means of trial, but most of them do not know. 50 Those before them previously said that, but what they used to earn did not avail them, 51 so they were afflicted by the evil deeds of whatever they had earned. And the unjust among these will also be afflicted by the evil deeds of whatever they have earned, and in no way can they thwart (God). 52 Have they not come to know that Allah extends provision for whomever He wills, and He restrains (it)? In that are signs for people who believe. 53 Saysg, “O My servants who have gone to extremes against themselves: despair not of Allah’s mercy, for indeed Allah forgives all misdeeds; indeed, He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Bestower of mercy.” 54 And turn penitent to yourpl Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you and you are not supported. 55 And follow the best of what was sent down to youpl from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you are unaware. 56 So that no soul may say, “Alas, for having neglected my duty towards Allah and for having been of the mockers.” 57 Or it may say, “Had Allah guided me, I would have been of the mindful (of God).” 58 Or it may say, when it sees the punishment, “If only I had another chance, I would be of those who excel in doing good.” 59 Yes indeed! My signs did come to yousg, but you disbelieved in them and acted arrogantly and were of the deniers. 60 And on the Day of Resurrection yousg see those who told lies about Allah with their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell a dwelling for the arrogant? 61 And Allah delivers[1448] those who were mindful (of Him) to their place[1449] of triumph; no harm touches them, nor do they grieve. 62 Allah is the Creator of everything, and He is the Ultimate Trustee over everything. 63 To Him belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth. But those who have denied the signs of Allah—it is they who are the losers. 64 Saysg, “Is it other than Allah, then, that you command me to worship, you ignorant ones?” 65 And it was revealed to yousg and to those before you that if yousg associate (others with God), your work will certainly be nullified, and you will certainly be of the losers. 66 Rather, worship Allah and be of the appreciative. 67 Yet they did not render to Allah the respect that He deserves, for the entire earth is in His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens are folded in His right. Highly Exalted is He and Most High beyond the associations they make. 68 And the Trumpet was blown[1450], so all who were in the heavens and the earth were stunned, except whomever Allah willed. Then it was blown another time, whereupon they all stood looking on. 69 And the earth shone with the Light of its Lord, and the record[1451] was placed, and the prophets and the witnesses[1452] were brought in, and it was judged between them in truth, and they were not dealt with unjustly. 70 And every soul was fully compensated for what it had done, for He knows better what they do. 71 And those who denied were driven to Hell in throngs, until, when they had reached it, its gates were opened[1453] and its keepers said to them, “Did not messengers from among you come to you, reading to you the signs[1454] of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this day of yours?” They said, “Yes, indeed!” But the word of punishment proved true against the deniers. 72 It was said, “Enter the gates of Hell, abiding therein.” So how miserable is the dwelling of the arrogant! 73 And those who were mindful of their Lord were driven to the Garden (of Paradise) in throngs, until, when they had reached it and its gates were opened[1455] and its keepers said to them, “Peace be upon you, you have been good, so enter it, to abide.” 74 And they said, “All praise be to Allah Who has fulfilled His promise to us and made us inherit the land, enjoying the Garden (of Paradise) as we please.” So how excellent is the reward of the workers! 75 And yousg see[1456] the angels hovering around the Throne, exalting their Lord with praise. And it was judged between them equitably, and it was said, “Praise be to Allah, Lord of all realms.”

40. Forgiver

40- Ghâfir

1 Ha, Mīm. 2 The bestowal of the Scripture from on high is by Allah the Almighty, the All-Knowing, 3 the Forgiver of (every) misdeed and the Granter and Accepter of repentance, the Severe in punishment, the Bountiful in bounty; there is no god but He; to Him is the ultimate return. 4 None argues against Allah’s signs except those who have denied, so dosg not be deceived by their movement in the land. 5 Before them the people of Noah disbelieved, as did the parties after them. And every community sought after their[1457] messenger in order to capture him, and they argued using falsehood to defeat with it the truth. But I seized them, so how was My punishment! 6 Thus yoursg Lord’s Word[1458] came true against those who denied: that they are the fellows of the Fire. 7 Those who carry the Throne and those around it exalt their Lord with praise and believe in Him and ask for forgiveness for those who have attained faith: “Our Lord, You have encompassed everything in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way, and protect them from the punishment of purgatory. 8 Our Lord, and enter them into the Gardens of Eden which You have promised them—and the righteous among their forefathers and their spouses and their offspring(s); indeed, it is You, You (alone), who are the Almighty, the All-Wise. 9 And shield them from evil deeds, for whomever You shield from evil deeds on that day, You have had mercy on him. And that is the great triumph.” 10 Indeed, those who denied will be addressed, “The loathing of Allah is greater than your loathing of yourselves—for you were invited to the faith, but you refused.” 11 They said[1459], “Our Lord, you caused us to die twice, and you gave us life twice. Now we have acknowledged our misdeeds, so is there any way out?” 12 That is because whenever Allah alone was called upon, youpl denied. But if others are associated with Him, you believe. But judgment rests with Allah the All-High, the Supreme. 13 It is He who shows youpl His signs and bestows[1460]—from on high—provision from heaven for you. But none reminds himself except whoever is penitent. 14 So callpl upon Allah, devoting religion to Him, even if the deniers hate it. 15 Exalted in degrees (of rank), Owner of the Throne—He casts the spirit (of inspiration) by His command upon whomever He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Encounter: 16 the day when they emerge; nothing about them is hidden from Allah. “To whom does the dominion belong today?” “To Allah, the One, the Subduer.” 17 Today, every soul is repaid for what it has earned. There is no injustice today; indeed, Allah is Swift in reckoning. 18 And warnsg them of the Day of the Inevitable Event, when hearts are at throats, while they block them[1461]. The evildoers will have neither intimate (friend) nor intercessor to be obeyed. 19 He knows the treacherous look of the eyes and whatever the chests hide. 20 And Allah decrees with the truth, while those whom they[1462] call upon apart from Him do not decree at all. Indeed, it is Allah who is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. 21 Have they not journeyed through the earth and looked at how the outcome was for those before them? They were superior to them[1463] in strength and in the traces which they left in the land, but Allah seized them for their misdeeds, for they had no shield from Allah. 22 That is because their messengers used to come to them with evident proofs, but they denied, so Allah seized them. He is All-Powerful, Stern in retribution. 23 And We sent Moses with Our signs and an evident manifestation 24 to Pharaoh and Hamān and Qarun, but they said, “A sorcerer, a sheer liar.” 25 Then when he came to them with the truth from Us, they said, “Kill the sons of those who have attained faith with him and keep their women alive (in bondage).” But the plotting of the deniers can only go astray. 26 And Pharaoh said, “Let me kill Moses, and let him call upon his Lord; indeed, I am afraid that he may exchange yourpl religion or that he may cause corruption to appear[1464] in the land.” 27 And Moses said, “I have sought refuge with my Lord and yourpl Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.” 28 And a believing man from Pharaoh’s folk who had concealed his faith said, “Do youpl kill a man for saying, ‘My Lord is Allah,’ and he has come to you with evident proofs from your Lord? If he is a liar, then his lying is upon him. But if he is truthful, then some of what he promises you will befall you; indeed, Allah does not guide anyone who is an extremist, a sheer liar. 29 O my people, yours is the dominion today, prevailing in the land. But who will help us against Allah’s chastisement, should it fall upon us?” Pharaoh said, “I do not show youpl except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the way of prudence.” 30 But the one who had attained faith said, “O my people, I fear for you the like of the Day of the Parties— 31 like the custom of the people of Noah and ʻĀd[1465] and Thamûd[1466] and those after them. For Allah wants no injustice for the servants. 32 O my people, I fear for you the Day of Calling Out— 33 the day when you turn away, fleeing, with no safeguard from Allah. And whomever Allah misguides, no guide shall there ever be for him. 34 And surely Joseph did come to youpl with the evident proofs, but you continued to doubt what he came to you with, until when he perished, you said, “Allah will never send a messenger after him.” Thus Allah misguides whoever is an extremist, constantly doubting. 35 Those who argue against Allah’s signs without any manifestation having come to them—this is most loathsome to Allah and to those who have attained faith; thus Allah seals the heart[1467] of every arrogant compeller. 36 And Pharaoh said, “O Hamān, build me a tower, that I may reach the means— 37 the means of the heavens, so that I may view[1468] the God of Moses, though I surely think he is a liar.” And thus Pharaoh’s evil deeds were adorned for him and he was barred[1469] from the way, for Pharaoh’s plotting is in nothing but ruin. 38 And the one who had attained faith said, “O my people, follow me and I will guide you to the way of prudence. 39 O my people, this Earlier Life is nothing but (fleeting) enjoyment, while the Hereafter is indeed the Home of Permanence. 40 Whoever has committed an evil deed will not be repaid except with its like, but whoever has acted righteously, whether male or female, while a believer—then those shall enter[1470] the Garden (of Paradise) where they shall be provided for without measure. 41 And O my people, how is it that I call you to salvation and you call me to the Fire? 42 Youpl call me to deny Allah and associate with Him what I have no knowledge of, while I call you to the Almighty, the Forgiver. 43 Without doubt, what youpl call me to has no say in the Earlier (Life) or in the Hereafter, and that our turning back is to Allah, and that it is the extremists who are the fellows of the Fire. 44 Youpl will remember what I am telling you. So I entrust my affairs to Allah; indeed, Allah is All-Seeing of the servants.” 45 So Allah shielded him from the evils of their scheming, while an awful punishment surrounded Pharaoh’s folk: 46 the Fire—they are exposed to it in the early morning and at nightfall, and on the day the Hour takes place (it is said): “Enterpl Pharaoh’s folk[1471] into the most intense punishment.” 47 And as they debate in the Fire, the weak say to the arrogant leaders, “Indeed, we were followers of yours, so will you now spare us a portion of the Fire?” 48 The arrogant leaders said[1472], “We are all in it; indeed, Allah has judged between the servants.” 49 And those in the Fire said to the keepers of Hell, “Call upon your Lord to lighten one day of the punishment for us.” 50 They said, “Did not your messengers come to you with evident proofs?” They said, “Yes.” They said, “Then call.” But the calling of the deniers is but in vain. 51 Most surely, We support Our messengers and those who have attained faith in the Earlier Life and on the day when all sorts of witnesses arise— 52 the day when the excuses of the unjust do them no benefit, and for them is the curse, and for them is the worst (final) Home. 53 And certainly We gave Moses the guidance and made the children of Israel inherit the Scripture, 54 as guidance and a reminding for those endowed with understanding. 55 So be patientsg; indeed the promise of Allah is true. And ask forgiveness for yoursg misdeed and exalt your Lord with praise evening and morning. 56 Indeed, those who argue against Allah’s signs without any manifestation having come to them—there is nothing in their chests but a feeling of greatness which they will never attain. So seeksg refuge in Allah; indeed, it is He who is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. 57 The creation of the heavens and the earth is certainly greater than the creation of humanity, but the majority of mankind does not know. 58 And in no way are the blind and the seeing equal, nor are those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds (equal) to the evildoer. How little you[1473] remind yourselves! 59 Indeed, the Hour is coming—no doubt about it—but the majority of mankind does not believe. 60 Yet your Lord has said, “Call upon Me (and) I will respond to you. Indeed, those who are too arrogant to serve Me will enter[1474] Hell in humiliation.” 61 It is Allah Who made the night for youpl, that you may rest therein, and the day allowing sight; indeed, Allah is certainly Gracious towards mankind, but the majority of mankind does not give thanks. 62 Such is Allah, yourpl Lord, Creator of everything; there is no god except Him, so how can you be averted (from the truth)? 63 Thus are averted those who used to repudiate the signs of Allah. 64 It is Allah who made the earth a habitat for youpl, and the sky a structure, and He designed you and perfected your designs, and He provided you with the good things. Such is Allah, your Lord, so supremely blessed be Allah, Lord of all realms. 65 He is the Living One; there is no god except He, so callpl upon Him, devoting religion to Him. All praise be to Allah, Lord of all realms. 66 Saysg, “Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those whom youpl call upon apart from Allah, now that the evident proofs have come to me from my Lord. And I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of all realms.” 67 It is He Who created youpl from dust, then from a drop of semen, then from a clinging form, then He brings you out as infants, then He lets you attain your full strength, then you become elderly—although some of you are taken (at death) sooner—and that you may reach a predetermined age, and so that you may reason. 68 It is He who gives life and death, so whenever He decrees a matter, He only says to it, “Be,” and so it is[1475]. 69 Have yousg not seen those who argue regarding Allah’s signs? How are they turned away? 70 Those who disbelieved the Scripture and what We sent Our messengers with, for they will come to know 71 when the yokes are around their necks, as well as the chains, as they are dragged 72 into the scalding water, then in the Fire they are seethed. 73 Then it was said[1476] to them, “Where are those you used to associate 74 apart from Allah?” They said, “They have strayed from us. In fact, we were calling upon nothing before.” Thus Allah misguides the deniers. 75 “That is on account of how youpl used to rejoice on earth in untruth and on account of how you used to behave with vanity. 76 Enterpl the gates of Hell, abiding therein. So how miserable is the dwelling of the arrogant!” 77 So be patientsg; indeed, the promise of Allah is true. So whether We show you some of what We have promised them or take you up to Us, to Us they are returned[1477]. 78 And surely We sent messengers before yousg, some of whose stories We related to you, and some We did not. And it was never for any messenger to bring about a sign except by Allah’s leave. So when the command of Allah comes, matters are decreed between them with fairness, and there and then the advocates of falsehood will lose. 79 It is Allah who made livestock for youpl, that you may ride some of them and of some you eat. 80 And in them you have benefits, and through them you satisfy a need within your chests, and on them and on ships you are carried. 81 And He shows youpl His signs, so which of Allah’s signs do you deny? 82 Have they not journeyed through the earth and looked at how the outcome was for those before them? They were superior to them in strength and in the traces which they left in the land, but what they had achieved availed them nothing. 83 When their messengers came to them with evident proofs they rejoiced in the knowledge they had, so they became surrounded by what they used to ridicule. 84 Then when they witnessed Our chastisement they said, “We believe in Allah alone and we deny what we used to associate with Him.” 85 But their faith could not help them once they witnessed Our chastisement; such has been Allah’s rule in (dealing with) His servants, and there and then did the deniers lose.

41. Detailed

41- Fussilat

1 Ha Mīm. 2 A bestowal from on high by the All-Merciful, the Bestower of mercy— 3 a Scripture whose signs[1478] were detailed as an Arabic Recital[1479] for people who know. 4 A herald of glad tidings and a warner, but most of them disregard (it), so they do not hear. 5 And they said, “Our hearts are screened from what yousg call us to, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a barrier. So do what you want, and so will we.” 6 Saysg, “I am only a human being like youpl. To me it is revealed that your god is One God. So be upright towards Him and seek forgiveness from Him.” And woe to the polytheists— 7 those who do not bring about the purifying act[1480], and regarding the Hereafter they are deniers. 8 Indeed, those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—for them is an unfailing reward. 9 Say, “Can it be that youpl really deny the One Who created the earth in two (heavenly) days and attribute rivals to Him? That is the Lord of all realms.” 10 And He made therein firm mountains on top of it, and He blessed it and determined its sustenance in four days, equal,[1481] for those who ask. 11 Then He settled[1482] to the heaven while it was smoke, and said to it and to the earth, “Come, willingly or reluctantly.” They said, “We have come willingly.” 12 So He decreed them as seven heavens in two days, and He revealed within each heaven its command. And We adorned the lowest[1483] heaven with lamps, and for preservation; that is the determining of the Almighty, the All-Knowing. 13 But if they disregard (you), then saysg, “I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt of ʻĀd[1484] and Thamûd[1485].” 14 Recall when their messengers came to them from before them and from behind them, saying, “Do not worship anyone but Allah.” They said, “Had our Lord willed, He would have sent down angels; therefore, of what you are sent with, we are deniers.” 15 So, as for ʻĀd, they turned unjustifiably arrogant in the land and said, “Who is more powerful than us?” Had they not seen that Allah, who created them, is more powerful than them? And they used to repudiate Our signs, 16 so We sent upon them a screaming wind for a few days of unrelenting misfortune, to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the Earlier Life. But the punishment of the Hereafter is surely more disgraceful, and they will not be supported. 17 But as for Thamûd, We had guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance. So the thunderbolt of the degrading punishment seized them on account of what they used to earn. 18 Meanwhile, We delivered those who had attained faith and had been mindful (of God). 19 And the day when Allah’s enemies are herded[1486] into the Fire in an organized manner— 20 until, when they reach it, their hearing and their sight(s) and their skins testify against them regarding what they used to do. 21 And they say to their skins, “Why did you testify against us?” They say, “Allah, Who made everything speak, made us speak.” It is He Who created youpl the first time, and to Him you are returned[1487]. 22 And youpl were unable to hide yourselves in a way that neither your hearing nor your sight(s) nor your skins were prevented from testifying against you, and you thought that Allah does not know much of what you do. 23 And it is that thought of yours about yourpl Lord that led you to ruin—so you became of the losers. 24 So even if they endure patiently, the Fire is (still) a dwelling for them; and if they ask to make amends, they will not be allowed to amend. 25 And We assigned for them comrades who then adorned for them what was before them and what was behind them, and the Word came to pass against them among communities of unseen beings[1488] and humans that passed away before them; indeed, they were losers. 26 Those who denied said, “Do not listen to this recitation[1489] and speak noisily during it so that youpl may overcome.” 27 We will certainly make those who have denied taste a severe punishment, and We will certainly repay them for the worst of what they used to do. 28 Such is the repayment of Allah’s enemies—the Fire; therein for them is the Home of Eternity, a repayment on account of how they used to repudiate Our signs. 29 And those who denied said, “Our Lord, show us those two (groups) which misguided us—among unseen beingsa and humankind—so that we can trample them both under our feet so they become of the lowest.” 30 Indeed, those who said: “Our Lord is Allah,” and then led a righteous life—the angels descend upon them: “Do not fear and do not grieve, but have glad tidings of the Garden (of Paradise) which you were promised. 31 We are your allies in the Earlier Life and in the Hereafter, and you have therein whatever your (inner) selves desire, and for you therein is whatever you claim, 32 as hospitality from One Who is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.” 33 And who is better in speech than one who called to Allah and did righteousness and said, “I am of the Muslims[1490]”? 34 For good and evil are never equal. Repel (evil) with that which is better, and thereupon the one between whom and yousg is enmity becomes like an intimate ally. 35 But none receives it except those who were patient, and none receives it except the very fortunate. 36 And if yousg are ever spurred by a spurring from Satan, take refuge with Allah; indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. 37 And of His signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon. Do not prostrate yourselves to the sun nor to the moon, but prostrate yourselves to Allah Who created them, if it is Him that you worship. 38 But if they act arrogantly, then those in the presence of yoursg Lord highly exalt Him with praise night and day, and never do they tire. 39 And of His signs is that yousg see the land still[1491], but when We send down water upon it, it shakes and swells[1492]. Indeed, He Who revived it will certainly revive the dead; indeed, He is All-Powerful over everything. 40 Indeed, those who blaspheme Our signs are not hidden from Us. Is one who is cast into the Fire better, or one who comes safely on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you wish; He is All-Seeing of what you do. 41 Indeed, those who denied the Reminder when it came to them . . .[1493]—whereas it is indeed a mighty Scripture 42 which falsehood cannot approach from before it or behind it—a bestowal from on high by One Who is Wise, Praiseworthy. 43 Nothing is said to yousg but was said to the messengers before you. Indeed, yoursg Lord is certainly Possessor of forgiveness and Possessor of painful retribution. 44 Had We made it a Recital[1494] in a foreign language, they would have said, “If only its signs[1495] were detailed.” A foreign language while (the messenger is) an Arab? Saysg, “For those who have attained faith, it is guidance and healing. But as for those who do not believe—there is deafness in their ears, and it is blindness upon them. Those are being called out from a distant place.” 45 And surely, We brought Moses the Scripture, but it was differed upon. And were it not for a word that had preceded from yoursg Lord, judgment would have been decreed between them. But indeed, they are surely in perplexing doubt concerning it. 46 Whoever acts righteously does so to his own benefit, while whoever commits evil does so to his own detriment. And yoursg Lord is never a tyrant unto the servants. 47 To Him is referred (all) knowledge of the Hour. And no products[1496] come out of their sheaths nor does any female carry or deliver but with His knowledge. And on the day when He calls out to them, “Where are My associates?” They said[1497], “We declare to You, none of us is a witness.” 48 And whatever they used to call upon earlier strayed away from them, and they realized that there was no escape for them. 49 Man never tires of supplication for good things, but if evil touches him, he becomes despairing, despondent. 50 And if We do let him taste a mercy from Us after an adversity that has touched him, he will surely say, “This is mine, and I do not think that the Hour is coming. And even if I am returned to my Lord, I will have the very best with Him.” We will inform those who denied of what they did, and We will make them taste a harsh punishment. 51 And when We bestow Our blessings upon Man, he disregards (Us) and distances himself. But when evil touches him, he has lengthy supplication. 52 Saysg, “Have youpl seen? If it is from Allah and then you deny it—who is more misguided than he who is in profound discord?” 53 We will show them Our signs in the horizons and in themselves until it becomes evident to them that He[1498] is the Truth. Is it not sufficient that yoursg Lord is witness over everything? 54 Undoubtedly, they do regard the meeting with their Lord with skepticism. Undoubtedly, He is indeed All-Encompassing of everything.

42. Consultation

42- Ash-Shûrâ

1 Ha Mīm. 2 ’Ayn Sîn Qaf. 3 Thus reveals[1499]—to yousg and to those before you—Allah the Almighty, the All-Wise. 4 To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the All-High, the Great. 5 The heavens almost splinter[1500] from above them, while the angels exalt their Lord with praise and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Undoubtedly, Allah is indeed the Oft-Forgiving, the Bestower of mercy. 6 And those who take guardians apart from Him—Allah is a Constant Preserver over them, for yousg are not a trustee over them. 7 And thus We revealed to yousg an Arabic Recital[1501], that you may warn the Mother of Towns[1502] and those around it and warn of the Day of Assembly, of which there is no doubt: a group in the Garden (of Paradise) and a group in the Blaze. 8 And had Allah willed, He could have made them one community, but He enters into His mercy whomever He wills, while the unjust have neither ally nor supporter. 9 Or have they taken others as guardians apart from Him? Yet Allah is the Ultimate Guardian, and He gives life to the dead, and He is All-Powerful over everything. 10 And whatever matter youpl differ over— its judgment rests with Allah. “Such is Allah, my Lord; in Him I have placed my trust and to Him I turn penitently.” 11 The Originator of the heavens and the earth; He has made for you spouses from among yourselves, and of the animals mates[1503], by means of which He multiplies you. The like of Him has nothing like him, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. 12 To Him belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whomever He wills and He restrains (it); indeed He is All-Knowing of everything. 13 He legislated for youpl the same religion He enjoined upon Noah, and what We revealed to yousg, and what We enjoined upon Abraham[1504] and Moses and Jesus: “You shall establish the religion and not be disunited therein.” To the polytheists, outrageous is what you call them to. Allah chooses to Himself whomever He wills, and He guides to Himself whoever is penitent. 14 And they did not become disunited except after knowledge had come to them, thereby oppressing one other. And were it not for a word that had preceded from yoursg Lord (to defer judgment) to a stated term, judgment would have been decreed between them. And indeed, those who were made to inherit the Scripture after them are in grave doubt about it. 15 So, because of that, gosg on calling, and be upright as you have been commanded, and do not follow their whims, and say, “I have attained faith in what Allah has sent down in every Scripture, and I have been commanded to judge between you equitably. Allah is our Lord and your Lord; we have our deeds and youpl have your deeds; there is no debate between us and you; Allah will bring us together, for to Him is the destiny.” 16 And those who continue to debate about Allah after He has been responded to—their argument is invalid with their Lord, and upon them falls wrath, and for them is a severe punishment. 17 It is Allah who sent down the Scripture with the truth, and the Balance[1505]. But what could make yousg realize that perhaps the Hour is near? 18 Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it, but those who have attained faith are apprehensive of it and know it to be the truth. Undoubtedly, those who cast doubts about the Hour are most surely far astray. 19 Allah is Subtle towards His servants; He provides for whomever He wills, and He is the All-Powerful, the Almighty. 20 Whoever wants the harvest of the Hereafter—We increase for him his harvest, and whoever wants the harvest of the Earlier (Life)—We give him thereof, yet he has no share of the Hereafter. 21 Or is it that they have associates who have legislated for them as religion that which Allah has not given permission? And were it not for the conclusive decision, it would have been settled between them. For indeed, there is a painful punishment for the unjust. 22 Yousg see the unjust apprehensive of what they have earned, and it is sure to befall them. But those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds are in the meadows of the Gardens (of Paradise). For them is whatever they will in the presence of their Lord; that is what the supreme grace is. 23 Those are the glad tidings Allah gives to His servants who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds. Saysg, “I ask of you no reward for it except the genuine love offered among those of kinship.” And whoever scores a good deed, We will increase its goodness for him; indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Ever Thankful. 24 Or do they say, “He has fabricated lies about Allah.” Yet if Allah so willed, He could seal yoursg heart. But Allah erases falsehood and upholds the truth by His Words; indeed, He is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests. 25 And it is He who accepts the repentance of His servants, and pardons evil deeds, and knows what youpl do[1506]; 26 and He responds (to) those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds, and He increases them of His grace. But for the deniers is a severe punishment. 27 And if Allah were to extend provision for His servants, they would oppress (others) on earth. Rather, He bestows[1507] from on high in precise measure whatever He wills; indeed, regarding His servants, He is All-Aware, All-Seeing. 28 And it is He who bestows[1508] rain from on high, after they have despaired, and unfolds His mercy, and it is He Who is the Ultimate Guardian, the Praiseworthy. 29 And of His signs are the creation of the heavens and the earth and the treading creatures He has spread throughout them, for He is All-Able to gather them at will. 30 And whatever disaster befalls youpl—it is because of what your hands have earned, yet He pardons much. 31 And youpl cannot thwart (God) on earth, and apart from Allah you have neither ally nor supporter. 32 And of His signs are the ships sailing the sea like flags. 33 If He wills, He can still the wind[1509], leaving them motionless on its surface; indeed, in that are signs for everyone who is most patient, constantly thankful. 34 Or He can wreck them on account of what they have earned, yet He pardons much— 35 so that those who dispute Our signs may know[1510] that there is no escape for them. 36 So whatever you are given of anything is only an enjoyment of the Earlier Life, but what Allah has is better and more lasting for those who have attained faith and in their Lord they have placed their trust; 37 and those who avoid the gravest[1511] of sins and obscenities, and if they feel wrathful, they (then) forgive; 38 and those who responded to their Lord and established the prayer, and whose affairs are conducted by mutual consultation, and of what We[1512] have provided them they spend; 39 and those who, when oppression befalls them, defend themselves. 40 And the repayment of an evil deed is an evil deed equivalent to it. But whoever has pardoned and made reconciliation—his reward lies with Allah; indeed, He does not love the unjust. 41 And for one who has defended himself after being dealt with unjustly—on those[1513] there is no blame. 42 Rather, blame lies on those who do injustice to mankind and commit unjustified aggression in the land; for those is a painful punishment. 43 But whoever has endured patiently and has forgiven—that is certainly a sign of real resolve. 44 And whoever Allah misguides has no guardian apart from Him. And yousg see the unjust when they have seen the punishment, saying, “Is there a way of going back?” 45 And yousg see them exposed to it[1514], reverent with humility, looking with a stealthy glance. And those who had attained faith said[1515], “Indeed, the losers are those who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection.” Undoubtedly, the unjust are indeed in a lasting punishment. 46 And they had no allies to support them against Allah. And whomever Allah misguides has no way out. 47 Respond to yourpl Lord before there comes from Allah a day that cannot be turned back. You will have neither refuge on that day, nor possibility of denial. 48 But if they disregard (you)—We have not sent yousg as a constant preserver over them; your only duty is proclamation. And indeed, whenever We let man taste a mercy from Us, he rejoices in it. But when something evil befalls them as a consequence of what their hands have put forth, then man is indeed a staunch denier. 49 To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates whatever He wills. He grants females to whomever He wills, and He grants males to whomever He wills. 50 Or He pairs them, males and females, and He makes whomever He wills barren; indeed, He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful. 51 And it is not for any human that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veil or by sending[1516] a messenger to reveal by His permission whatever He wills; indeed, He is All-High, All-Wise. 52 And thus have We revealed a spirit to yousg by Our command. Yousg did not know what the Scripture was nor what faith was, but We made it a light with which We guide whomever We will of Our servants. And most surely, you guide to a straight path— 53 the path of Allah to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Undoubtedly, to Allah are destined all commands.

43. Decorations

43- Az-Zukhruf

1 Ha Mīm. 2 By the Evident Scripture, 3 indeed, We made it an Arabic Recital[1517], that youpl may reason. 4 And indeed, it is with Us in the Source of Scriptures, all-high, all-wise. 5 So shall We ignore reminding youpl, for having been[1518] an extremist people? 6 And how many a prophet did We send to the ancients! 7 Yet not a prophet came to them but that they used to ridicule him. 8 Thus We annihilated people more powerful than them, and so the example of the ancients has passed away. 9 And were yousg to ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth?” They would say, “The Almighty, the All-Knowing created them.” 10 He Who made the earth a cradle[1519]  for youpl and traced in it ways for you, that you may be guided. 11 And He Who sent down water from the sky in due proportion, whereby We revived a lifeless land; thus youpl are brought out[1520]. 12 And He Who created all pairs and provided youpl with ships and livestock on which you ride, 13 that youpl may mount their backs then remember the blessing of your Lord as you settle upon them and say, “Highly Exalted is the One Who has subjected this to us, and in no way could we have done it by ourselves, 14 and indeed to our Lord we are certainly returning.” 15 Yet they ascribed to Him a portion of His servants. Surely, man is indeed an evidently staunch denier. 16 Or has He chosen for Himself daughters from what He creates, and favored youpl with sons? 17 Yet when one of them is given glad tidings[1521] of what he ascribed to the All-Merciful, his face becomes dark as he suppresses his anguish, 18 (thinking) “What! Someone brought up[1522] amid adornments and, in conflict, cannot be evident?”[1523]  19 And they considered the angels, who are servants[1524] of the All-Merciful, to be females. Did they witness[1525] their creation? Their claim will be recorded and they will be asked. 20 And they said, “Had the All-Merciful willed, we would not have worshiped them.” But they have no knowledge of that; they are merely conjecturing. 21 Or have We brought them a scripture prior to this one[1526] , so that they are adhering to it? 22 Rather, they said, “Indeed, we found our forefathers on a course[1527], and indeed we are being guided in their footsteps.” 23 Likewise, We sent no warner before yousg to any town but its affluent ones said, “Indeed, we found our forefathers on a courseb, and indeed we are following in their footsteps.” 24 He would say[1528], “Even if I[1529] have come to youpl with better guidance than what you found your forefathers following?” They would say, “Indeed, we deny what youpl are sent with.” 25 Thus We took retribution on them, so looksg at what the outcome was for the disbelievers. 26 And recall when Abraham said to his father and his people, “I am innocent of what you worship 27 except for the One Who originated me, for He will guide me.” 28 And he made it an enduring word in his posterity, so that they may return. 29 Yet I let these and their forefathers enjoy (life) until the truth and an evident messenger came to them. 30 But when the truth came to them, they said, “This is sorcery, and indeed we are deniers of it.” 31 They also said, “If only this Recital[1530] had been sent down to any great man from the two towns[1531].” 32 Is it they who allocate the mercy of yoursg Lord? It is We who have allocated their livelihood in the Earlier Life. And We elevated some of them by degrees above others, that some of them may employ one another in service. But your Lord’s mercy is better than what they hoard. 33 Were it not that humanity would become a single (ungodly) community, We would have provided those who deny the All-Merciful with roofs[1532] of silver to their houses, and stairways (of silver) by which they ascend, 34 and doors (of silver) to their houses, and furnishings on which they recline, 35 and (golden) decorations. Yet all that is nothing[1533] but the enjoyment of the Earlier Life, whereas the Hereafter with yoursg Lord is for the ones who are mindful (of God). 36 And whoever shuns the remembrance of the All-Merciful, We assign[1534] for him a Satan who then becomes his comrade. 37 And indeed, they certainly bar them from the way, though they think they are guided. 38 Until, when he comes to Us, he says, “If only there were between me and yousg the distance of the two easts.” What a miserable comrade! 39 Yet never will it benefit youpl on that day, since you have committed injustices, that you are partners in the punishment. 40 Can yousg make the deaf hear, or guide the blind and one who has been in evident misguidance? 41 So We will either take yousg away, then surely wreak vengeance upon them, 42 or We will surely show you what We have promised them, for indeed We have absolute power over them. 43 So adheresg to what has been revealed to you; indeed you are upon a straight path. 44 And indeed it is surely a message for yousg and for your people, and youpl will be asked. 45 And ask those of Our messengers We sent before yousg: “Did We appoint gods apart from the All-Merciful to be worshiped?” 46 And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, so He said, “Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of all realms.” 47 Yet, as soon as he came to them with Our signs, they promptly started laughing at them, 48 even though each sign We showed them was more supreme than its counterpart, and We took hold of them with the punishment, that possibly they would return. 49 And they said (to Moses), “O sorcerer, pray to your Lord for us according to His covenant with you, and then we will surely be guided.” 50 But when We lifted the punishment from them, they promptly broke their promise. 51 And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, “O my people, do I not have the dominion over Egypt, and are these rivers not flowing beneath me? Do you not see? 52 Or am I not better than this one who is despicable and can barely express himself? 53 So, if only some bracelets of gold had been cast on him, or if angels had come with him in comradeship!” 54 Thus he fooled his people, and they obeyed him; indeed they were a defiantly disobedient people. 55 So when they displeased Us, We took vengeance on them and We drowned them all. 56 So We made them a precedent[1535] and an example for later people. 57 And when the son of Mary was set forth as an example, yoursg people promptly clapped[1536] him 58 and said, “Are our gods better, or he?” They cited him only for argument; in fact, they are a quarrelsome people. 59 He is but a servant whom We blessed, and We made him an example for the children of Israel. 60 And had We willed, We would have made from among youpl angels to be successors on earth. 61 And indeed he[1537] is a portent of the Hour, so never bepl skeptical about it and follow Me; this is a straight path. 62 And let not Satan bar youpl; indeed, he is an evident enemy to you. 63 And when Jesus came with the evident proofs, he said, “I have come to youpl with wisdom, and to clarify for you some of what you differ over, so be mindful of Allah and obey me. 64 Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him; this is a straight path.” 65 But the parties differed among themselves, so woe to those who committed injustices from the punishment of a painful day. 66 Are they only waiting for the Hour to come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware? 67 On that day, close friends will be enemies to one another, except for the ones who were mindful (of God). 68 O My servants, no fear shall be upon you today, nor shall you grieve. 69 Those who believed in Our signs[1538] and were Muslims[1539]: 70 enter the Garden (of Paradise), you and your spouses, filled up with joy. 71 They are served around with trays of gold and cups, and therein is whatever is desired[1540] by the selves and delights the eyes, and therein youpl abide. 72 And that is the Garden (of Paradise) youpl were made[1541] to inherit on account of what you used to do. 73 For youpl therein is abundant fruit from which you eat. 74 Indeed, the criminals abide in the punishment of Hell 75 which is never palliated for them, and in it they are devastated. 76 Yet in no way did We do them injustice, but it was they who were the unjust. 77 And they criedf, “O Malek[1542], let your Lord finish us off.” He said, “You are staying. 78 We certainly came to you with the truth, but most of youpl are hateful of the truth.” 79 Or have they contrived to do something? So indeed, We too are contriving. 80 Or do they think that We cannot hear their secret and their private conversations? Yes indeed, Our messengers are by them, writing down. 81 Saysg, “If the All-Merciful had a child[1543], I would be the first of (his) worshipers.” 82 Highly Exalted is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, beyond what they describe. 83 So leavesg them to blunder and play until they meet[1544] their day which they are promised. 84 And it is He who in the heaven is God, and in the earth is God, and He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing. 85 And supremely blessed be the One to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and Who alone has knowledge of the Hour, and to Whom youpl are returned[1545]. 86 And those they call upon apart from Him are incapable of intercession, except those who testify to the truth knowingly. 87 And surely if you asked them, “Who created them?” they would certainly say, “Allah.” So how can they be averted (from the truth)? 88 And (God hears) his[1546] statement: “My Lord, indeed, these are people who do not believe.” 89 Then grantsg them amnesty and say, “Peace.” For they[1547] shall come to know.

44. Smoke

44- Ad-Dukhân

1 Ha Mīm. 2 By the Evident Scripture, 3 We have indeed sent it down on a blessed night[1548].
