Indeed, We have always been warning. 4 On it, every wise command is distinguished— 5 a command from Us; indeed, We have always been sending 6 mercy from yoursg Lord—indeed, it is He who is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing— 7 (from the) Lord[1549] of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if youpl (can ever) believe with certitude. 8 There is no god but He; He gives life and causes death—yourpl Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers. 9 Yet they play around in doubt. 10 So waitsg and watch out for the day when the sky produces evident smoke 11 that overwhelms mankind; this is a painful punishment. 12 “Our Lord, lift the punishment from us; we are truly believers.” 13 But how can the reminding benefit them when an evident messenger had already come to them, 14 then they turned away from him and said, “(He is) taught (by others), a madman!” 15 Indeed, if We lift off the punishment a little, youpl will revert. 16 On the day when We assault with the biggest onslaught, We will indeed wreak vengeance upon them. 17 And surely before them We tested the people of Pharaoh when a noble messenger[1550] came to them, 18 saying, “Hand over Allah’s servants to me; indeed, I am to youpl a trustworthy messenger. 19 And do not consider yourselves to be above Allah; indeed, I come to you with an evident manifestation. 20 And I have indeed sought refuge with my Lord and yourpl Lord lest you stone me. 21 Thus if youpl do not believe in me, just keep away from me.” 22 Then he called upon his Lord—that these people are criminals. 23 (Then His Lord commanded,) “Journey with My servants by night; indeed, youpl will be followed. 24 And leavesg the sea parted (behind you); indeed, they are an army to be drowned.” 25 How many gardens and springs did they leave behind, 26 as well as vegetation(s) and a noble domicile 27 and a blessing they used to enjoy? 28 So it was. And We made another people inherit it. 29 So neither heaven nor earth wept over them, nor were they reprieved. 30 And surely, We delivered the Children of Israel from the demeaning punishment— 31 from Pharaoh; indeed, he was of the extremists. 32 And We chose them knowingly over all communities, 33 and gave them of the signs that which was an evident test. 34 Indeed, these people surely say, 35 “There is nothing but our first death, for we will not be resurrected. 36 So bringpl back our forefathers, if you are truthful!” 37 Are they better, or the people of Tubbaʻ[1551] and those before them? We annihilated them; indeed, they were criminals. 38 And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them to play. 39 We did not create them except with truth, but most of them do not know. 40 Indeed, the Day of Decision is the appointed time for them all— 41 a day when no patron will avail a protégé in any way, and they cannot be supported, 42 except for one upon whom Allah has had[1552] mercy; indeed, He is the Almighty, the Bestower of mercy. 43 Indeed, the Tree of Zaqqum[1553] 44 is the food of the sinful one, 45 like molten brass boiling[1554] in the bellies 46 like the boiling of scalding water. 47 “Takepl him and drag him into the midst of Hell, 48 then pour over his head some of the punishment of scalding water!” 49 “Tastesg! You[1555] —indeed you—are the mighty, the noble[1556]. 50 Indeed, this is what youpl were[1557] skeptical about.” 51 Indeed, the mindful (of God) are in a safe domicile, 52 amidst Gardens and springs, 53 dressed in silk and brocade, facing one another. 54 So it is. And We marrieda them to spouses with lovely wide eyes. 55 They call therein for every kind of fruit, feeling safe. 56 Therein they do not taste death beyond the first death, and He[1558] shielded them from the punishment of Hell— 57 a grace from yoursg Lord; that is the great triumph. 58 Thus have We made it[1559] easy through yoursg tongue, that they may remind themselves. 59 So wait and watchsg. Indeed, they too are waiting and watching.

45. Kneeling

45- Al-Jâthiyah

1 Ha, Mîm. 2 The bestowal of the Scripture from on high is by Allah the Almighty, the All-Wise. 3 Indeed, in the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers. 4 And in yourpl own creation, and in the treading creatures He scatters, are signs for people who believe with certitude. 5 And the alternation of night and day, and the provision Allah has sent down from the sky, with which He has revived the earth after its death, and the shifting of the winds[1560] are signs for people who reason. 6 Those are Allah’s signs[1561] which We read to yousg in truth. So in which discourse, after Allah and His signs, will they[1562] believe? 7 Woe to every sinful liar 8 who hears Allah’s signsb being read to him, yet he persists arrogantly, as though he did not hear them. So givesg him glad tidings[1563] of a painful punishment. 9 And when he learns something of Our signs, he takes them in mockery; for those[1564] is a demeaning punishment. 10 Beyond them lies Hell, and what they have earned will not benefit them at all, nor will those whom they took as guardians apart from Allah, and for them is a great punishment. 11 This is guidance, but those who have denied their Lord’s signs—for them is a painful punishment of torment[1565]. 12 Allah is the One Who has subjected to youpl the sea, that ships may run in it by His Command, and that you may seek of His grace, and that you may give thanks. 13 And He has subjected to youpl whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth—all is from Him. Indeed, in that are signs for people who reflect. 14 Tellsg those who have attained faith to forgive those who do not expect the Days of Allah, that He may repay[1566] people for what they used to earn. 15 Whoever acts righteously does so to his own benefit, while whoever commits evil does so to his own detriment, then to yourpl Lord you are returned[1567]. 16 And surely We had given the Children of Israel the Scripture and wise judgment and prophethood, and We provided them with good things and favored them above all communities17 and gave them evident explanations regarding matters. Thus they differed not except after knowledge had come to them, thereby oppressing one other. Indeed, yoursg Lord judges between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding whatever they used to differ over. 18 Then We set yousg upon a (path of) legislation regarding matters, so follow it and do not follow the whims of those who do not know. 19 Indeed, they will never avail yousg against Allah in any way, for indeed, the unjust are guardians of one another, while Allah is the Ultimate Guardian of the ones mindful (of Him). 20 This provides insights for mankind, and guidance and mercy for people who believe with certitude. 21 Or do those who have perpetrated evil deeds assume that We will make them as equal to those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds, whether[1568] in their life or their death? Miserable is their judgment! 22 And Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth, and so that every soul will be repaid for what it has earned, for they will not be dealt with unjustly. 23 Have yousg seen the one who has taken his own whim as his god, and Allah has misguided him despite his knowledge, and has sealed his hearing and his heart, and has placed a veil over his sight? Who will guide him after Allah? Will you not remind[1569] yourselves? 24 And they said, “There is nothing but our Earlier Life; we die and we live, for nothing annihilates us except time.” But they have no knowledge of that; they are only guessing. 25 And when Our signs[1570] are recited to them, evident, their only argument is to say, “Bring back our forefathers, if youpl are truthful.” 26 Saysg, “Allah gives you life, then He makes you die, then He gathers you for the Day of Resurrection about which there is no doubt; but most of mankind does not know.” 27 And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Thus on the day when the Hour takes place—on that day the advocates of falsehood lose. 28 And yousg see every community kneeling; every[1571] community is called to its Scripture: “Today youpl are being repaid for what you used to do: 29 here is Our Scripture speaking about youpl in truth. Surely, We have been transcribing what youpl have been doing.” 30 As for those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—their Lord enters them into His mercy; that is the evident triumph. 31 But as for those who have denied (it will be said to them): “Were My signs not read to youpl, yet you acted arrogantly and were a criminal people?” 32 And when it is said, “Indeed, the promise of Allah is true”—while of the Hour[1572] there is no doubt—youpl say, “We do not know what the Hour is; we are only making a guess; we are not certain.” 33 And the evils of what they had done became evident to them[1573], and they became surrounded by what they used to ridicule. 34 And it was said, “Today We forget youpl as you forgot the meeting of this day of yours. Thus your shelter is the Fire, and there are no helpers for you. 35 That is because youpl dealt with Allah’s signs[1574] with ridicule, and the Earlier Life deceived you.” So today they are not brought[1575] out of it, and they are not allowed to make amends. 36 So praise be to Allah—Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of all realms. 37 And to Him belongs all supremacy in the heavens and the earth, for He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

46. The Dunes

46- Al-Ahqâf

1 Ha Mīm. 2 The bestowal of the Scripture from on high is by Allah, the Almighty, the All-Wise. 3 We did not create the heavens and the earth and what lies between them except in accordance with truth and for a stated term. But the deniers continue to disregard the warnings which they have received. 4 Saysg, “Have youpl seen what you call upon apart from Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth, or do they own a share of the heavens? Bring me a scripture prior to this one, or some trace of knowledge, if you are truthful.” 5 And who is more misguided than one who calls upon, apart from Allah, those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection and who are oblivious to their invocation? 6 And when mankind is herded, those (false gods) become enemies to them and deny their worship of them. 7 And when Our signsc are read to them, evident, those who deny say of the truth when it has come to them, “This is evident sorcery.” 8 Or do they say, “He has fabricated it!” Saysg, “If I have fabricated it myself, there is nothing youpl can do to protect me from Allah. He knows better what you are engaged in; sufficient is He as a witness between me and you, and He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Bestower of mercy.” 9 Saysg, “I am not different from the other messengers, and I do not know what will be done with me or with youpl. I only follow what is revealed to me, and I am only an evident warner.” 10 Saysg, “Have youpl seen: if it is truly from Allah and you deny it? And a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to its like and has attained faith, while you have acted arrogantly. Indeed, Allah does not guide the unjust people.” 11 Those who denied said of those who had attained faith, “If it were anything good, they would not have preceded us to it.” And since they were not guided by it, they will say, “This is an ancient lie.”12 And before it was the Scripture of Moses, a guide and a mercy. And this is a confirming Scripture in the Arabic tongue, that it may warn[1576] those who have done injustice, and as glad tidings for those who excel in doing good. 13 Indeed, those who said, “Our Lord is Allah,” then led a righteous life—no fear shall be upon them, nor shall they grieve; 14 those are the fellows of the Garden (of Paradise), abiding therein—a repayment on account of what they used to do. 15 And We have enjoined upon man excelling in showing kindness[1577] to his parents; his mother carried him with difficulty and delivered him with difficulty; his carriage and weaning are thirty months. Until, when he has attained his full strength and has reached forty years, he says, “Lord, enable me to appreciate the blessings with which You have blessed me and my parents, and to do righteousness that well pleases You, and grant me righteousness in my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed I am of the Muslims[1578].” 16 Those are the ones from whom We accept the best of what they have done and whose misdeeds We overlook[1579]; (they are) among the fellows of the Garden (of Paradise)—the promise of truth which they had been promised. 17 As for the one who said to his parents, “Fie on both of you! Are you promising me that I will be brought out when generations have passed away before me?” Meanwhile, they both cry for Allah’s help, “Woe to you, believe! The promise of Allah is true!” But he says, “These are nothing but legends of the ancients.” 18 Those are the ones upon whom the sentence is justified, among the communities that have passed away before them of unseen beings[1580] and humans; they were indeed losers. 19 And for all, there are degrees according to what they have done, and that He may render[1581] to them in full (the reward) for their deeds, and they will not be dealt with unjustly. 20 And on the day when those who denied the truth are paraded before the Fire: “Youpl have squandered your good things in your Earlier Life and you enjoyed them. So today you are being repaid with the punishment of shame on account of your unjustifiable arrogance on earth, and on account of how you used to defiantly disobey.” 21 And recall the brother of ʻĀd[1582] when he warned his people at the dunes—and warnings had passed away before him and after him: “Worship none but Allah; I fear for youpl the punishment of a great day.” 22 They said, “Have yousg come to us to divert us from our gods? Then bring us what you promise us, if you are of the truthful.” 23 He said, “Indeed, all knowledge is only with Allah, and I proclaim[1583] to you what I have been sent with, but I see you are an ignorant people.” 24 Then, when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, “This is a cloud that will bring us rain.” “Rather, it is what youpl sought to hasten: a wind in which is painful punishment, 25 destroying everything by the command of its Lord.” And when the morning came upon them, nothing could be seen[1584] except their residences. Thus We repay the criminal people. 26 And surely We had empowered them in the same way as We empowered youpl and We gave them hearing, and sight(s)[1585], and burning hearts. But neither their hearing, nor their sight(s), nor their burning hearts availed them in any way. That is because they used to repudiate the signs[1586] of Allah, and so they became surrounded by what they used to ridicule. 27 And most surely We have annihilated many towns around youpl and diversified the signs, that they may return (to the truth). 28 Why then did those whom they worshiped as means of nearness to Allah not support them? Rather, they abandoned[1587] them. It was their lie, a fabrication of their own making. 29 And recall when We dispatched towards yousg several unseen beings[1588] to listen to the Recital[1589]. When they came in its presence, they said, “Listenpl quietly!” Then, when it was concluded, they turned to their people, forewarning them. 30 They said, “O our people, we have heard a Scripture, sent down after Moses, confirming what came before it. It guides to the truth and to a straight path. 31 O our people, respond to the caller to Allah and believe in Him, and He will forgive you your misdeeds and grant you protection from a painful punishment.” 32 And he who does not respond to the caller to Allah cannot incapacitate (God) on earth and has no protectors apart from Him; those are in evident misguidance. 33 Have they not seen that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth and was never tired by creating them, is capable[1590] of reviving the dead? Yes indeed; He is indeed powerful over all things. 34 And on the day when those who denied are presented to the Fire: “Is this not real?” They said, “Yes, indeed, by our Lord.” He said, “Then taste the punishment on account of how youpl used to deny.” 35 So besg patient, as the messengers with resolve were patient, and do not be hasty regarding them. On the day when they witness what they are promised, it will seem as if they had lasted for only an hour of a day. A proclamation: will any be annihilated except the defiantly disobedient people?

47. Muhammad

47- Muhammad

1 Those who denied and barred (others) from the way of Allah—He made their deeds go to waste. 2 And those who attained faith and did righteous deeds, and attained faith in what was sent down to Muhammad—and it is the truth from their Lord—He remitted their evil deeds and set aright their state of mind. 3 That is because those who denied followed falsehood, while those who attained faith followed the truth from their Lord. Allah thus sets forth for mankind their examples. 4 Thus, when youpl encounter those who have denied, strike at their necks. Then when you have subjugated them, bind them firmly[1591]. Then either release them by grace or by ransom until war lays down its burdens. Had Allah willed, He could have defeated them Himself, but He thus tests some of you by means of others. As for those who were killed[1592] in the way of Allah, He will not let their deeds go to waste. 5 He will guide them and set aright their state of mind 6 and will enter them into the Garden (of Paradise)—He has identified it for them. 7 O you who have attained faith, if you support Allah, He will support you and strengthen your foothold. 8 But as for those who denied, for them is perdition, and He made their deeds go to waste. 9 That is because they hated what Allah had sent down, so He nullified their deeds. 10 Have they not journeyed through the earth and looked at what the outcome was for those before them? Allah poured destruction upon them. For for the deniers there is something comparable. 11 That is because Allah is the Patron of those who have attained faith, while the deniers have no Patron. 12 Indeed, Allah enters those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds into Gardens beneath which rivers flow. And those who have denied enjoy themselves and eat as cattle eat, but the Fire is a dwelling for them. 13 And how many a town was more powerful than your town[1593] which evicted yousg? We annihilated them, and there was no helper for them. 14 Is someone who relies on evident proof from his Lord like someone the evil of whose work was adorned for him? And they[1594] followed their own whims. 15 The likeness of the Garden (of Paradise) that the mindfulpl (of God) have been promised: rivers of water, not staling[1595]; and rivers of milk whose taste has not changed; and rivers of wine, a delight for those who drink; and rivers of honey, clarified and pure. And they have therein of all products and forgiveness from their Lord. (How can this be) compared to the fate of those abiding in the Fire and were given, for drink, scalding water, so that it tore their bowels? 16 And among them is one who listens to yousg, but when they[1596] depart from your presence, they say to those given knowledge, “What did he say just now?” Those are the ones whose hearts Allah has sealed, and they followed their own whims. 17 But as for those who wanted guidance, He has increased them in guidance and has brought them their mindfulness (of God). 18 So are they but waiting until the Hour comes to them suddenly? In fact, its tokens have already come. But how will they be reminded when it has come to them? 19 So knowsg that there is no god but Allah, and ask forgiveness for your misdeed, and for believing men and believing women. For Allah knows your moving about and your dwelling. 20 And those who have attained faith say, “If only a surah[1597] was sent down.” Yet when a decisive surah is sent down and combat is mentioned in it, yousg see those in whose hearts is sickness looking at you with the look of someone fainting at death. Yet worthier of them would be 21 obedience and upright speech. Then, when the matter is settled, had they been true to Allah, it would have been better for them. 22 Would youpl then, in case you became in charge[1598], spread corruption in the earth and sever[1599] your family ties[1600]? 23 Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed, so He made them deaf and blinded their sight(s)[1601]. 24 Will they not ponder the Recital[1602], or are there locks upon their hearts? 25 Indeed, those who turned on their heels after guidance became evident to them—Satan has enticed them and has filled[1603] them with false hopes. 26 That is because they said to those who hated what Allah had bestowed from on high, “We will obey you in certain matters.” But Allah knows their secret exchanges[1604]. 27 How will it be when the angels take them at death, beating their faces and their backs? 28 That is because they followed what angered Allah, and they disliked His good pleasure, so He nullified their deeds. 29 Or did those in whose hearts is sickness think that Allah would not bring out (to the open) their malice? 30 Had We willed, We could have shown them to yousg, and you would have recognized them by their marks. Yet you will recognize them by their tone of speech, and Allah knows all yourpl deeds. 31 And We[1605] will certainly test youpl until We know those of you who strive and those who are steadfastly patient, and (until We) test[1606] your reactions. 32 Indeed, those who denied and barred (others) from the way of Allah and opposed the Messenger after guidance had become clear to them—they will not harm Allah at all, but He will nullify their deeds. 33 O you who have attained faith, obey Allah and obey the Messenger, and do not let your deeds go to waste. 34 Indeed, those who denied and barred (others) from the way of Allah and then died as deniers—Allah will not forgive them. 35 So do not waver and call for peace while youpl have the upper hand; Allah is with you and He will not divest you of your deeds. 36 Indeed, the Earlier Life is nothing but a game and a distraction. But if youpl attain faith and are mindful (of God), He will grant you your rewards, and He will not ask you for your possessions. 37 Were He to ask youpl for it and press you, you would become miserly, and He would bring out (to the open) your malice. 38 Here youpl are, being called to spend in the way of Allah. Among you are those who become miserly, but whoever becomes miserly, becomes miserly only against himself. And Allah is the Self-Sufficient, while you are the needy. And if you turn away (from Him), He will replace you with another people, then they will not be like you.

48. Conquest

48- Al-Fath

1 Indeed, We have unlocked for yousg an evident conquest, 2 that Allah may forgive you what has passed of your misdeeds and what is yet to come, and complete His blessing upon you and guide you to a straight path 3 and support you with mighty support. 4 It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers, to add faith to their faith, for to Allah belong the troops of the heavens and the earth, and Allah has always been All-Knowing, All-Wise. 5 So as to enter believing men and believing women into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein, and to remit their evil deeds. And that, with Allah, has always been a great triumph. 6 And to punish hypocritical men and hypocritical women and idolatrous men and idolatrous women—those who harbor evil thoughts about Allah; they are encircled by evil, and Allah’s wrath is upon them and has cursed them and has prepared for them Hell, and what an evil destiny. 7 For to Allah belong the troops of the heavens and the earth, and Allah has always been Almighty, All-Wise. 8 Indeed, We have sent yousg as a witness and a bearer of glad tidings and a warner, 9 that youpl may believe[1607] in Allah and His Messenger, and rally to Him and honor Him and highly exalt Him morning and evening. 10 Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to yousg are actually pledging allegiance to Allah: the hand of Allah is over their hands. So whoever reneges in fact reneges to his own detriment. And whoever fulfills what he has covenanted with Allah, then He[1608] will grant him a great reward. 11 The nomadic Arabs who lagged behind will say to yousg, “Our belongings and our families have preoccupied us, so ask forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Saysg, “Who can avail you anything against Allah if He desires harm for you or desires benefit for you?” In fact, Allah has always been All-Aware of what you do. 12 But youpl thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and that was adorned in your hearts. And you harbored evil thoughts, for you have always been a worthless people. 13 And whoever has not believed in Allah and His Messenger— We have prepared for the deniers a Blaze. 14 And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He forgives whomever He wills, and He punishes whomever He wills, for Allah has always been Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 15 Those who lagged behind will say when youpl depart to collect the gains[1609], “Let us follow you.” They want to change the Speech[1610] of Allah. Saysg, “You will not follow us; Allah has said so before.” Then they will say, “Rather, youpl envy us.” In fact, they have not comprehended except a little. 16 Saysg to the nomadic Arabs who lagged behind, “You will be called against a people of intense force to combat them, unless they surrender. So if you obey, Allah will give you an excellent reward. But if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.” 17 There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the lame, nor any blame on the sick. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger—He[1611] will enter him into Gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever turns away—He will punish him with a painful punishment. 18 Surely, Allah was well pleased with the believers as they pledged allegiance to yousg under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest 19 and a multitude of gainsa for them to capture. For Allah has always been Almighty, All-Wise. 20 Allah has promised youpl a multitude of gainsa to capture, so He has expedited this for you and has restrained people’s hands from you, that it may be a sign to the believers, and to guide you to a straight path. 21 And other (war booty) of which youpl were incapable (of capturing), but Allah has encompassed it, and Allah has always been Powerful over everything. 22 And if those who have denied had combated you, they would have turned their backs, then they would find neither ally nor supporter. 23 Such has been Allah’s rule that has passed on before, for yousg will never find any change in Allah’s rule. 24 And it is He who withheld their hands from youpl and your hands from them in the valley of Makkah after giving you advantage over them, for Allah has always been All-Seeing of what you[1612] do. 25 It is they who have denied, and barred youpl from the Inviolable Mosque, and prevented the offering from reaching its destination. And were it not for (the presence among them of) some faithful men and some faithful women whom you did not know of and whom you would have hurt, thus incurring dishonor unknowingly on their account . . .[1613]—that Allah may enter into His mercy whomever He wills. If they had been apart, We would have punished those of them who denied with a painful punishment. 26 Those who denied filled their hearts with chauvinism—the chauvinism of pagan ignorance[1614]. But Allah sent His tranquility down upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed on them the word of mindfulness (of God) of which they were most worthy and deserving, for Allah has always been All-Knowing of everything. 27 Surely, Allah has fulfilled His Messenger’s vision in truth: “Youpl will surely enter the Inviolable Mosque by the will of Allah in security, heads shaven or hair cut short, not fearing anything. Yet He knew what you did not know and so set up for you, apart from that, a near conquest.” 28 It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth to make it prevail over all religions, for Allah suffices as Witness. 29 Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and those with him are stern against the deniers, merciful to one another; yousg see them kneeling, prostrating, seeking grace from Allah and (His) good pleasure; their marks are on their faces from the effect of prostration. Such is their description in the Torah and their description in the Gospel: like vegetation that sprouted, then became strong, then grew thick, then rested on its stem, impressing the farmers. Through them He enrages the deniers. Allah has promised those of them who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds forgiveness and a great reward.

49. The Chambers

49- Al-Hujurât

1 O you who have attained faith, do not proceed ahead of Allah and His Messenger, and be mindful of Allah; indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing. 2 O you who have attained faith, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, and do not speak loudly to him as you speak loudly to one another, lest your deeds be nullified while you are unaware. 3 Indeed, those who lower their voices before Allah’s Messenger—those are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for mindfulness (of Him); for them is forgiveness and a great reward. 4 Indeed, those who call yousg from behind the chambers—most of them do not reason. 5 Had they remained patient until yousg came out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 6 O you who have attained faith, if an ungodly person brings you any news, investigate[1615] (the matter), lest you harm a people out of ignorance and thus become regretful for what you have done. 7 And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah; if he were to obey you in many matters, you would suffer hardship. But Allah has endeared faith to you and adorned it in your hearts and made denial and ungodliness and rebellion hateful to you; those are the prudent ones. 8 A grace from Allah and a blessing, and Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. 9 And if two factions of believers fall to fighting each other, reconcilepl between them. But if one group oppresses the other, then combat the one which oppresses until it complies with the command of Allah. But once it has complied, reconcile between them with justice and be equitable; indeed, Allah loves the equitable. 10 Indeed, all the believers are but brothers, so reconcile between yourpl two brothers[1616] and be mindful of Allah, that you may receive mercy. 11 O you who have attained faith, no people shall ridicule other people, for they may be better than them. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than them. Nor shall you defame yourselves[1617], nor shall you insult one another by nicknames. What a miserable label ungodliness is after attaining faith! And whoever has not repented—then those[1618] are the unjust. 12 O you who have attained faith, avoid making too many assumptions—indeed, some assumptions are sinful. And do not spy on one another nor backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would detest it. So be mindful of Allah; indeed, Allah is Granting and Accepting of repentance, Bestowing of mercy. 13 O mankind, We have created you from a male and a female and made you into races and tribes, that you may know one another; indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allah are the most mindful (of Him) among you; indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware. 14 The nomadic Arabs said, “We have attained faith.” Saysg, “You have not attained faith; rather say, ‘We have become Muslims,’ for faith has not yet entered into your hearts. But if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish any of your deeds; indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.” 15 The believers are those who have attained faith in Allah and His Messenger, and then have not doubted and have striven with their wealth and their lives in the way of Allah; those are the truthful. 16 Saysg, “Are youpl going to teach Allah about your religion, when Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, for Allah is All-Knowing of everything?” 17 They keep reminding yousg of the favor they did you by becoming Muslims. Say, “Do not consider your submission (to Allah) a favor to me; it is Allah who does you a favor by guiding you to the faith, if you are truthful.” 18 Allah knows the hidden realm of the heavens and the earth, for Allah is All-Seeing of what you[1619] do.

50. Qāf

50- Qâf

1 Qāf. By the Glorious Recital[1620] . . .[1621] 2 But they marveled that a forewarner had come to them from among them, so the deniers said, “How strange! 3 Can it be that when we have died and become dust . . .[1622]? This is a far-fetched return.” 4 We have already known what the earth consumes of them, and with Us is a constantly preserving record[1623]. 5 But they rejected the truth when it came to them, so they are in a state of confusion. 6 Have they not looked at the sky above them—how We constructed it and decorated it and how it has no fractures? 7 And the earth—how We spread it out and set on it firm mountains and germinated therein all kinds of lovely plants, 8  an eye-opener and a reminder for every penitent servant? 9 And We brought down from the sky blessed water and germinated with it gardens and grain to harvest, 10 and the soaring palm trees with clustered dates— 11 provision for the servants. And We revived thereby a lifeless land; likewise is the emergence. 12 Before them the people of Noah disbelieved, and (so did) the fellows of Al-Russ and Thamûd 13 and ʻĀd and Pharaoh and the brethren of Lot 14 and the fellows of the Thicket and the people of Tubbaʻ; they all disbelieved the messengers, so My threat came true. 15 Were We fatigued by the first creation? Rather, they are in doubt of a new creation. 16 And surely We created man and know what his (inner) self whispers to him, for We are nearer to him than his jugular vein. 17 As the two receptors[1624] receive (him), one on the right and one on the left, constantly seated. 18 Not a word does he utter, but close to him is a watcher, constantly ready. 19 Then came the daze of death with the truth: “That is what yousg were trying to avoid.” 20 And the Trumpet was blown[1625]: “That is the Day of the Threat.” 21 And every soul came forward, accompanied by a driver and a witness[1626]. 22 “Indeed, yousg were oblivious to this, so We removed your veil and your sight today is (as sharp as) iron.” 23 And His comrade[1627] said, “This is what I have ready with me.” 24 “Castdl into Hell, every stubborn relentless denier, 25 preventer of good, transgressor, doubter, 26 who has set up another deity with Allah. So castdl him into the severe punishment.” 27 His comrade said, “Our Lord, I did not make him exceed all limits, but he was in extreme misguidance.” 28 He said, “Do not dispute in My presence, for I have warned youpl in advance.  29 The decree from Me cannot be changed, and I am not a tyrant unto the servants.” 30 On the day when We say[1628] to Hell, “Are you full?” And it says, “Are there any more?” 31 And the Garden (of Paradise) was brought closer to those mindful (of God), not far away. 32 This is what youpl are promised[1629]—for every constant preserver who often turns to God, 33 the one who inwardly feared the All-Merciful and came with a penitent heart. 34 “Enterpl it in peace; that is the Day of Eternity.” 35 Therein they have whatever they desire, and We have even more. 36 And how many generations before them who were more powerful than they did We destroy! And they explored the lands—was there any escape? 37 Indeed, in that is a reminder for whoever possesses a heart or cares to listen and witness. 38 And surely We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days[1630], and never were We touched by any fatigue. 39 So enduresg what they say, and highly exalt your Lord with praise before the rising of the sun and before sunset. 40 And highly exaltsg Him with praise in the night and after[1631] prostrations. 41 And listensg on the day when the caller calls from a nearby place. 42 The day when they hear the Shout in all truth; that is the Day of Emergence. 43 Indeed, We—We alone—give life and cause death, and to Us is the destiny. 44 The day the earth ruptures[1632] open from above them, letting them rush out; that is an easy exodus for Us. 45 We know better what they say, and yousg are not a compeller over them, so remind by the Recital[1633] whoever fears My warning.

51. The Spreaders

51- Adh-Dhâriyât

1 By the spreaders spreading[1634], 2 and by those bearers of loads, 3 and by those moving gently, 4 and by those distributing as commanded— 5 what youpl are promised is true. 6 And, indeed, the Recompense is sure to come. 7 By the heaven comprising interwoven tracks, 8 indeed, youpl are of different opinions[1635]. 9 Averted from it is he who is averted. 10 May the conjecturers perish![1636] 11 Those who are unmindful and in perplexity, 12 asking, “When is the Day of Recompense?” 13 The day they are heated on the Fire: 14 “Taste your trial; this is what youpl, (challengingly) have been asking to be hastened.” 15 Indeed, the mindful (of God) are amidst Gardens (of Paradise) and springs, 16 taking what their Lord has given them. Indeed, before that, they used to excel in doing good: 17 they used to lie down but little of the night, 18 and at dawn they would seek forgiveness, 19 and in their wealth was a share for the asker and the deprived. 20 And on earth are signs for those who believe with certitude, 21 and within yourselves; do you not see? 22 And in the heaven is your provision and what you are promised. 23 So by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, indeed, it is as true as the fact that youpl (can) pronounce. 24 Has the story of Abraham’s[1637] honored guests reached yousg? 25 When they entered upon him they said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace, strangers.” 26 And he slipped away to his family and brought a fatted calf 27 and set it before them. He said, “Will you not eat?” 28 And he was filled with apprehension towards them. They said, “Do not be afraid,” and they announced to him the glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy. 29 So his wife came forward with a shriek, then clasped her face and said, “A barren old woman!” 30 They said, “Thus your Lord has said; He is the All-Wise, the All- Knowing.” 31 He said, “So what is your business, O emissaries?” 32 They said, “We have been sent to a criminal people, 33 to unleash upon them rocks of clay, 34 marked by yoursg Lord for the extremists.” 35 Then We brought out all the believers who were in it. 36 Yet We found in it only one household of Muslims, 37 and We left in it a sign for those who fear the painful punishment. 38 And in Moses (there is also a sign) —when We sent him to Pharaoh with an evident manifestation. 39 But he turned away with his warlords and said, “A sorcerer or a madman.” 40 So We seized him and his troops and flung them into the waters, and he was to blame. 41 And (likewise) in (the people of) ʻĀd[1638]—We sent against them the Barren Wind, 42 sparing nothing it came upon without rendering it like decayed ruins. 43 And (likewise) in (the people of) Thamûd[1639]—they were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a while.” 44 But they defied the command of their Lord, so the Lightning struck[1640] them as they looked on, 45 and they could not rise up, nor could they help themselves. 46 And (recall) before that, the people[1641] of Noah—indeed, they were a defiantly disobedient people. 47 And the universe—We constructed it with power, and We are surely expanding it. 48 And the earth—We spread it out. So how excellent are We who prepared it! 49 And We created all things in pairs, that you may remind[1642] yourselves. 50 “So flee to Allah; I am to youpl from Him an evident warner. 51 And do not set up any other god with Allah; I am to you from Him an evident warner.” 52 Likewise, no messenger came to those before them but they said, “A sorcerer or a madman.” 53 Did they recommend it to one another? In fact, they are a people who exceed all limits. 54 So turn away from them, for yousg are not to blame. 55 And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers. 56 And I did not create the unseen beings[1643] and humans but to worship Me. 57 I need no provision from them, nor do I need them to feed Me. 58 Allah is the All-Providing, the Possessor of power, the All-Firm. 59 So, indeed, those who do injustice will have their lot like the lot of their fellows, so let them not hasten Me. 60 So woe to those who have denied from that day of theirs which they are promised.

52. Mount Tûr

52- At-Tûr

1 By Mount Tûr. 2 By a scripture inscribed 3 in an unrolled parchment. 4 By the frequented House (of God). 5 By the raised canopy. 6 By the sea flared up with fire— 7 the punishment of yoursg Lord is sure to come; 8 there is nothing to avert it 9 on the day when the sky sways in agitation 10 and the mountains go into motion. 11 So woe on that day to the disbelievers 12 who are indulged in vain talk, playing. 13 The day when they are shoved into the Fire of Hell forcefully. 14 “This is the Fire in which youpl used to disbelieve. 15 Is this magic, or do youpl not see? 16 Roast in it, and be patient or be impatient—it is the same for youpl; indeed, you are only being repaid for what you used to do.” 17 Indeed, the mindful (of God) are in Gardens and bliss, 18 enjoying what their Lord has brought them, and their Lord has shielded them from the punishment of purgatory. 19 “Eat and drink pleasantly on account of what youpl used to do.” 20 Relaxing on luxurious furnishings, and We coupled them with spouses with lovely wide eyes. 21 And those who attained faith and whose offspring[1644] followed them in faith—We have united[1645] them with their offspring[1646], and We have not deprived them of anything of their work; every person is in pledge for what (deeds) he has earned. 22 And We have supplied them with fruit and meat such as they desire. 23 They exchange therein a cup which does not lead to any idle talk or recrimination. 24 And serving them are youths like nestled pearls. 25 And they approached one another, inquiring. 26 They said, “When we were still with our families[1647] we used to live in fear[1648], 27 so Allah has conferred favor upon us and has shielded us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire. 28 Indeed, before this we used to pray to Him; indeed[1649], He is the Fulfiller of promises, the Bestower of mercy.” 29 So remind, for yousg are neither a soothsayer nor a madman. 30 Or do they say, “A poet[1650] for whom we await a calamity of time”? 31 Saysg, “Go on awaiting, for I am with youpl among those awaiting.” 32 Or is it that their discerning minds command them to this? Or are they a people who exceed all limits? 33 Or do they say, “He made it up”? In fact, they do not believe. 34 So let them produce a discourse like it if they are truthful. 35 Or were they created out of nothing? Or are they the creators? 36 Or did they create the heavens and the earth? In fact, they are not certain. 37 Or do they possess the treasuries of your Lord? Or are they the controllers? 38 Or do they have a stairway (to heaven) by means of which they listen? Then let their listener bring an evident manifestation. 39 Or is He to have the daughters and youpl the sons? 40 Or do yousg ask them for a reward so that they are weighed down by debt? 41 Or do they have (knowledge of) the hidden realm and they are writing it down? 42 Or do they want a plot? Rather, the plot will only befall the deniers. 43 Or do they have a god other than Allah? Highly Exalted is Allah above what they associate. 44 And if they were to see lumps of sky falling, they would say, “A mass of clouds.” 45 So leavesg them until they meet[1651] their day in which they are stunned— 46 the day when their plots avail them nothing, nor are they supported. 47 And indeed, for those who did injustice there is a punishment apart from that, but most of them do not know. 48 So wait patiently for the decree of yoursg Lord, for you are before Our Eyes. And highly exalt your Lord with praise when you arise, 49 and highly exalt Him during the night and at the receding of the stars.

53. The Star

53- An-Najm

1 By the star as it goes down, 2 yourpl fellow has not gone astray, nor has he been deluded, 3 nor does he speak out of whim. 4 It is but a revelation being revealed, 5 taught to him by the extremely powerful,[1652] 6 the one of vigor. He settled 7 while he was at the highest horizon, 8 then he came near and descended 9 so that he was within two bows’ length or closer. 10 Then He revealed to His servant that which He revealed. 11 The burning heart did not lie[1653] about what it saw. 12 Will youpl enter into controversies[1654] with him despite what he sees? 13 And he saw him on another descent, 14 at the Lote-tree of the Extremity[1655], 15 near which is the Garden of Shelter, 16 when there covered the Lote-tree what covered it. 17 The sight (of the Prophet) did not swerve, nor did it exceed. 18 He certainly saw some of the great signs of his Lord. 19 Have youpl seen Al-Lāt and Al-ʻUzza? 20 And Manāt[1656], the third one, the other? 21 Are youpl to have the males and He the females[1657]? 22 What a bizarre distribution! 23 These are nothing but names which youpl have named, you and your forefathers, for which Allah sent down no manifestation. They follow nothing but assumptions and what the (inner) selves desire, even though guidance has come to them from their Lord. 24 Or is there for man whatever he wishes? 25 To Allah belong the Hereafter and the first (life). 26 And how many an angel is there in the heavens whose intercession avails nothing except after Allah gives permission to whomever He wills and is well pleased with. 27 Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels with female names, 28 though they have no knowledge of that. They only follow assumptions, yet surely assumptions do not substitute for the truth. 29 So disregardsg the one who has turned away from Our Reminder and has wanted nothing but the Earlier Life. 30 That is the extent of their knowledge. Indeed, yoursg Lord is the One Who knows better who has strayed from His way and He is the One Who knows better who has accepted guidance. 31 And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, that He may repay those who have done evil according to what they have done and repay those who have excelled in doing good with the best. 32 Those who avoid the gravest[1658] of sins and obscenities—except for minor lapses—yoursg Lord is of vast forgiveness. He knows better about youpl, ever since He initiated you from the earth, and ever since you were fetuses in your mothers’ bellies. So do not acclaim your own purity—He knows better who is mindful (of Him). 33 Have yousg seen the one who turned away 34 and gave a little, then held back? 35 Does he possess knowledge of the hidden realm and can therefore foresee? 36 Or was he not informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses, 37 and of Abraham[1659] who fulfilled (conveying the commandments): 38 that no bearer of burden bears the burden of another; 39 and that man attains only what he has striven for; 40 and that surely his pursuit will eventually be seen, 41 then he is repaid for it with the fullest repayment; 42 and that to yourpl Lord is the finality; 43 and that it is He Who caused laughter and weeping; 44 and that it is He Who caused death and gave life; 45 and that He created the two spouses[1660]—the male and the female, 46 from a sperm drop when emitted; 47 and that upon Him is the next creation; 48 and that it is He Who enriched and impoverished; 49 and that it is He Who is the Lord of Sirius[1661]; 50 and that He annihilated ancient ʻĀd[1662] 51 and Thamûd[1663], sparing no one; 52 and the people of Noah before that; indeed, they were more unjust and more exceeding of all limits[1664]. 53 And He brought down the Ruined Cities[1665] 54 and covered them by that which He covered. 55 So which of yoursg Lord’s marvels do you enter into controversies about? 56 This is a warning just like the first warnings. 57 The inevitable is imminent; 58 none apart from Allah can unveil it. 59 Do youpl marvel at this discourse, 60 and laugh and do not weep, 61 lost in your frivolity? 62 So prostrate yourselves to Allah and worship!

54. The Moon

54-Al-Qamar

1 The Hour has drawn near and the moon has ruptured. 2 Yet whenever they see a miracle, they disregard (it) and say, “Continuous magic!” 3 And they disbelieved and followed their whims. And every matter is bound to settle[1666]. 4 And most surely there have come to them tidings containing a deterrent— 5 profound wisdom, but warnings are of no avail. 6 So turn awaysg from them. On the day when the Summoner summons to something terrible, 7 with their sight(s) (subdued) in reverence they come out of the tombs like swarming locusts, 8 scrambling towards the Summoner; the deniers say, “This is a hard day.” 9 The people of Noah disbelieved before them, so they disbelieved Our servant and said, “A madman!”, and he was rebuked. 10 So he called upon his Lord, “I am overcome, so bestow help!” 11 So We opened[1667] the gates of the sky with water pouring down, 12 and We made the earth burst with springs, so the waters met for a matter already determined. 13 And We carried him on a craft of planks and nails, 14 sailing before Our eyes—a repayment for the one who had been denied. 15 And most surely We have left it as a sign, so is there anyone to remind himself? 16 So how were My punishment and My warnings! 17 And most surely We have made the Recital[1668] easy for remembrance, so is there anyone to remind himself? 18 ʻĀd[1669] disbelieved, so how were My punishment and My warnings! 19 Indeed, We sent against them a screaming wind on a day of unrelenting misfortune, 20 plucking people away as though they were trunks of uprooted palm trees. 21 So how were My punishment and My warnings! 22 And most surely We made the Recitalc easy for remembrance, so is there anyone to remind himself? 23 Thamûd[1670] disbelieved in the warnings 24 and said, “Are we to follow a human being from among us? Indeed, we would then be astray and insane! 25 Has the Reminder been cast to him out of all of us? Rather, he is a wicked sheer liar.” 26 They[1671] will know tomorrow who the wicked sheer liar is. 27 We are sending the she-camel as a means of trial for them, so watchsg them and be patient. 28 And informsg them that the water is to be shared between them[1672]; each one should drink in turn. 29 But they called their fellow, and he dared and hamstrung (it). 30 So how were My punishment and My warnings! 31 Indeed, We sent against them a single Shout, and they ended up like a fence-maker’s dry sticks. 32 And most surely We made the Recital[1673] easy for remembrance, so is there anyone to remind himself? 33 The people of Lot disbelieved in the warnings. 34 Indeed, We sent against them a shower of stones, except for Lot’s folk–We delivered them at dawn— 35 a blessing from Us; thus We repay whoever gives thanks. 36 And most surely he[1674] had warned them of Our onslaught, but they entered into controversies about the warnings. 37 And most surely they solicited of him his guests, so We obliterated their eyes— “So taste My punishment and My warnings.” 38 And most surely an abiding punishment came upon them in the morning— 39 “So tastepl My punishment and My warnings.” 40 And most surely We made the Recitala easy for remembrance, so is there anyone to remind himself? 41 And most surely the warnings came to Pharaoh’s folk— 42 they disbelieved all Our signs. So We seized them (with) the seizure of an Almighty, Invincible One. 43 “Are yourpl deniers better than all those? Or do you have immunity in the Books?” 44 Or do they say, “We, all together, will be victorious”? 45 The multitude will be defeated, and they will turn their backs. 46 Nay, the Hour is their appointed time, and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter. 47 Indeed, the criminals are in confusion and insanity. 48 The day when they are dragged upon their faces into the Fire: “Taste the touch of Saqar[1675].” 49 Indeed, We have created everything in due measure. 50 And Our command is but once, like the twinkling of an eye. 51 And most surely We have annihilated yourpl likes, so is there anyone to remind himself? 52 And everything they have done is in the Books— 53 for everything, small or large, is written down. 54 Indeed, the mindful (of God) are amidst Gardens and rivers, 55 in a seat of truth, in the presence of an Invincible King.

55. The All-Merciful

55- Ar-Rahmân

1 The All-Merciful 2 taught the Recitala, 3 created man, 4 and taught him clear expression. 5 The sun and the moon move according to plan, 6 and the plants[1676] and the trees prostrate themselves. 7 And the sky—He raised it and set up the balance, 8 so dopl not exceed in the balance, 9 but maintain the weights justly and do not fall short in the balance. 10 And the earth—He set it up for living creatures; 11 in it are fruits and sheathed palm trees, 12 and grains[1677] in the blades, and fragrant plants. 13 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in[1678]?14 He created man from potter’s clay like pottery 15 and created the unseen being[1679] from a smokeless flame of fire. 16 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 17 Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests. 18 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 19 He merged the two waters[1680], converging together; 20 between them is a barrier which they do not overrun. 21 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 22 From them come out[1681] pearls and corals. 23 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in?  24 His are the running ships, whose sails are raised[1682] in the sea like banners[1683]. 25 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 26 Everyone upon it[1684] is bound to perish, 27 and all that remains is yoursg Lord’s Countenance, the Possessor of majesty and nobility. 28 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 29 Everyone in the heavens and the earth asks Him; every day He is bringing about a matter. 30 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 31 We[1685] will attend to youpl, O two huge communitiesc. 32 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 33 O society of unseen beings and humans, if youpl can penetrate the bounds of the heavens and the earth then go ahead and penetrate; you will never penetrate except with authority[1686]. 34 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 35 Flares of fire, and brass[1687], will be sent upon youdl, and you will not find help. 36 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 37 And when the sky ruptures and becomes rose-colored like oil— 38 so which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 39 On that day neither any human nor unseen being[1688] is asked about his misdeeds. 40 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 41 The criminals are recognized by their marks then taken by the forelocks and the feet. 42 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 43 This is Hell in which the criminals disbelieve; 44 they circulate between it and an intensely scalding water. 45 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in?  46 But for whoever feared standing before his Lord there are two Gardens (in Paradise). 47 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 48 Both having varieties. 49 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 50 In them are two flowing springs. 51 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 52 In them, of every kind of fruit there is a pair. 53 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 54 Reclining on furnishings lined with brocade, and the yield of the two Gardens are near at hand. 55 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 56 In them are bashful maidens, untouched before by any human or unseen beingb. 57 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 58 Like rubies and corals. 59 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 60 Is the repayment of kindness anything but kindness? 61 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in?  62 And beneath them are two gardens. 63 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 64 Both of deepest green. 65 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 66 In them are two gushing springs. 67 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 68 In them are fruits and date-palms and pomegranates. 69 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 70 In them are good, beautiful ones. 71 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 72 Spouses with lovely wide eyes, secluded in pavilions. 73 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 74 Untouched before by any human or unseen beingb. 75 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 76 Reclining on green cushions and exquisite carpets. 77 So which of your Lord’s marvels do youdl disbelieve in? 78 Supremely Blessed be the Name of yoursg Lord, the Possessor[1689] of majesty and nobility.

56. The Inevitable

56- Al-Wâqi‘ah

1 When the inevitable event befalls, 2 no disbelief will there be about its befalling, 3 bringing low, raising high. 4 When the earth is shaken violently, 5 and mountains are crushed and crumbled 6 and become scattered dust, 7 and you become three classes: 8 the fellows of the rightness; what of the fellows of the rightness! 9 And the fellows of the ill-omened; what of the fellows of the ill-omened! 10 And the pioneers, the pioneers: 11 those are the ones brought near (to God) 12 in the Gardens of Bliss— 13 a throng from the ancients 14 and a small band from the latecomers, 15 on luxurious couches, 16 leaning on them, facing one another. 17 Serving them will be immortal youths 18 with glasses, and pitchers, and a cup from a flowing spring, 19 causing them neither headache nor intoxication[1690], 20 and fruit of their choice, 21 and meat of any bird they may desire. 22 And (in it are) spouses[1691] with lovely wide eyes, 23 like well-preserved pearls, 24 as a repayment on account of what they used to do. 25 Therein they will hear no idle talk and no recrimination 26 except for the saying: “Peace, peace.” 27 And the fellows of the right—what of the fellows of the right? 28 Amid thornless lote-trees 29 and clustered banana-trees 30 and extended shade 31 and outpouring water 32 and abundant fruit, 33 neither withheld nor forbidden. 34 And high-class spouses; 35 We have created them perfectly 36 and made them virgins, 37 tender, of matching age, 38 for the fellows of the right— 39 a throng from the ancients 40 and a throng from the latecomers. 41 And the fellows of the left—what of the fellows of the left? 42 Amid searing wind and scalding water 43 and a shadow of thick smoke, 44 neither cool nor refreshing[1692]. 45 They had lived before that indulging in affluence, 46 and they used to insist on great violation, 47 and they used to say, “Can it be that when we have died and become dust and bones—can it be that[1693] we will really be resurrected? 48 And[1694] our ancient forefathers, too?” 49 Saysg, “Indeed, the ancients and the latecomers 50 will be gathered for the appointment of a well-known day! 51 Then indeed all of you, O misguided disbelievers, 52 will certainly be eating from the trees of Zaqqum[1695] 53 and filling your bellies with it 54 and will be drinking on top of it scalding water, 55 thus drinking as a thirst-mad camel drinks.” 56 That is their hospitality on the Day of Recompense. 57 We have created youpl; if only you would believe! 58 Have youpl seen what you ejaculate? 59 Is it youpl who create it or are We the Creators? 60 We have decreed death among youpl, and We will not be outstripped 61 in replacing you with your likes and transforming you into what you do not know. 62 And youpl have certainly known the first formation; if only you would remind[1696] yourselves! 63 Have youpl seen what you cultivate? 64 Is it you who plant it or are We the Planters? 65 If We will, We can turn it into rubble, then youpl will lament, 66 “Indeed, we[1697] are in debt; 67 rather, we are dispossessed!” 68 Have youpl seen the water you drink? 69 Is it you who sent it down from the rainclouds or are We the Senders? 70 If We will, We can make it salty. Will youpl not be thankful? 71 Have you seen the fire you kindle? 72 Is it you who produced the tree for it, or are We the Producers? 73 We have made it a reminding and a comfort for the travelers. 74 So highly exalt the Name of yoursg Lord, the Great. 75 I swear by the locations[1698] of the stars— 76 and it is certainly a great oath if only youpl were to know. 77 It is indeed a Noble Recital[1699] 78 in a well-protected Scripture. 79 None touches it except the cleansed, 80 a bestowal from on high by the Lord of all realms. 81 Is it this discourse that youpl take so lightly? 82 And you render due thanks for being provided with it by disbelieving in it? 83 So when it[1700] has reached the throat, 84 and you are at that moment looking on, 85 and We are nearer to him than you are, but you do not see— 86 why, if you are not to be held to account, 87 do you not bring ita back if you are truthful? 88 Yet, if he is one of those brought near (to God), 89 then serenity[1701] and fragrant plants and a Garden of Bliss. 90 And if he is one of the fellows of the right, 91 then, “Peace for yousg,” from the fellows of the right. 92 But if he is one of the misguided disbelievers, 93 then the welcome will be scalding water 94 and roasting in purgatory. 95 Indeed, this is surely the truth of certitude. 96 So highly exalt the Name of yoursg Lord, the Great.

57. Iron

57- Al-Hadîd

1 Whatever is in the heavens and the earth has been highly exalting Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise. 2 To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He gives life and causes death, for He is All-Powerful over everything. 3 He is the First and the Last and the Manifest and the Innermost, and He is All-Knowing of everything. 4 It is He Who created the heavens and the earth in six days[1702] then settled over the Throne. He knows what penetrates the earth and what comes out of it, and what descends from the sky and what ascends to it, for He is with youpl wherever you may be. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do. 5 To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah all matters are returned[1703]. 6 He causes the night to penetrate the day and He causes the day to penetrate the night, and He is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests. 7 Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend of that over which He has made you trustees, for those of you who have attained faith and spent—for them is a supreme reward. 8 And what is the matter with youpl that you do not believe in Allah when the Messenger calls you to believe in your Lord—when He has taken[1704] your pledge[1705]— if you are believers? 9 It is He who bestows[1706] upon His servant evident signs from on high to bring youpl out of darkness(es) into light. And towards you Allah is truly Compassionate, Bestowing of mercy. 10 And why is it that youpl do not spend in the way of Allah when to Allah belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest and combated; those are higher in degrees (of rank) than those who spent afterwards and combated, yet to each[1707] Allah has promised the best (reward), and Allah is All-Aware of what you do. 11 Who is it that will lend Allah a good loan, that He may multiply it for him, and for him is a noble reward? 12 On the day when yousg see the believing men and believing women with their light radiating ahead of them and to their right: “Glad tidings for you today: Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein; it is that which is the great triumph.” 13 On the day when the hypocritical men and hypocritical women say to those who believed, “Wait for[1708] us so that we may borrow from your light.” They were told[1709]: “Go back behind you and seek light.” Then a wall with a door was raised between them: within it is mercy and outside of it is punishment. 14 They[1710] call to them[1711], “Were we not with you?” They said, “Yes, but you tempted yourselves and waited and doubted and became deceived by fancies until the command of Allah arrived, and the deceiver[1712] deceived you regarding Allah. 15 So today no ransom is accepted from youpl nor from those who have denied. The Fire is your shelter; it is your patron—and what a miserable destiny!” 16 Is it not time for those who have attained faith: that their hearts should become reverent towards Allah’s Reminder and to that which came down[1713] of the truth, and not be[1714] like those who were given the Scripture previously, but for whom time became prolonged so that their hearts hardened, and many of them are defiantly disobedient? 17 Know that Allah revives the earth after its death; We have made the signs evident for you, that you may reason. 18 Indeed, charitable men and charitable women[1715] who have loaned Allah a good loan—it will be multiplied for them, and for them is a noble reward. 19 And as for those who have attained faith in Allah and His messengers—those are the unwavering believers and the witnesses[1716] who will come as witnesses with their Lord; for them is their reward and their light. But as for those who denied and rejected Our signs—those are the fellows of purgatory. 20 Knowpl that the Earlier Life is only a game and a distraction and an adornment and boasting among you and rivalry in wealth and children: like a rainfall producing plants that delighted the farmers, then it withers and you see it yellowing, then it becomes debris. But in the Hereafter is severe punishment and forgiveness from Allah and (His) good pleasure, for the Earlier Life is nothing but the enjoyment of deception. 21 Race towards forgiveness from yourpl Lord and a Garden (of Paradise) whose width is like the width of the heavens and the earth—prepared for those who have attained faith in Allah and His messengers. That is Allah’s grace; He bestows it upon whomever He wills, and Allah is the Possessor of great grace.  22 No calamity occurs on earth or among yourselves but it is already written in a Record[1717] before We make it— indeed, that is easy for Allah— 23 so that youpl do not grieve over what you have missed nor exult over what He has given[1718] you. And Allah does not love every self-admiring boaster— 24 those who are miserly and command mankind to miserliness. And whoever turns away—indeed, it is Allah who is[1719] the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy. 25 And We certainly sent Our messengers with evident proofs, and We sent down with them the Scripture and the Balance, that mankind may uphold justice. And We sent down iron in which there is intense force and benefits for humanity, and that Allah may know who supports Him and His messengers, though unseen. Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, Almighty. 26 And We certainly sent Noah and Abraham[1720] and established Prophethood and Scripture among their offspring, so some of them are rightly guided, while many of them are defiantly disobedient. 27 Then We sent in their wake Our messengers and followed them with Jesus, son of Mary, and We gave him the Gospel and instilled in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy. But the monasticism which they invented was only to seek Allah’s good pleasure—We did not ordain it for them— yet they did not observe it with its due observance. So We gave those of them who attained faith their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient. 28 O you who have attained faith, be mindful of Allah and believe in His Messenger: He shall (then) bring you a double share of His mercy and shall make for you a light by which you walk and shall forgive you, for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 29 So that the People of the Scripture may know that they have no power whatsoever over Allah’s grace and that all grace is in Allah’s hand; He brings it to whomever He wills, for Allah is the Possessor of great grace.

58. The Arguing Woman

58- Al-Mujâdilah

1 Allah has surely heard the statement of she who argues with yousg concerning her spouse and complains to Allah, and Allah hears yourdl conversation; indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing. 2 Those of you who estrange their wives by equating them with their mothers—they are not their mothers; their mothers are only those who gave birth to them. And indeed, what they say is truly a deplorable thing to say and a blatant lie. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning, Oft-Forgiving. 3 And those who estrange their wives by equating them with their mothers then go back on what they have said—a slave must be set free before they may touch one another. With this youpl are admonished, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do. 4 But whoever cannot find the means must fast for two consecutive months before they may touch one another, and if he is unable—then the feeding of sixty destitute people. This is to affirm yourpl faith in Allah and His Messenger, and these are the limits of Allah. And for the deniers is a painful punishment. 5 Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger have been subdued as those before them were subdued. And we have certainly sent down evident signs. And for the deniers is a demeaning punishment 6 on the day when Allah resurrects them all and informs them of what they did. Allah has kept count of it, but they have forgotten it, and Allah is Witness over all things. 7 Have yousg not seen that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth? There is no secret conversation between three but He is their fourth, nor between five but He is their sixth, nor less than that nor more[1721] but He is with them wherever they may be. Then on the Day of Resurrection He will inform them of what they did; indeed, Allah is All-Knowing of everything. 8 Have yousg not seen those who were prohibited from conversing secretly but then revert to what they were prohibited from? They converse secretly[1722] in sin and hostility and (in) disobedience to the Messenger. And when they come to yousg they greet you with a greeting that Allah never greeted you with, and they say within themselves, “Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?” Hell is enough for them; they will roast in it—so what a miserable destiny! 9 O you who have attained faith, when you converse secretly, do not converse secretly[1723] in sin and hostility and (in) disobedience to the Messenger, but converse in virtue and mindfulness (of God), and be mindful of Allah to Whom you will be herded. 10 Indeed, (malicious) private conversations are from Satan, that those who have attained faith may be sad[1724]. But he cannot harm them at all except by Allah’s leave. And in Allah let the believers place their trust. 11 O you who have attained faith, when you are told, “Make room for one another in assemblies[1725],” then make room so that Allah makes room for you. And when you are told, “Arise,” then arise. Allah elevates by degrees those of you who have attained faith and those given knowledge. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do. 12 O you who have attained faith, when you converse privately with the Messenger, give a donation ahead of your private conversation. That is better for you and cleaner. But if you do not find the means, then Allah is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 13 Are youpl reluctant to give donations before your private conversation? If you do not do so and Allah pardons you, then establish the prayer and bring[1726] the purifying charity[1727] and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do. 14 Have yousg not seen those who allied themselves with a people upon whom is Allah’s wrath? They are neither of youpl nor of them, and they swear to lies while they know (the truth). 15 Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; evil indeed is what they used to do. 16 They took their oaths as a cover and barred (others) from the way of Allah, so for them is a demeaning punishment. 17 Neither their possessions nor their children will avail them anything against Allah. Those are the fellows of the Fire; therein they abide. 18 On the day when Allah resurrects them all together, they swear to Him as they swear to youpl, thinking that they are (standing) upon something. Undoubtedly, it is indeed they themselves who are the liars. 19 Satan has taken hold of them and so has caused them to forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Undoubtedly, it is indeed the party of Satan who are the losers. 20 Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are among the most humiliated[1728]. 21 Allah has prescribed: “I will most surely overcome, I and My messengers.” Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, Almighty. 22 Yousg will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day loving those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brethren or their kinsfolk. Those—He has prescribed faith in their hearts and has aided them with a spirit from Him, and He will enter them into Gardens (of Paradise) beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide. Allah became well pleased with them and they became well pleased with Him. Those are the party of Allah. Undoubtedly, it is indeed the party of Allah who are the successful.

59. Exodus

59- Al-Hashr

1 Whatever is in the heavens and in the earth has been highly exalting Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise. 2 It is He who evicted those who denied among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first exodus[1729] . Youpl did not think they would depart, and they thought their fortresses would protect them from Allah, but Allah came at them from where they never expected and threw terror into their hearts. They[1730] wreck[1731] their houses with their own hands and by the hands of the believers. So take a lesson, O you who are endowed with sight(s). 3 Had Allah not prescribed evacuation for them, He would have punished them in the Earlier (Life), and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire. 4 That is because they went against Allah and His Messenger, and whoever goes against Allah—indeed, Allah is stern in retribution. 5 Whatever palm tree youpl cut down or left standing on its roots, then that was by Allah’s leave and that He may disgrace those who are defiantly disobedient. 6 And whatever Allah has turned over to His Messenger from them, you have spurred neither horse nor camel for them, but Allah gives authority to His messengers over whomever He wills, and Allah is All-Powerful over everything. 7 Whatever Allah has turned over to His Messenger from the people of the towns, then that is for Allah and for the Messenger and for the relative and the orphans and the destitutepl and to the traveler in need, so that it does not circulate exclusively[1732] between the wealthy among you. And whatever the Messenger brings you—accept it, and whatever he forbids you—abstain from it. And be mindful of Allah; indeed, Allah is stern in retribution. 8 (It is) for the poor immigrants[1733] who were evicted from their homes and their possessions, seeking grace from Allah, and (His) good pleasure, and supporting Allah and His Messenger— those are the sincere. 9 And (for) those who, before them, had settled in the homeland and (adopted) the faith—they love those who emigrated to them and find no need in their chests for what has been brought to them, and they give them priority over themselves even if they themselves are needy. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his (inner) self—then it is those[1734] who are the successful. 10 And those who came after them, saying, “Our Lord, forgive us and our brethren who preceded us in faith, and leave no malice in our hearts towards those who have attained faith. Our Lord, You are indeed Compassionate, Bestowing of mercy.” 11 Have yousg not seen those who became hypocrites, saying to their brethren who denied among the People of the Scripture, “Indeed, if you are evicted, we will certainly depart with you and not obey anyone against you, ever, and should anyone combat you, we will certainly support you”? But Allah bears witness that they are certainly liars. 12 Indeed, if they are evicted, they will not depart with them; and indeed, if anyone combats them, they will not support them. And (even) if do they support them, they will (then) certainly turn their backs, then they will not be supported. 13 Indeed, fear of youpl is surely more intense in their chests than fear of Allah; that is because they are people who do not comprehend. 14 They do not combat youpl all together except from fortified strongholds or from behind walls[1735]. Their hostility towards each other is severe. Yousg would think them united, but their hearts are diverse; that is because they are people who do not reason. 15 Like those who shortly before them tasted the grievous consequences of their affairs, and for them is a painful punishment. 16 Like the example of Satan when he said to man, “Deny,” but when he had denied, he said, “I disown you; I fear Allah, Lord of all realms.” 17 So the consequence for both of them was[1736] that they are[1737] in the Fire, abiding therein, and such is the repayment of the unjust. 18 O you who have attained faith, be mindful of Allah, and let every soul look what it has put forth for tomorrow, and be mindful of Allah; indeed, Allah is All-Aware of what you do. 19 And dopl not be like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves; those are the defiantly disobedient. 20 Not equal are the fellows of the Fire and the fellows of the Garden (of Paradise); it is the fellows of the Garden who are the triumphant ones. 21 Had We sent this Recital[1738] down upon a mountain, yousg would have seen it (trembling) in reverence, crumbling in awe of Allah. And these parables We set forth for mankind, that they may reflect. 22 He is Allah, besides Whom there is no god, the Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest; He is the All-Merciful, the Bestower of mercy. 23 He is Allah, besides Whom there is no god, the King, the Holy, the Peace (Giver), the Believer, the Overseer, the Almighty, the Irresistible, the Sublime; Highly Exalted is Allah beyond what they associate. 24 He is Allah, the Creator, the Maker, the Designer; His are the Most Beautiful Names. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth highly exalts Him, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

60. The Woman Tested

60- Al-Mumtahanah

1 O you who have attained faith, do not take My enemies and your enemies as guardians, extending love towards them when they have denied what has come to you of the truth, evicting the Messenger and yourselves because you believe in Allah, your Lord—if you have set out to strive in My way and to seek My pleasure. How can you secretly express love towards them while I know better what you have hidden and what you have made public?
