And whoever of you does that has certainly strayed from the right way. 2 If they encounter youpl, they are enemies to you and they extend their hands and tongues against you with malice, for they would love that you become deniers. 3 Neither your relatives[1739] nor your children will benefit you; on the Day of Resurrection He will decide[1740] between you, for Allah is All-Seeing of what you do. 4 Surely, there has always been an excellent role model for youpl in Abraham[1741] and those with him, when they said to their people, “We disown you and what you worship apart from Allah. We have disbelieved[1742] in you, and enmity and hatred have surfaced between us and you forever until you believe in Allah alone.” Except for the words of Abraham to his father, “I will ask forgiveness for you, though I cannot protect you from Allah.” “Our Lord, in You we have placed our trust, and to You we have turned penitent, for to You is the destiny. 5 Our Lord, do not make us a means of trial for those who have denied, and forgive us, our Lord; You are indeed the Almighty, the All-Wise.” 6 Indeed, there has always been an excellent role model in them for youpl (and) for anyone who has been putting hope in Allah and (expecting) the Last Day. But whoever turns away—indeed, Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy. 7 Hopefully, Allah will produce love between you and those of them whom you took for enemies, for Allah is All-Powerful, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 8 Allah does not forbid youpl from those who have neither combated you over religion nor evicted you from your homes—that you deal with them very kindly and equitably. Indeed, Allah loves the equitable. 9 Rather, Allah forbids youpl from[1743] those who combated you over religion and evicted you from your homes and backed up (your enemies) in your eviction. And whoever takes them as guardians—those are the unjust. 10 O you who have attained faith, when believing women come to you immigrating, test them; Allah knows better about their faith. And if youpl find them to be faithful, do not send them back to the deniers; they are not lawful for them[1744] nor are they lawful for them[1745]. But give them what they have spent[1746]. And no sin is committed by you if you marry them, provided you give them their compensationg. And do not hold on to ties with unbelieving women, but demand what you have spent and let them demand what they have spent. This is Allah’s judgment—He judges among you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise. 11 And if any of yourpl wives should go over to the deniers and then you punish (them in retaliation), then give those whose wives have gone away the equivalent of what they had spent. And be mindful of Allah in whom you are believers. 12 O Prophet, if believing women come to you pledging allegiance to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor steal, nor fornicate, nor kill their children, nor commit perjury as to parenthood, nor disobey you in anything righteous—then accept their allegiance and ask Allah’s forgiveness for them; indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 13 O you who have attained faith, do not take for guardians people upon whom is Allah’s wrath—they have indeed despaired of the Hereafter as the deniers have despaired of the fellows of the graves.

61. Lining Up in Ranks

61- As-Saff

1 Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth has been highly exalting Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise. 2 O you who have attained faith, why do you say what you do not do? 3 It is most loathsome to Allah that youpl say what you do not do. 4 Indeed, Allah loves those who combat in His way, lining up in ranks as though they were a compact structure. 5 And recall when Moses said to his people, “O my people, why do you hurt me, though you know that I am Allah’s Messenger to you?” And when they swerved, Allah caused their hearts to swerve, for Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people. 6 And recall when Jesus, son of Mary, said, “O Children of Israel, I am Allah’s Messenger to you, confirming what preceded me of the Torah and a bearer of glad tidings of a messenger who comes after me, whose name is Ahmad.” Yet when he came to them with evident proofs, they said, “This is evident sorcery[1747].” 7 And who is more unjust than one who fabricated lies against Allah when he was being invited to Islam? Thus Allah does not guide the unjust people. 8 They want to extinguish Allah’s Light with their mouths, but Allah shall perfect His Light, even though the deniers hate it. 9 It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth to make it prevail over all religion, even though the pagans hate it. 10 O you who have attained faith, shall I inform you of a bargain that will save[1748] you from a painful punishment? 11 That youpl believe in Allah and His Messenger, and strive in the way of Allah with your wealth and yourselves; that is better for you, if you only knew— 12 He will forgive youpl your misdeeds and will enter you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, and into beautiful residences in the Gardens of Eden; that is the great triumph. 13 And something else youpl love: support from Allah and an imminent conquest. So give glad tidings to the believers. 14 O you who have attained faith, be the supporters[1749] of Allah as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples, “Who are my supporters towards Allah?” The disciples said, “We are the supporters of Allah.” Then a faction of the Children of Israel attained faith while another faction denied it, and We aided those who had attained faith against their enemy, so they came to prevail.

62. Friday

62- Al-Jumu‘ah

1 Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth highly exalts Allah, the Sovereign, the Holy, the Almighty, the All-Wise. 2 It is He who sent among the gentiles[1750] a messenger from among themselves, reading His signs[1751] to them and purifying them and teaching them the Scripture and wisdom—although they were indeed in evident misguidance before that— 3 and (to) others of them who have not yet joined them[1752]. And He is the Almighty, the All-Wise. 4 That is Allah’s grace which He brings to whomever He wills, and Allah is the Possessor of great grace. 5 The likeness of those who were made to carry (the responsibility of) the Torah but then failed to carry it is as the likeness of the donkey carrying tomes. How miserable is the example of the people who rejected Allah’s signs, for Allah does not guide the unjust people. 6 Saysg, “O you who have Judaized, if you claim to be the allies of Allah apart from (the rest of) mankind, then wish for death if you are truthful.” 7 But they will not wish for it ever due to what their hands have put forth, and Allah is All-Knowing of the unjust. 8 Saysg, “Indeed, the death from which youpl flee—it is bound to encounter you, then you will be returned to the Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest, and He will inform you of what you used to do.” 9 O you who have attained faith, when the call to prayer is made on Friday, hasten to the remembrance of Allah and leave aside all selling; that is better for you if you only knew. 10 Then when the prayer is concluded, disperse through the land and seek Allah’s grace and remember Allah much, that youpl may succeed. 11 Yet whenever they[1753] come across a bargain or distraction they scramble towards it and leave yousg standing. Say, “What is with Allah is better than (any) distraction or bargain, and Allah is the Best of providers.”

63. The Hypocrites

63- Al-Munâfiqûn

1 When the hypocrites come to yousg, they say, “We bear witness that you are most surely Allah’s Messenger.” And Allah knows that you are most surely His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are most surely liars: 2 they have taken their oaths as a cover, and so they have barred (others) from the way of Allah; indeed, evil is what they have been doing. 3 That is because they believed then they denied, so their hearts were sealed—thus they do not comprehend. 4 Yet when yousg see them, their physiques impress you, and when they speak, you listen to what they say. They are like propped-up timber; they think every shout is aimed at them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah strike them down! How can they be averted (from the truth)? 5 And when it is said to them, “Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you,” they keep turning[1754] their heads aside and yousg see them turning away while acting arrogantly. 6 It is the same for them whether yousg ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them—Allah will not forgive them; indeed, Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people. 7 It is they who say: “Do not spend anything on those who side with Allah’s Messenger, that they may disperse.” And to Allah belong the treasuries of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not comprehend. 8 They say, “If we return to al-Madinah, the mightier ones will surely evict the inferior ones.” But might belongs to Allah and His Messenger and the believers, but the hypocrites do not know. 9 O you who have attained faith, let neither your wealth nor your children distract you from the remembrance of Allah, and whoever does that—then those are the losers. 10 And spend from what We have provided for youpl before death approaches one of you, whereupon he says, “My Lord, if only You would delay me for a short while so that I may donate and become of the righteous!” 11 But Allah will not delay a soul when its time has come, for Allah is All-Aware of what youpl do[1755].

64. Mutual Loss and Gain

64- At-Taghâbun

1 Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth highly exalts Allah; to Him belongs the dominion and to Him all praise is due, and He is All-Powerful over everything. 2 It is He Who created you: so some of you are deniers and some of you are believers. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do. 3 He created the heavens and the earth with truth, and He designed youpl and perfected your designs, and to Him is the destiny. 4 He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and He knows whatever youpl keep secret and whatever you make public. For Allah is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests. 5 Has the news not reached youpl of those who denied before, so they tasted the grievous consequences of their affairs? For for them is a painful punishment. 6 That is because their messengers came to them with evident proofs, but they said, “Are human beings going to guide us?” So they denied and turned away, but Allah had no need (for anyone), for Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy. 7 Those who have denied have claimed that they will not be resurrected. Saysg, “Yes indeed, by my Lord, youpl will be resurrected, then you will be informed of whatever you did, for that is easy for Allah.” 8 So have faith in Allah and His Messenger and the Light[1756] which We have sent down. For Allah is All-Aware of what you do. 9 The day when He[1757] gathers youpl for the Day of Gathering—that is the Day of Mutual Loss and Gain. And whoever attains faith in Allah and acts righteously, He[1758] will remit his evil deeds and He will enter him into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever; that is the great triumph. 10 But those who denied and rejected Our signs—those are the fellows of the Fire, abiding therein, and what a miserable destiny! 11 No disaster occurs except by Allah’s leave. And whoever believes in Allah—He guides his heart. For Allah is All-Knowing of everything. 12 So obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if youpl turn away, then surely Our Messenger’s only duty is evident proclamation. 13 Allah—there is no god but He. So in Allah let the believers place their trust. 14 O you who have attained faith, indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive—then indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 15 Indeed, your wealth and your children are but a means of trial, while with Allah is a great reward. 16 So be mindful of Allah as much as youpl can, and listen and obey and give (in charity) for your own good. For whoever is protected from the stinginess of his (inner) self—those are the successful. 17 If youpl lend Allah a good loan, He will multiply it for you and will forgive you, for Allah is Ever Thankful, Forbearing— 18 the Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

65. Divorce

65- At-Talâq

1 O Prophet, when youpl divorce[1759] women, then divorce them at a time when their (waiting) period can properly start, and calculate the period carefully. And be mindful of Allah, yourpl Lord. Do not evict them from their houses nor shall they depart, unless they have committed an evident obscenity[1760]. Those are the limits of Allah, and whoever oversteps Allah’s limits, then he has surely been unjust to himself. Yousg never know—Allah may afterwards bring about a new matter. 2 Once they have reached their term, either retainpl them in accordance with what is fair or separate from them in accordance with what is fair. And call to witness two just people from among you and give upright testimony for Allah. That is to admonish whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, for whoever is mindful of Allah—He will make for him a way out (of every difficulty) 3 and will provide for him from where he never expects, and whoever places his  trust in Allah—He will suffice him. Allah shall indeed conclude His decreed matters; Allah has set a due measure for everything. 4 And those of your women who have despaired of (further) menstruation—if you have any doubts, their (waiting) period shall be three months, and also for those who have not menstruated[1761]. And those who are pregnant—their term shall be until they have delivered. And whoever is mindful of Allah—He will ease his affairs. 5 That is Allah’s command which He has sent down to youpl. And whoever is mindful of Allah—He will remit his evil deeds and amplify his reward. 6 Allow them[1762] to reside where youpl have been residing according to your means, and do not harass them to make things difficult for them. And if they are pregnant, spend for them until they deliver. And if they nurse your infant, pay them their reward and conduct your relation in accordance with what is fair. But if you disagree, then another woman will nurse him. 7 The wealthy one shall spend according to his means, and the one whose resources have been restrained shall spend according to what Allah has given him. Allah never tasks any self beyond what He has brought it; Allah shall bring ease after hardship. 8 And how many a town has defied the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We held it to a strict reckoning and We punished it with a dreadful punishment: 9 it tasted the grievous consequence of its affairs, and the consequence of its affairs was perdition. 10 Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment, so beware of Allah, O you who possess intellect and have attained faith. Allah has sent down to you a Reminder— 11 a messenger who reads to you Allah’s signs[1763], (which are) clarifying[1764], in order to bring out those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds from darkness into light. And whoever believes in Allah and acts righteously—He[1765] will enter him into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever; Allah has surely given him an excellent provision. 12 Allah is He Who created seven heavens, and their like of earth. The command descends between them so that youpl may know that Allah is Powerful over everything and that Allah has encompassed everything in knowledge.

66. Prohibition

66-At-Tahrîm

1 O Prophet, why do you prohibit what Allah has permitted for you, seeking to please your spouses? Yet Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy. 2 Allah has already ordained for youpl the dissolution of your oaths, for Allah is your Patron, and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. 3 And recall when the Prophet confided a matter to some of his spouses, then as soon as one (of them) disclosed it (to another wife) and Allah made it known to him, he communicated part of it[1766] and disregarded another part. Then, when he informed her of it, she said, “Who informed you of this?” He said, “The All-Knowing, the All-Aware informed me.” 4 If youdl repent[1767] to Allah, then your hearts have listened. But if both of you band together against him, then Allah is his Patron, as are Gabriel and the righteous believers. And, in addition, the angels will back him. 5 Perhaps, if he divorces[1768] youpl, his Lord will give him in exchange better spouses than you: Muslim[1769], believing, devout, repentant, given to worshiping, given to fasting—whether previously married or virgins. 6 O you who have attained faith, shield yourselves and your families from a fire whose fuel is people and stones; over it are fierce and powerful angels who never disobey Allah in anything He commands them, and they carry out whatever they are commanded. 7 O you who have denied, make no excuses today; indeed, you are only being repaid for what you used to do. 8 O you who have attained faith, repent to Allah with sincere[1770] repentance; hopefully your Lord will remit your evil deeds and enter you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the day when Allah will never disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. With their light streaming before them and to their right, they say, “Our Lord, perfect our light for us and forgive us; You are indeed All-Powerful over everything.” 9 O Prophet, strive hard against the deniers and the hypocrites, and be stern with them. And their shelter is Hell, and what a miserable destiny! 10 Allah has set forth a parable for those who denied: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot; they were under two servants of Our righteous servants but they betrayed them, so they availed them nothing against Allah, and it was said, “Enter the Fire with those who are entering.” 11 And Allah has set forth a parable for those who have attained faith: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, “My Lord, build for me, with you, a house in the Garden (of Paradise), and deliver me from Pharaoh and his actions, and deliver me from the unjust people.” 12 And Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, and so We breathed into her of Our Spirit, and she believed in her Lord’s Words and His Scriptures[1771] and was one of the devout.

67. Dominion

67- Al-Mulk

1 Supremely Blessed be He in whose hand is the dominion, and He is All- Powerful over everything; 2 the One Who created death and life to test youpl as to which of you is better in conduct, for He is the Almighty, the Oft-Forgiving; 3 the One Who created seven heavens in layers: yousg see no discrepancy in the creation of the All-Merciful. So look again: can you see any splits? 4 Then look again and again—yoursg sight will return to you bedazzled and exhausted. 5 And indeed, We have adorned the lowest[1772] heaven with lanterns and made them missiles against the Satans, and We have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze. 6 And for those who have denied their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and what a miserable destiny! 7 When they are thrown into it, they hear it roaring as it seethes— 8 it almost bursts with rage. Every time a crowd is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, “Did no warner come to you?” 9 They said[1773], “Yes, a warner did come to us, but we disbelieved and said, ‘Allah did not bestow anything from on high; it is youpl who are greatly misguided!’” 10 And they said, “Had we listened or reasoned, we would not have been among the fellows of the Blaze.” 11 Thus they acknowledged their misdeed, so away with the fellows of the Blaze. 12 Indeed, for those who fear their Lord though Unseen, there is forgiveness and a supreme reward. 13 And keep yourpl words secret or say them aloud—indeed, He is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests. 14 Would He not know whomever He has created, while He is the Subtle, the All-Aware? 15 It is He who made the earth manageable for youpl, so walk through its regions and eat of His provision, and to Him is the Resurrection. 16 Are youpl confident that the One in heaven will not cause the earth to collapse beneath you as it spins? 17 Or are you confident that the One in heaven will not unleash against you a violent storm? Then you will know what My[1774] warning is like. 18 And surely those before them disbelieved (as well), so how terrible was My condemnation! 19 Have they not seen the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them? None holds them except the All-Merciful; indeed, He is All-Seeing of everything. 20 Or who is this who is an army for youpl, supporting you, apart from the All-Merciful? Indeed, the deniers are in nothing but a deception. 21 Or who is this that will provide for you if He withholds His provision? Rather, they persist in defiance and aversion. 22 Is one who walks bent on his own face better guided or one who walks upright on a straight path? 23 Saysg, “It is He Who initiated youpl and made for you hearing and sight(s) and burning hearts; rarely do you give thanks.” 24 Saysg, “It is He Who scattered youpl on earth, and to Him you will be herded.” 25 And they say, “When will this promise be fulfilled if youpl are truthful?” 26 Saysg, “Indeed, knowledge is only with Allah, and indeed, I am only an evident warner.” 27 But when they saw it approaching, the faces of those who had denied turned gloomy, and it was said, “This is what youpl used to claim[1775] (would never happen).” 28 Saysg, “Have you seen: if Allah makes me and those with me perish or has mercy on us, who then will protect the deniers from a painful punishment?” 29 Saysg, “He is the All-Merciful; we have attained faith in Him, and in Him alone we have placed our trust, and soon youpl will know[1776] who is in evident misguidance.” 30 Saysg, “Have youpl seen: if your water drains away, who then will bring you pure running water?”

68. The Pen

68- Al-Qalam

1 Nûn. By the pen and all that they inscribe. 2 Yoursg Lord’s blessing does not make you a madman. 3 And most surely, for yousg is an unfailing reward. 4 And very truly, yousg are of great moral character. 5 Thus yousg shall see and they shall see 6 which of you is the demented. 7 Indeed, yoursg Lord is He Who knows better who has strayed from His way, and it is He Who knows better of the rightly guided. 8 So do not obey the disbelievers; 9 they would like you to compromise, then they too would compromise. 10 And do not obey any despicable swearer, 11 backbiter, spreader of malicious gossip, 12 preventer of good, transgressor, sinful, 13 brutal; moreover, of spurious parentage! 14 Just[1777] because he has money and sons, 15 when Our signs[1778] are read to him, he says, “Legends of the ancients!” 16 We will brand him on the snout. 17 Indeed, We have tested them as We tested the fellows of the garden, when they swore to harvest it in the morning 18 without any reservation. 19 Then a sweeping visitation from yoursg Lord swept through it while they were asleep, 20 and in the morning it was as though harvested. 21 So they called to each other in the early morning: 22 “Go early to yourpl field if you are going to harvest.” 23 So they set out, murmuring to one another, 24 “Not one destitute person is to enter it upon youpl today.” 25 And early they went, resolved in intent. 26 But when they saw it, they said, “Indeed, we are surely misguided; 27 rather, we are deprived.” 28 The most reasonable of them said, “Did I not tell youpl, ‘if only you would highly exalt (God)?’” 29 They said, “Highly Exalted is our Lord; indeed, we were unjust.” 30 Then they turned to each other, blaming one another. 31 They said, “Woe to us; indeed, we have exceeded all limits. 32 Perhaps our Lord will give us a better substitute for it. Indeed, to our Lord we turn wishfully.” 33 Such is the punishment (of this world); but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew. 34 Indeed, for the people who are mindful (of God) are Gardens of Bliss, with their Lord. 35 Shall We treat the Muslims[1779] like the criminals? 36 What is the matter with youpl? How do you judge? 37 Or do you have a scripture in which you study, 38 wherein there is whatever you choose? 39 Or do you have oaths from Us, binding until the Day of Resurrection, that you will have whatever you demand? 40 Asksg them which of them guarantees that. 41 Or do they have associates? Then let them bring their associates if they are truthful. 42 On the day when the shin is exposed[1780] and they are called to prostrate themselves, but they[1781] are unable to. 43 Their sight(s) (subdued) in reverence, humiliation overwhelms them, for they had been called to prostrate themselves when they were sound. 44 So leavesg Me to those who reject this discourse; We will draw them forth gradually (to punishment) from where they do not know. 45 And I will give them respite. Indeed, My plot is firm. 46 Or do yousg ask them for a reward, so they are burdened with debt? 47 Or do they have (knowledge of) the hidden realm and they are writing it down?  48 So wait patiently for the Decree of yoursg Lord, and do not be like the Fellow of the Whale, who cried out in despair. 49 Were it not for his Lord’s favor that reached him, he would have been thrown into the wilderness, fully despised. 50 But his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous. 51 Those who have denied almost stab yousg with their sight(s) when they hear the Reminder, and say, “He is indeed a madman!” 52 But it is nothing other than a Reminder to (all creatures of) all realms.

69. The Reality

69- Al-Hâqqah

1 The Reality. 2 What is the Reality? 3 And what can make yousg realize what the Reality is? 4 Thamûd and ʻĀd disbelieved in   the Shocking Event. 5 So as for Thamûd, they were annihilated by the Overwhelming. 6 And as for ʻĀd, they were annihilated by a furious, roaring wind 7 which He unleashed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so yousg could see the people tossed around as though they were stumps of hollow palm trees. 8 So can yousg see any remnant of them? 9 Then Pharaoh and whoever was before him[1782] and the Overturned Cities[1783] came up with grave offenses 10 and disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with an overpowering grip. 11 Indeed, when the waters overflowed We carried youpl in the running ship, 12 making it a lesson for youpl—so that an attentive ear may take heed. 13 Then, when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast, 14 and the earth and the mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single crush— 15 on that day, the Inevitable Event shall come to pass 16 and the heaven shall crack, for on that day it shall be frail. 17 And the angels are ranged around its borders, while eight carry the Throne of yoursg Lord above them on that day. 18 On that day youpl are presented, and no hidden secret of yours remains hidden. 19 So as for the one who was given his record[1784] in his right hand, he says, “Here, take my record and read it. 20 Indeed, I was certain that I would meet my reckoning.” 21 So he will be in a well-pleasing living, 22 in a lofty Garden (of Paradise), 23 its clusters (of fruit) within reach— 24 “Eat and drink with satisfaction on account of what youpl did[1785] in the days gone by.” 25 But as for the one who was given his recorda in his left hand, he says, “I wish I was never given my record 26 and never knew what my reckoning was. 27 If only it was the end! 28 My money cannot avail me; 29 my power has vanished from me.” 30 “Takepl him and shackle him, 31 then scorch him in purgatory, 32 then in a chain whose length is seventy cubits tie him up. 33 For he would not believe in Allah, the Great, 34 nor would he urge (others to serve) food to the destitutesg. 35 So he has no intimate (friend) here today, 36 nor any food except scum, 37 which none eats except the wrongdoers.” 38 So I swear by what youpl see 39 and what you do not see: 40 it is indeed the word[1786] of a noble messenger 41 and in no way is it the word of a poet—little do youpl believe[1787], 42 nor is it the speech of a soothsayer—little do you remind yourselves[1788]. 43 (It is) a bestowal from on high by the Lord of all realms. 44 And had he falsely attributed some statements to Us, 45 We would certainly have seized him strongly[1789], 46 then We would certainly have slashed his aorta, 47 and in no way could any of you have defended him. 48 And indeed, it is a reminding for the mindfulpl (of God). 49 And indeed, We do know that some of you are disbelievers. 50 And indeed, it is surely a source of grief for the deniers. 51 And indeed, it is surely the truth of certitude. 52 So highly exalt the name of yoursg Lord, the Great.

70. Ways of Ascent

70- Al-Ma‘ârij

1 An asker asked[1790] about a punishment sure to come 2 for the deniers, that none can repel— 3 from Allah, Lord of the Ways of Ascent. 4 Unto Him the angels and the Spirit ascend on a day the duration of which is fifty thousand years. 5 So besg patient with beautiful patience. 6 Indeed, they see it distant, 7 but We see it near— 8 on the day when the sky is like molten brass, 9 and the mountains are like tufted wool, 10 and no intimate (friend) asks[1791] his intimate (friend)— 11 though they are shown each other. The criminal wishes he could be redeemed from the punishment of that day[1792] by sacrificing his children 12 and his female companion and his brother 13 and his kinsfolk who shelter him 14 and everyone on earth, so it would then save him. 15 But no! It is a raging fire 16 that strips[1793] away the scalps, 17 inviting the one who had retreated and turned away[1794] 18 and accumulated (wealth) and hoarded. 19 Indeed, man was created fretful: 20 when touched by adversity he is impatient, 21 and when touched by good he is ungenerous; 22 except the prayerfulpl 23 who are[1795] constant at their prayers; 24 and those in whose wealth is a rightfully acknowledged share 25 for the asker and the deprived; 26 and those who believe in the Day of Recompense; 27 and those who fear their Lord’s punishment— 28 indeed, none can feel secure from their Lord’s punishment; 29 and those who preserve their private parts[1796], 30 except from their spouses or those whom they rightfully possess—for then they are indeed not blameworthy. 31 But whoever seeks to go beyond that, then those are the transgressors; 32 and those who are faithful to their trusts[1797] and their covenant; 33 and those who stand by their testimonies[1798]; 34 and those who preserve their prayers— 35 those are honored in Gardens (of Paradise). 36 So what is with those who have denied, craning their necks towards yousg, 37 from the right and from the left, banding together? 38 Does every one of them ardently hope to be entered into a Garden of Bliss? 39 But no! Indeed, We created them from what they know. 40 So I swear by the Lord of the Easts and the Wests that We are surely able 41 to replace them with better than them, and We cannot be outstripped. 42 So letsg them blunder and play until they meet[1799] their day which they are promised— 43 the day when they come out of the tombs in a rush, as though they are hurrying towards some statues[1800], 44 their sight(s) (subdued) in reverence, humiliation overwhelming them. That is the day which they were promised.

71. Noah

71- Nûh

1 Indeed, We sent Noah to his people: “Warn your people before there comes upon them a painful punishment.” 2 He said, “O my people, indeed, I am an evident warner to you: 3 that you should worship Allah and be mindful of Him, and obey me. 4 He will then forgive youpl your misdeeds and reprieve you until (you fulfill) a stated term; indeed, Allah’s term cannot be deferred once it has come, if you only knew.” 5 He said, “My Lord, I have called my people night and day, 6 but my call has only made them flee the more. 7 And indeed, every time I called them, that You may forgive them, they put their fingers into their ears and wrapped themselves in their garments and insisted and became extremely arrogant. 8 Then I called them openly, 9 then I spoke to them publicly and I spoke to them privately, 10 and I said, ‘Ask your Lord for forgiveness–indeed, He has always been Forgiving. 11 He will send (rain from) the sky upon youpl in showers 12 and supply you with wealth and children and allot for you Gardens (of Paradise) and allot for you rivers. 13 What is the matter with youpl that you do not expect (a reward for having) reverence towards Allah 14 although He created you in stages? 15 Have youpl not seen how Allah has created seven heavens in layers? 16 And He has made the moon therein a light, and He has made the sun a lamp. 17 And Allah has germinated youpl from the (dust of the) land, 18 then He will return you into it and will bring you out again. 19 And Allah has made the land a spread for youpl, 20 that you may travel its pathways made broad.’” 21 Noah said, “My Lord, indeed, they have disobeyed me and followed one whose wealth and children increased him in nothing but in loss. 22 And they schemed outrageous schemes, 23 saying, ‘Do not abandon yourpl gods, and do not abandon Wadd, nor Souwaʻ, nor Yaghooth and Yaʻooq and Nasra[1801]. 24 And truly, they have misguided many, so do not increase the unjust except in misguidance.” 25 For their offenses, they were drowned then hurled into a fire, and they did not find any supporters apart from Allah. 26 And Noah said, “My Lord, do not leave of the deniers a single dweller in the land. 27 Indeed, if You leave them, they will misguide your servants and beget none but wicked relentless deniers. 28 My Lord, forgive me and my parents and anyone who enters my house as a believer, and all the believing men and believing women, and do not increase the unjust except in perdition.”

72. The Jinn

72- Al-Jinn

1 Saysg, “It was revealed to me that a band of unseen beings[1802] listened in and said, ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous Recital[1803] 2 that guides to prudence, so we have come to believe in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord. 3 And that[1804] most high is the Grandeur of our Lord—He never took a female companion nor a child. 4 And thatd our fool used to speak untruthfully about Allah. 5 And that[1805] we thought that humans and unseen beings would never say[1806] a lie about Allah. 6 And thatd certain men among humans used to seek refuge in certain men among the unseen beings, but they only increased them in confusion. 7 And thata they thought, as youpl thought, that Allah would never resurrect anyone. 8 And thata we sought to reach the heaven and found it filled with stern guards and meteors. 9 And thata we used to take up positions to listen in, but whoever listens now finds a meteor in wait for him. 10 And thata we do not know whether ill has been desired for those on earth, or if their Lord has desired prudence for them. 11 And thata some of us are righteous, but some of us are less than that: we have been following divergent roads. 12 And that[1807] we realized that we cannot thwart Allah on earth, nor can we thwart Him by fleeing. 13 And thata when we heard the guidance we believed in it, for whoever believes in his Lord fears neither loss nor confusion. 14 And thata among us are Muslims[1808] and among us are those who swerve from justice, so whoever has become Muslim—it is they who have pursued prudence. 15 But as for those who swerve from justice—they have become firewood for Hell.’” 16 But had they gone straight on the right mode (of life), We would have given them plenty of water to drink, 17 so as to test them with it. And whoever disregards the remembrance of his Lord—He[1809] will insert him into a mounting punishment. 18 And (say) that mosques belong to Allah, so do not call upon anyone along with Allah. 19 And that[1810] when the servant of Allah got up, calling upon Him (in prayers), they almost fell on him in a mass[1811]. 20 Say[1812], “Indeed, I pray only to my Lord, and I never associate anyone with Him.” 21 Saysg, “Indeed, I possess for youpl neither harm nor prudence.” 22 Saysg, “Indeed, no one can protect me from Allah, and I will not find any refuge except with Him. 23 (I have nothing) except for a proclamation from Allah and His messages, and whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger—for him is the fire of Hell, abiding therein forever. 24 Only when they see what they are promised, will they then know who has weaker helpers and is fewer in numbers. 25 Saysg, “I do not know whether what youpl are promised is near, or whether my Lord will extend it for a period. 26 The Knower of the hidden realm—so He does not disclose His hidden realm to anyone 27 except to a Messenger of His choosing, for He then dispatches guards before him and behind him, 28 that He may know[1813] that they have compiled and proclaimed the messages of their Lord. But He has encompassed what they have, and has tallied everything by number.”

73. The Enwrapped

73- Al-Muzzammil

1 O you enwrapped one, 2 stand up[1814] during the night except a little– 3 for half of it or reduce it a little 4 or add to it, and chant the Recital[1815] slowly and distinctly. 5 Indeed, We are about to cast upon yousg a heavy word. 6 The vigil of the night is indeed more intense[1816] and more upright for articulation. 7 Indeed, in the daytime yousg have lengthy work to do. 8 So remember the Name of yoursg Lord and devote yourself to Him with (solemn) devotion. 9 (He is) the Lord[1817] of the East and the West; there is no god but He, so take Him as a Trustee. 10 And endure patiently what they say, and withdraw from them politely. 11 And leave to Me the disbelievers, those of luxury, and give them a brief respite. 12 Indeed, We have shackles and a purgatory 13 and food that chokes and a painful punishment 14 on the day when the earth and the mountains tremble and the mountains became[1818] heaps of sand. 15 Indeed, We have sent to youpl a messenger as a witness over you, as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger. 16 But Pharaoh disobeyed the Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing. 17 So how, if youpl deny, will you guard yourselves from a day which turns children gray-haired? 18 The heaven shatters thereby; His promise has always been fulfilled. 19 Indeed, this is a reminding, so whoever wills, let him take a way to his Lord. 20 Indeed, yoursg Lord knows that you stand up nearly two-thirds of the night, and (sometimes you stand up) half of it[1819], and (sometimes you stand up) one-third of it, along with a faction of those with you. And Allah determines the night and the day. He has known that youpl will be unable to sustain it, so He has pardoned you. So recite of the Recital[1820] whatever is easy (for you). He knew that some of you will be ill, and others traveling through the land seeking a share of Allah’s grace, and others combating in the way of Allah, so read of it what is possible for you, and establish the prayer, and bring[1821] the purifying charity[1822], and lend Allah a good loan. And whatever good you advance for yourselves, you will find it with Allah; it will be better and greater in reward. And seek Allah’s forgiveness; indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.

74. The Enrobed

74- Al-Muddaththir

1 O you shrouded (in your mantle)— 2 stand up and warn! 3 And yoursg Lord glorify! 4 And yoursg clothes purify! 5 And abominations forsakesg! 6 And showsg no favor, seeking self-gain! 7 And to yoursg Lord endure patiently! 8 So when the Trumpet is blown, 9 that day will be a difficult day 10 for the deniers—not easy. 11 Leavesg to Me the one whom I created alone, 12 and to whom I gave vast wealth 13 and children by his side, 14 and smoothed things for him— 15 yet he ardently hopes that I give more! 16 But no! He was stubborn towards Our signs[1823] 17 I will exhaust him increasingly. 18 He thought and determined. 19 May he perish[1824]—how he determined! 20 Again: may he perish—how he determined! 21 Then he looked, 22 then he frowned and scowled, 23 then he retreated and acted arrogantly 24 and said, “This is nothing but sorcery from the past. 25 This is nothing but the word of a human being.” 26 I will roast him in Saqar[1825]. 27 But what can make yousg realize what Saqar is? 28 It neither leaves nor spares; 29 it scorches the flesh; 30 over it are nineteen. 31 And We have not appointed except angels to be wardens of the Fire and have made their number nothing but a means of trial for the deniers—so that those given the Scripture may attain certitude, and those who have attained belief may increase in faith, and those given the Scripture and the believers may not doubt, and so that those in whose hearts is sickness and the deniers may say, “What did Allah desire by this parable?” Thus Allah misguides whomever He wills and guides whomever He wills, and none knows the soldiers of yoursg Lord except He, and this is nothing but a reminder to human beings. 32 But no! By the moon. 33 By the night as it retreated. 34 By the morning when it lights up— 35 indeed, it is one of the greatest things:  36 a warning to human beings, 37 to whomever of you who wishes to advance or regress. 38 Every single self is held in pledge for what it has earned, 39 except for those on the Right— 40 in Gardens (of Paradise), inquiring 41 about the criminals: 42 “What drove yousg into Saqar?” 43 They said, “We were not of those who prayed, 44 nor did we feed the destitutesg, 45 and we used to indulge (in falsehood) with those who indulged, 46 and we used to deny the Day of Recompense, 47 until the certitude (of death) came to us.” 48 So in no way can the intercession of intercessors help them. 49 So why are they disregarding the Reminder, 50 as though they were panicked donkeys[1826], 51 having fled from a lion? 52 Yet every one of them wants to be given scrolls unrolled. 53 But no! Rather, they do not fear the Hereafter. 54 But no! It is a Reminder. 55 So whoever wills shall remember it. 56 Yet they[1827] will not remember unless Allah wills; He is Worthy of mindfulness and Worthy of (bestowing) forgiveness.

75. The Resurrection

75- Al-Qiyâmah

1 No![1828] I swear by the Day of Resurrection. 2 And, no! I swear by the reproaching (inner) self. 3 Does man think that We will not reassemble his bones? 4 Yes indeed; We are Able to form his very fingertips. 5 Rather, man wants to commit vice ever onward.  6 He asks, “When is the Day of Resurrection?” 7 So, when the sight is dazzled[1829], 8 and the moon is eclipsed, 9 and the sun and the moon are joined together— 10 man says on that day, “Where is the escape?” 11 But no! There is no refuge. 12 To yoursg Lord on that day everything comes to reside. 13 Man is informed on that day of whatever he put forth and whatever he left behind. 14 Rather, man is an eyewitness against himself, 15 even as he presents his excuses. 16 Do not rush yoursg tongue with it[1830] to hurry on with it. 17 Indeed, upon Us is its collection and its recitation. 18 So, when We have recited it, followsg its recitation; 19 then upon Us is its explanation. 20 But no! Rather, youpl love the fleeting life 21 and you[1831] leave aside the Hereafter. 22 Some faces on that day are radiant, 23 looking towards their Lord. 24 And some faces on that day are gloomy, 25 expecting that a back-breaking blow will be dealt them. 26 But no! Rather, when it[1832] has reached the collarbone, 27 and it is said, “Who is the healer?” 28 And one realizes that it is the final departure, 29 and leg is entwined with leg[1833]— 30 to yoursg Lord on that day is the driving (of people). 31 Then, (as for) one who neither believed nor prayed, 32 but disbelieved and turned away, 33 then went to his family, strutting— 34 (this punishment is) more and more suitable for yousg. 35 Then again, more and more suitable for you. 36 Does man think that he will be left without purpose? 37 Was he not a drop of emitted semen[1834]? 38 Then he became a clinging form, which He then created and formed? 39 And made of him the two spouses[1835], the male and the female? 40 Is not that One Able to revive the dead?

76. Man

76- Al-Insân

1 Has there come upon man a period of time when he was nothing to be mentioned? 2 Indeed, We created man from a mingled sperm drop to try him, and We made him hearing and seeing. 3 Indeed, We have guided him to the way, be he thankful or a staunch denier. 4 Indeed, We have prepared for the deniers chains and yokes and a blaze. 5 Indeed, the virtuous drink from a cup whose mixture is camphor— 6 a spring from which Allah’s servants drink, making it gush abundantly. 7 They fulfill (their) vows and fear a day of widespread evil, 8 and they feed—for the love of Him—(any) destitute person and (any)  orphan and (any) captive. 9 “Indeed, we only feed youpl for the sake of Allah; We want from you neither repayment nor thankfulness. 10 Indeed, we fear from our Lord a frowning, grim day.” 11 So Allah shielded them from the ills of that day and made them receive radiance and joy 12 and repaid them for their patience with a Garden (in paradise) and silk (garments); 13 reclining therein on couches, they see therein neither (the heat of a) sun nor freezing cold. 14 And its shades hover over them, and its clusters (of fruit) are brought low within reach. 15 And passing around them are vessels of silver and cups of crystal— 16 crystalline silver cups—that they measured out with perfect measure. 17 And they are served in it with a cup whose flavor is a mixture of ginger, 18 (from) a spring therein named Salsabeel. 19 And passing among them are immortal youths; when yousg see them, you think them sprinkled pearls. 20 And when yousg see, you see there bliss and a vast Dominion. 21 Upon them are green garments of silk, and (upon them is) brocade[1836], and they have been adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord has offered them a pure drink. 22 “Indeed, this is a repayment for youpl, and your efforts have been well thanked.” 23 Indeed, We—We alone—have surely bestowed the Recital[1837] upon yousg from on high. 24 So wait patiently for the judgment of yoursg Lord, and do not obey any sinner or any staunch denier among them. 25 And remember[1838] the Name of yoursg Lord morning and evening, 26 and for part of the night prostrate yourself to Him, and highly exalt Him long into the night. 27 Indeed, these[1839] love the fleeting life and leave behind them a heavy day. 28 We have created them and have strengthened their frame, and whenever We will, We can replace them entirely with others like them. 29 Indeed, this is a Reminder. So whoever wills, let him take a way to his Lord. 30 Yet youpl cannot[1840] will, unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah has always been All-Knowing, All- Wise. 31 He enters into His mercy whomever He wills, and the unjust— He has prepared for them a painful punishment.

77. The Unleashed

77- Al-Mursalât

1 By those unleashed in succession[1841], 2 and by those storming turbulently[1842]. 3 By those scattering far and wide, 4 and by those separating decisively, 5 and by those casting a Reminder[1843], 6 excusing or warning–– 7 indeed, what youpl are promised is sure to come. 8 So when the stars are obliterated, 9 and when the sky is fractured, 10 and when the mountains are blown away, 11 and when the messengers are gathered to their appointed time–– 12 to which day is it deferred? 13 To the Day of Decision. 14 And what can make yousg realize what the Day of Decision is? 15 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 16 Did We not destroy the ancients, 17 then follow them up with the later ones? 18 This is how We deal with the criminals. 19 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 20 Did We not create youpl from a despicable fluid, 21 then lodged it in a secure place 22 for a known term? 23 And We have determined, so what excellent determiners are We! 24 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 25 Did We not make the earth a homestead 26 for the living and the dead, 27 and set on it lofty, firm mountains, and gave you pure water to drink? 28 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 29 “Proceed to what youpl used to disbelieve in. 30 Proceed[1844] to a shadow that rises in three different columns, 31 offering no shade and unavailing against the flames.” 32 It shoots sparks like huge buildings, 33 as if they are yellow[1845] camels. 34 Woe on that day to the disbelievers 35 This is a day when they do not speak, 36 nor are they allowed to apologize. 37 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 38 This is the Day of Decision; We have gathered youpl, together with the ancients. 39 So if you have a plot, then plot against Me. 40 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 41 Indeed, the mindful (of God) are amidst shades and springs 42 and fruits as they desire. 43 “Eat and drink pleasantly on account of what youpl used to do.” 44 Indeed, this is how We repay those who excel in doing good. 45 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 46 “Eat and enjoy yourselves a little; youpl are indeed criminals.” 47 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 48 And when it is said to them, “Bow down”, they do not bow down. 49 Woe on that day to the disbelievers. 50 So in what discourse, beyond this, will they believe?

78. The Tiding

78- An-Naba’

 1 What are they asking one another about? 2 About the Great Tiding, 3 over which they differ. 4 But no, surely they will find out! 5 Once again, no, surely they will find out! 6 Did We not make the earth a resting place, 7 and the mountains as pegs? 8 And created youpl in pairs? 9 And made your sleep for rest, 10 and made the night a garment, 11 and made the day for livelihood? 12 And built above you seven strong ones, 13 and made a glowing lamp? 14 And brought down from the clouds pouring water, 15 to bring out with it grains and plants 16 and luxuriant gardens? 17 Indeed, the Day of Decision has been appointed: 18 the day when the Trumpet is blown, and you come in crowds, 19 and the sky was[1846] opened[1847] up and became gateways, 20 and the mountains were set in motion and became a mirage. 21 Indeed, Hell has been lying in ambush—22 a destination for those who exceed all limits, 23 where they remain[1848] for eons, 24 tasting therein neither coolness nor drink, 25 except scalding water and purulence— 26 a fitting repayment, 27 for they were not expecting any reckoning, 28 and they disbelieved Our signs with utter disbelief. 29 But We have enumerated everything in writing. 30 So taste, for We will not increase youpl except in punishment! 31 Indeed, for the mindfulpl (of God) there is triumph: 32 Gardens (of Paradise) and vineyards; 33 and high-class spouses, well-matched; 34 and overflowing cups. 35 They hear therein neither idle talk nor lies— 36 a repayment from yoursg Lord, a measured gift, 37 (from) the Lord[1849] of the heavens and the earth and everything between them, (from) the All-Merciful. They have no authority from Him to speak 38 on the day when the Spirit and the angels line up in ranks, not speaking—except whomever the All-Merciful has permitted and who has said what is right. 39 That is the True Day. So whoever wills, let him take a route to return to his Lord. 40 Indeed, We have warned youpl of a near punishment—the day when a person looks at what his hands have put forth, and the denier says, “If only I were dust!”

79. The Snatchers

79- An-Nâzi‘ât

 1 By those who snatch violently[1850]. 2 By those who remove gently. 3 By those who glide smoothly, 4 and by those who race swiftly, 5 and by those who regulate matters— 6 on the day when the Quake quakes 7 and is followed by the Successor, 8 hearts on that day are pounding, 9 their sight(s) (subdued) in reverence. 10 They say, “Can it be[1851] that we will really be restored to the original condition? 11 Can that be[1852] when we have become worn out[1853] bones?” 12 They said[1854], “This is a losing return.” 13 Yet, indeed, it is nothing but a single nudge, 14 and they are all awake. 15 Has the story of Moses reached yousg? 16 When His Lord called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa, 17 “Go to Pharaoh—indeed, he has exceeded all limits— 18 and say, ‘Do yousg care to be purified? 19 And I will guide you to your Lord, so you will be in awe.’” 20 So he showed him the biggest sign, 21 but he disbelieved and disobeyed, 22 then retreated in haste 23 and gathered and proclaimed. 24 He said, “I am yourpl Lord, the most high.” 25 So Allah seized him with an exemplary punishment, in the Last (life) and in the First. 26 Indeed, in this is a lesson for whoever fears. 27 Are youpl more difficult to create or the heaven? He constructed it: 28 He raised its masses and proportioned it, 29 and He dimmed its night and brought out its daylight. 30 And the earth, after that—He spread it out; 31 from it He brought out its water and its pasture, 32 and the mountains He anchored— 33 a source of enjoyment for youpl and for your livestock. 34 So when the Biggest Catastrophe arrives— 35 on the day when man reminds himself of what he has endeavored, 36 and purgatory is displayed to whoever sees. 37 So as for the one who exceeded all 38 limits and preferred the Earlier Life, 39 then indeed, purgatory is the shelter. 40 But as for the one who feared standing before his Lord and forbade the self (its) whim, 41 then indeed, the Garden (of Paradise) is the shelter. 42 They ask yousg about the Hour: “When will it take place?” 43 What have yousg to do with mentioning it? 44 To yoursg Lord is its finality. 45 You are just a forewarner for whoever fears it. 46 On the day when they witness it, it will be as though they tarried (in the world) but the evening of one day or its morning.

80. He Frowned

80- ‘Abasa

1 He frowned and turned away 2 when the blind man approached him. 3 But what could make yousg realize that perhaps he was seeking to purify himself, 4 or to be reminded so that[1855] the reminder would benefit him? 5 But as for the one who thought himself self-sufficient, 6 yousg give him your attention, 7 though you are not liable if he never purifies himself. 8 Yet, as for the one who came to you rushing 9 with fear (of Allah), 10 to him you are inattentive. 11 But no, indeed this is a Reminder. 12 So whoever wills shall remember it. 13 (It is) in honorable Scrolls, 14 exalted and purified, 15 borne by the hands of scribes, 16 noble and devoted. 17 May man perish[1856]! What a denier he is! 18 From what did He create him? 19 From a sperm drop He created him and enabled him, 20 then He eased the way for him, 21 then He put him to death and buried him, 22 then, when He wills, He will resurrect him. 23 But no, he did not fulfill what He commanded him. 24 Let man look at his food: 25 that We[1857] poured down water in abundance, 26 then We made the land vigorously rupture 27 and germinated therein grains 28 and grapes and herbs, 29 and olives and dates, 30 and luscious orchards, 31 and fruit and fodder— 32 an enjoyment for you and for yourpl livestock. 33 But when the Deafening Noise comes to pass, 34 on a day when a person flees from his brother 35 and his mother and his father 36 and his female companion and his children— 37 every one of them on that day has enough to preoccupy him. 38 Some faces on that day are radiant, 39 laughing and glad. 40 And some faces on that day are covered with dust, 41 covered in darkness: 42 those are the deniers, the vicious.

81. The Rolling

81- At-Takwîr

1 When the sun is rolled up, 2 and when the stars are dimmed, 3 and when the mountains are set in motion, 4 and when pregnant camels are abandoned, 5 and when the beasts are herded, 6 and when the oceans are set aflame, 7 and when the souls are paired, 8 and when the baby girl that was buried alive is asked 9 for what misdeed she was killed[1858], 10 and when the scrolls are made public[1859], 11 and when the sky is peeled away, 12 and when purgatory is set fully ablaze[1860], 13 and when the Garden (of Paradise) is brought near— 14 each soul will know what it has brought forth. 15 So, no! I swear by those (stars) receding, 16 running, sweeping. 17 By the night as its darkness comes and goes. 18 By the morn as it breathes— 19 indeed, it is the word of a noble messenger[1861], 20 endowed with power, eminent with the Lord of the Throne, 21 obeyed there and trustworthy. 22 Thus yourpl fellow is not a madman, 23 for he most surely saw him on the evident horizon, 24 and he does not stingily withhold[1862] (knowledge of) the hidden realm, 25 and it is not the word of an outcast Satan. 26 So where are youpl going? 27 It is but a Reminder to (all creatures of) all realms, 28 to whomever of you who wills to be upright. 29 But youpl cannot will unless Allah, the Lord of all realms, wills.

82. The Splitting apart

82- Al-Infitâr

1 When the sky splits apart, 2 and when the planets are scattered, 3 and when the seas are made to burst, 4 and when the tombs are strewn around— 5 each self will know what it has put forth and what it has deferred. 6 O Man, what deceived you concerning your Noble Lord, 7 Who created you and formed you and proportioned[1863] you? 8 In whatever shape He willed, He assembled you. 9 But no, rather youpl disbelieve[1864] in the Recompense, 10 while indeed, over you are preservers— 11 honorable scribes— 12 who know whatever you do. 13 Indeed, the virtuous are in bliss, 14 while indeed, the wicked are in purgatory; 15 they will roast in it on the Day of Recompense, 16 and in no way will they be absent from it. 17 But what can make yousg realize what the Day of Recompense is? 18 Again, what can make yousg realize what the Day of Recompense is? 19 (They will be recompensed on) a day[1865] when no self is able to avail another self in anything, and the command on that day belongs to Allah.

83. The Defrauders

83- Al-Mutaffifîn

1 Woe to the defrauders: 2 those who, when they take a measure from people, take in full; 3 but when they measure or weigh to others, they give less than they should. 4 Do those not think that they will be resurrected 5 on a great day, 6 a day when mankind stands before the Lord of all realms? 7 But no, indeed the record[1866] of the wicked is in Sijjeen[1867]. 8 And what can make yousg realize what Sijjeen is? 9 A written recordd. 10 Woe on that day to the disbelievers 11 who disbelieve in the Day of Recompense, 12 for none disbelieves in it except every sinful transgressor 13 who, when Our signs[1868] are recited to him, says, “Legends of the ancients.” 14 But no, rather, encrusted over their hearts is what they used to earn. 15 But no, indeed on that day they are sure to be screened off from their Lord. 16 Then indeed, they are sure to roast in purgatory. 17 Then it will be said, “This is what you used to disbelieve in.” 18 But no, indeed the recordd of the virtuous is in Elliyyeen[1869]. 19 And what can make yousg realize what Elliyyoon[1870] is? 20 A written record[1871], 21 witnessed by those brought near. 22 Indeed, the virtuous are amid bliss, 23 on couches, looking on. 24 Yousg can recognize[1872] on their faces the radiance of bliss. 25 They are given to drink of a sealed nectar, 26 whose end[1873] is musk—and this is what competitors should compete for. 27 And its mixture is of Tasneem, 28 a spring from which those brought near drink. 29 Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who had attained faith; 30 and when they passed by them, they would wink at one another; 31 and when they went back to their families, they would go back jesting; 32 and when they saw them, they would say, “These people are most surely misguided.” 33 Yet they were not sent as preservers over them. 34 So today[1874] those who have attained faith are laughing at the deniers, 35 on couches, looking on. 36 Have the deniers been recompensed for what they used to do?

84. The Rupture

84- Al-Inshiqâq

1 When the sky is ruptured 2 and listens to its Lord as it rightly must, 3 and when the earth is leveled out 4 and casts out what is in it and becomes empty 5 and listens to its Lord as it rightly must— 6 O man, you are laboring towards your Lord laboriously, then you are bound to meet Him. 7 So as for the one who was brought his recordb in his right hand, 8 he will have an easy reckoning 9 and will return to his family joyful. 10 But as for the one who was brought his record behind his back, 11 he will call for demise 12 and will roast[1875] at the Blaze. 13 Indeed, he used to be joyful among his family; 14 indeed, he thought he would never return. 15 Yes, surely his Lord has always been All-Seeing of him. 16 So, No! I swear by the twilight. 17 By the night and what it covers. 18 By the moon as it grows full— 19 youpl will[1876] surely mount stage by stage. 20 So what is the matter with them that they do not believe? 21 And when the Recital[1877] is recited to them, they do not prostrate themselves? 22 Rather, the deniers disbelieve, 23 but Allah knows better what they hide inside. 24 So give them glad tidings[1878] of a painful punishment— 25 except for those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds; for them is an unfailing reward.

85. The Constellations

85- Al-Burûj

1 By the sky full of constellations. 2 By the Promised Day. 3 By the witness and the witnessed— 4 may they perish: the fellows of the Trench[1879] 5 (of) the fire fed with fuel! 6 Recall when they sat around it, 7 witnessing what they were doing to the believers. 8 And they resented them only for believing in Allah the Almighty, the Praiseworthy, 9 to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Yet Allah is Witness over everything. 10 Indeed, those who have persecuted the believing men and the believing women, then have not repented—for them is the punishment of Hell, and for them is the punishment of burning. 11 Indeed, those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—for them are Gardens beneath which rivers flow; that is the supreme triumph. 12 Indeed, the onslaught of yoursg Lord is surely severe. 13 Indeed, it is He who originates and reproduces, 14 and He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Loving, 15 Possessor of the Throne, the Glorious[1880], 16 Doer of whatever He wants. 17 Has there come to yousg the story of the troops— 18 (that of) Pharaoh and Thamûd[1881]? 19 Rather, the deniers are in (a state of) disbelief, 20 while beyond them Allah is All-Encompassing. 21 Rather, it is a Glorious Recitalb, 22 in a preserved[1882] Tablet.

86. The Pulsar

86- At-Târiq

1 By the sky and the pulsar. 2 But what can make yousg realize what the pulsar is? 3 The Drilling Star. 4 There is no self but has[1883] a preserver over it. 5 Let man look at what he was created from. 6 He was created from an ejected fluid, 7 coming out from between the backbone and the breastbones. 8 He is certainly able to return him 9 on the day when the secrets are put on trial, 10 then he will have neither strength nor helper. 11 By the sky that returns[1884]. 12 By the earth that cracks open— 13 it is most surely a decisive word[1885], 14 and it is no joke. 15 Indeed, they are plotting plots, 16 but I plot plots (as well). 17 So givesg the deniers respite; respite them briefly.

87. The Most High

87- Al-A‘lâ

1 Highly exalt the Name of yoursg Lord, the Most High, 2 Who created and proportioned; 3 and Who determined and guided; 4 and Who brought out the pasture, 5 then turned it into dark debris. 6 We shall make yousg recite such that you shall not forget— 7 except what Allah wills; indeed, He knows whatever is said aloud and whatever is hidden. 8 And We shall ease yousg towards ease. 9 So remindsg, if reminding can be of benefit. 10 The God-fearing will constantly remember, 11 but the wretched will avoid it— 12 he who will roast in the Gigantic Fire, 13 then he neither dies nor lives. 14 Surely, successful is the one who has purified himself 15 and remembered the name of his Lord and prayed. 16 Rather, youpl prefer[1886] the Earlier Life, 17 though the Hereafter is better and more lasting. 18 Most surely, this is in the former scrolls— 19 the Scrolls of Abraham and Moses.

88. The Overwhelming

88- Al-Ghâshiyah

1 Has there come to yousg the news of the Overwhelming (event)[1887]? 2 Some faces on that day are (subdued) in reverence, 3 toiling, exhausted, 4 roasting[1888] in a hot fire, 5 given to drink from a boiling spring. 6 They have no food except of a thorny bush 7 which neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger. 8 Some faces on that day are blissful, 9 well pleased with their endeavor, 10 in a lofty Garden: 11 in it you hear[1889] no nonsense; 12 in it is a flowing spring; 13 in it are raised couches, 14 and cups set in place, 15 and cushions set in rows, 16 and carpets spread around. 17 Do they not look at the camels—how they were created? 18 And at the sky—how it was raised? 19 And at the mountains—how they were firmly fixed? 20 And at the earth—how it was spread out? 21 So remind; yousg are only a reminder; 22 you have no control over them. 23 But whoever turns away and denies, 24 then Allah punishes him with the greatest punishment. 25 Indeed, to Us is their[1890] return, 26 then upon Us is their reckoning.

89. The Dawn

89- Al-Fajr

1 By the dawn. 2 By the ten nights. 3 By the even and the odd. 4 By the night as it passes— 5 is there in that a sworn oath for whoever has a mind[1891]? 6 Have yousg not seen what your Lord did to ʻĀd[1892]— 7 Iram, (the city) of the pillars 8 whose like has never been created in the lands; 9 and Thamûd[1893], who carved the rocks in the valley; 10 and Pharaoh of the stakes? 11 They (all) exceeded all limits in the lands 12 and spread much corruption therein, 13 so yoursg Lord poured down upon them a scourge of punishment; 14 indeed, your Lord is certainly ever-watchful. 15 So, as for man, whenever his Lord tries him through honoring and blessing him, he says, “My Lord has honored me.” 16 But whenever He tries him through restricting[1894] his provision, he says, “My Lord has insulted me.” 17 But no! Rather, youpl do not honor[1895] the orphan, 18 and you do not urge one another[1896] to (serve) food to the destitutesg, 19 and you devour inheritance (of the vulnerable) greedily, 20 and you love wealth immensely. 21 But no! When the earth is pounded to dust, pounding after pounding; 22 and yoursg Lord comes with the angels, rank after rank; 23 and on that day, Hell is made to come forward—on that day man reminds himself, but how will reminding avail him? 24 He says, “If only I had put forth something (good) for my life.” 25 On that day, none can punish as He punishes[1897], 26 and none can shackle as He shackles. 27 O you tranquil self, 28 return to your Lord, well pleased and well pleasing; 29 so enter among My servants, 30 and enter My Garden.

90. The City

90- Al-Balad

1 No! I swear by this city, 2 and yousg are free of restriction in this city. 3 By the begetter and what he has begotten— 4 We have certainly created man in distress. 5 Does he think that no one will be able to restrain him? 6 He says, “I have consumed stacks of[1898] wealth.” 7 Does he think that no one has seen him? 8 Have We not made for him two eyes 9 and a tongue and two lips, 10 and showed him the two courses[1899]? 11 But he did not brave the difficult route. 12 And what can make you realize what the difficult route is? 13 (It is) the freeing[1900] of a neck (from the yokes of slavery), 14 or the feeding—on a day of starvation—of 15 an orphaned relative 16 or a destitute person in the dust[1901], 17 then becoming of those who attained faith and enjoined upon one another patience and enjoined upon one another compassion— 18 those are the fellows of the rightness. 19 But those who denied Our revelations—those are the fellows of the ill-omened; 20 over them is a fire with no exit.

91. The Sun

91- Ash-Shams

1 By the sun and its morning shine, 2 and the moon as it follows her, 3 and the daytime as it reveals her, 4 and the night as it conceals her. 5 By the sky and He Who built it. 6 By the land and He Who spread it. 7 By the (inner) self and He Who formed it 8 then inspired it its own wickedness and its own mindfulness (of God)— 9 surely, successful is the one who has purified it, 10 and surely, failing is the one who has stunted it. 11 Exceeding all limits caused Thamûd[1902] to disbelieve, 12 when the most wicked man among them was delegated. 13 Then the messenger of Allah[1903] said to them, “This is the she-camel of Allah, so let her drink.” 14 So they disbelieved him and hamstrung her, so their Lord crushed them for their misdeed and leveled it[1904], 15 and[1905] He does[1906] not fear its ultimate outcome.

92. The Night

92- Al-Layl

1 By the night as it covers. 2 By the day as it reveals. 3 By the creation of the male and the female— 4 indeed, yourpl pursuits are diverse. 5 So as for the one who has given and has been mindful (of God) 6 and has believed in ultimate goodness— 7 We will ease his way towards ease. 8 But as for the one who has been stingy and complacent 9 and has disbelieved in ultimate goodness—  10 We will ease his way towards difficulty, 11 and his money will not avail him when he plummets. 12 Indeed, guidance is upon Us, 13 and indeed, unto Us belong the Last and the First (life). 14 So I have warned youpl of a fierce fire, 15 in which none roasts except the most wicked— 16 the one who disbelieved and turned away. 17 But the most mindfulsg (of God) will be kept away from it— 18 the one who brings[1907] his wealth to purify himself, 19 and not in return for any favor to anyone, 20 except for seeking the countenance of his Lord, the Most High. 21 And he will certainly be well pleased.

93. Morning Shine

93- Ad-Dhuhâ

1 By the morning shine. 2 By the night as it settles— 3 your Lord has not abandoned yousg, nor has He despised (you). 4 And indeed the Last is better for yousg than the First, 5 and your Lord will certainly give you so that you will be well pleased. 6 Did He not find yousg an orphan, so He sheltered (you); 7 and found you wandering, so He guided (you); 8 and found you in need, so He enriched (you)? 9 So as for the orphan, dosg not subdue; 10 and as for the asker, do not rebuke; 11 and as for the blessing of your Lord, do talk about it.

94. Expanding

94- Al-Sharh

1 Did We not expand yoursg chest, 2 and lift from you your burden 3 which weighed down your back, 4 and raised for you your remembrance[1908]? 5 So indeed, with hardship comes ease; 6 indeed, with hardship comes ease. 7 So whenever yousg are done (from work), stand up[1909], 8 and to your Lord turn wishfully.

95. The Fig

95- At-Tîn

1 By the fig and the olive. 2 By Mount Tûr of Sinai. 3 By this safe city[1910]— 4 surely, We created man in the best state, 5 then We returned him to the lowest of the low, 6 except those who attained faith and did righteous deeds, for for them is an unfailing reward. 7 So what makes yousg still deny the recompense? 8 Is Allah not the Wisest of judges?

96. The Clinging Form

96- Al-‘Alaq

1 Recite: In the name of yoursg Lord Who created— 2 created man from a clinging form. 3 Recite: And yoursg Lord is the Most Noble, 4 the One Who taught by the pen— 5 taught man what he never knew. 6 But no! Indeed, man surely exceeds all limits, 7 for he sees himself self-sufficient. 8 Indeed, to yoursg Lord is the ultimate return. 9 Have yousg seen the one who forbids 10 a servant when he prays? 11 Have yousg seen whether he was rightly guided 12 or commanded to mindfulness (of God)? 13 Have yousg seen whether he disbelieved and turned away? 14 Has he not realized that Allah sees? 15 But no! Surely, if he does not desist, We will drag (him) by the forelock— 16 a lying, wrongful forelock. 17 Let him call on his gang; 18 We will call the guards of Hell. 19 But no! Do not obey him, but prostrate yourself and draw near.

97. Determination

97- Al-Qadr

1 We sent it[1911] down on the Night of Determination. 2 But what can make yousg realize what the Night of Determination is? 3 The Night of Determination is better than a thousand months— 4 in it descend the angels, with the Spirit[1912] among them, by the leave of their Lord with every command. 5 Peace! It is until the rise[1913] of dawn.

98. Evident Proof

98- Al-Bayyinah

1 Those who have denied from among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted (from disbelief) until the evident proof came to them— 2 a messenger from Allah reading purified Scrolls; 3 in them are valuable scriptures. 4 Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided except after the evident proof came to them. 5 And they were only commanded to worship Allah—devoting religion to Him, turning away from all that is false—and to establish the prayer and to bring[1914] the purifying charity[1915], and that is the religion[1916] most upright. 6 Indeed, those who have denied among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists are in the fire of Hell, abiding therein; those are the worst of all beings. 7 Indeed, those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds—those are the best of all beings. 8 Their repayment with their Lord: Gardens of Eternity beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allah became well pleased with them and they became well pleased with Him. That is for whoever was in awe of his Lord.

99. The Quake

99- Al-Zalzalah

1 When the earth is made to quake with its earthquake, 2 and the earth brings out its heavy burdens, 3 and man says, “What is the matter with it?”— 4 On that day, it tells its tales, 5 because yoursg Lord has revealed to it. 6 On that day, mankind emerge in droves to be shown their deeds. 7 So whoever does an atom’s weight of good sees it, 8 and whoever does an atom’s weight of evil sees it.

100. The Racers

100- Al-‘Adiyât

1 By those[1917] that run panting, 2 then by those igniting sparks, 3 then by those raiding at dawn, 4 raising clouds of dust 5 and storming into the midst of the crowd— 6 indeed, man is certainly ungrateful to his Lord; 7 and indeed, he certainly bears witness to that; 8 and indeed, in his love for wealth he is certainly fierce. 9 Does he not know that when whatever lies within the graves is scattered around, 10 and when whatever lies within the hearts is obtained— 11 indeed, on that day, their Lord is most surely aware of them.

101. The Shocking Event

101- Al-Qâri‘ah

1 The Shocking Event! 2 What is the Shocking Event? 3 And what can make yousg realize what the Shocking Event is? 4 A day when mankind become like scattered moths, 5 and the mountains become like tufted wool. 6 So, as for the one whose scales were heavy[1918]— 7 he is in a pleasant life. 8 But as for the one whose scales were lightb— 9 his home[1919] is an Abyss. 10 And what can make yousg realize what it is? 11 A raging fire.

102. Vying for more

102- At-Takâthur

1 Vying for more distracted youpl 2 until you visited the graves. 3 But no! Youpl will come to know. 4 Once again: But no! Youpl will come to know. 5 But no! If only youpl knew with the knowledge of certitude: 6 you will certainly see[1920] purgatory. 7 Then youpl will certainly see it with the eye of certitude. 8 Then, on that day, youpl will certainly be asked about (worldly) bliss.

103. Time

103- Al-‘Asr

1 By Time— 2 man is most surely in a continuous state of loss, 3 except those who attained faith and did righteous deeds, and enjoined upon one another keeping to the truth, and enjoined upon one another patience.

104. The Backbiter

104- Al-Humazah

1 Woe to every slandering backbiter, 2 who hoarded[1921] wealth and counted it over, 3 thinking that his wealth has made him immortal. 4 But no! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher. 5 And what can make you realize what the Crusher is? 6 Allah’s kindled Fire 7 that mounts over burning hearts. 8 Indeed, it is over them with no exit, 9 in extended columns.

105. The Elephant

105- Al-Fîl

1 Have yousg not seen how your Lord dealt with the fellows of the Elephant? 2 Did He not make their plot go into great error? 3 And He sent against them swarms of birds, 4 throwing at them rocks of baked clay— 5 thus He made them like eaten leaves

106. Quraysh

106- Quraysh

1 for the lasting security of Quraysh[1922]— 2 their lasting security during winter and summer journeys— 3 so let them worship the Lord of this House, 4 who has fed them to ward off hunger and has secured them to ward off fear.

107. Kindnesses

107- Al-Mâ‘ûn

1 Have yousg seen the one who denies the Recompense[1923]? 2 It is the one who mistreats the orphan 3 and does not urge (others to serve) food to the destitutesg. 4 So woe to the ones who pray— 5 those who are heedless of their prayers, 6 those who make show (of their deeds) 7 yet withhold (little) kindnesses[1924].

108. Plenty

108- Al-Kawthar

1 Indeed, We have given yousg plenty[1925]. 2 So pray to yoursg Lord and sacrifice. 3 Indeed, it is the one who hates yousg who has been cut off. 

109. The Deniers

109- Al-Kâfirûn

1 Saysg, “O deniers, 2 I do not worship what youpl worship, 3 nor do you worship what I worship, 4 nor shall I ever worship what you worship, 5 nor shall you ever worship what I worship— 6 you have your religion, and I have my religion[1926].”

110. Support

110- An-Nasr

1 When there comes Allah’s support and the conquest, 2 and yousg see mankind entering Allah’s religion in crowds, 3 then highly exalt your Lord with praise and seek His forgiveness; indeed, He has always been Granting and Accepting of repentance.

111. Palm Fiber

111- Al-Masad

1 May the hands of Abi Lahab[1927] be ruined, and may he be ruined! 2 His wealth did[1928] not avail him, nor did what he earned. 3 He will roast in a flaming fire, 4 while his wife[1929], that firewood carrier[1930]— 5 around her neck is a rope of palm fiber.

112. Purity

112- Al-Ikhlâs

1 Saysg, “He is Allah, the Uniquely One. 2 Allah, the Indivisible. 3 He begot no one nor was He begotten, 4 and never has there been to Him anyone equivalent.”

113. Daybreak

113- Al-Falaq

1 Saysg, “I seek refuge with the Lord of daybreak 2 from the evil of whatever He created, 3 and from the evil of a dusky night when it darkens, 4 and from the evil of sorceresses who blow upon knots, 5 and from the evil of an envier when he envies.”

114. Mankind

114- An-Nâs

1 Saysg, “I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind, 2 the King of mankind, 3 the God of mankind, 4 from the evil of the sneaky whisperer 5 who whispers into the chests of mankind— 6 (from the whisperers) among the race of unseen beings[1931] and mankind.”

[1]Q   All except for ʻAsem, Al-Kesa’i, Yaʻqub and Khalaf in one of his narrations read it as: “King of the Day of Recompense.”

[2]  This portion can be read differently in Arabic by pausing after ‘doubt’, and in this case it means: ‘That is the Scripture, no doubt. In it there is guidance for the mindful (of God).’

[3]  Mentioned in plural form in Arabic, denoted by (s) in English for grammatical reasons.

[4]Q   Nafieʻ, Ibn Kathir and Abu ʻAmr read it as: “. . . yet they try to deceive none but . . .”

[5]Q   Nafieʻ, Ibn Kathir, Abu ʻAmr, Ibn ʻAmer, Abu Jaʻfar and Yaʻqub read it as: “. . . they used to disbelieve.”

[6]  A grammatical shift from singular to plural.

[7]  Mentioned in plural form in Arabic, denoted by (es) in English for grammatical reasons.

[8]  Each portion of the Qur’an is called a ‘surah’, which is sometimes translated as ‘chapter’.

[9]  Literally ‘protect yourselves against the Fire’.

[10]Q   Yaʻqub read it as: “. . . to Him you return?”

[11]  A grammatical shift from singular to plural.

[12]  Iblis is another name of Satan or Shaytan.

[13]Q   Hamza read it as: “Yet Satan removed them therefrom . . .”

[14]Q   Ibn Kathir read it as: “Thereupon Adam was received by words from His Lord.”

[15]Q   Yaʻqub read it as: “. . . then no fear shall ever be upon them nor shall they grieve.”
